jobDescription: At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Role: This is a technical role with the mission to become a trusted technical resource that our partners rely on to define the software ecosystem needed to realize their requirements. Support sales and automotive business development in customer meetings: define and qualify potential opportunities; understand the customer’s software architecture and requirements and map them to system hardware; and help create a technical consulting proposal for the software defined vehicle. Present current Synopsys solutions as well as adapt, conceptualize, and deliver new products. Participate, drive, and shape technical aspects in standardization groups (e.g., SOAFEE and ECLIPSE FOUNDATION). What you bring Ideally you have expertise in automotive E/E system level architecture with experience in service-oriented architecture (SOA)/cloud-native environment, embedded solutions, and modern development practices (CI/CD) from user applications to middleware to OS/RTOS to firmware/BIOS for different processor architectures. Expert-level understanding of the modern software environment with experience in automotive domains such as ADAS/AD, cockpit/IVI, powertrain, and body motion control, virtualization/hypervisor technologies for domain separation and safety processing, and meeting safety and cybersecurity requirements. Background and experience in hardware-in-the-loop (HiL), virtual hardware-in-the-loop (vHiL) and software-in-the-loop (SiL) testing. You have a firm grasp of the importance of software for these applications and hardware-software tradeoffs. You should understand how software is implemented and landed on compute platforms. Previous hands on coding/scripting experience (such as C/C++ and Python) would also be a benefit. Great presentational skills, and the ability to work across geographies and cultures are essential. BSEE or MSEE or higher is required, with typically 10 or more years industry experience in SW design and architecture. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Job Description and Requirements : The Technical Marketing Manager, Logic Libraries will be the key technical interface between customers, Field Application Engineers and R&D for the logic library product line. The candidate will work closely with the Logic Library Product Marketing Manager (PMM) and the field organization, key customers and strategic partners to identify and drive business opportunities. Responsibilities include: Translate customer requirements into marketing requirements documents (MRD) and Product Review Documents (PRD) Definition of new products that will result in sustainable growth within the product line Comparative study of product line with respect to competition and customer requirements FAE communication and training Communicating technical benefits of product line to customers and understanding customer needs Promotion of product lines through articles, white papers, application notes and seminars Qualifications: Energetic, results-based individual Deep understanding of all phases of logic library product lifecycle - specification, development, validation, and use in SoC design flows Strong knowledge of the interplay between logic libraries and the Synopsys design flow as applicable to hardening CPUs, GPUs, DSPs, and SoCs FAE or SoC design experience Proven ability to develop and manage technical relationships with architects and design engineers at key customers and strategic partners Exceptional organizational and program management skills Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment Excellent oral and written communication skills in English Education and Experience: BS EE with 5+ years relevant experience, or MS EE (preferred) with 3+ years relevant experience This position can be located at any of these office locations: Mountain View, CA Portland, OR or Masachusetts 1Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. #LI-Hybrid #LI-FS3

Senior Analog/Mixed-Signal Layout Engineer As a Senior A&MS Layout Engineer you will collaborate in the development of advanced analog integrated circuit designs using best-in-class Synopsys suite of tools. You will be working with local and global teams in developing layout for complex mixed-signal designs in the latest technology nodes. In your role you will be responsible for taking on top-level block ownership with technical expertise and skills. There will also be opportunities to act as analog layout technical lead where you will be coordinating with other team members in designing and reviewing layout designs. As a member of our Solutions IP Design Group you will be developing IP in various technology nodes and foundries for different customers in a fast paced and exciting design environment. Requirements In depth familiarity with layout of analog and mixed signal CMOS circuits Experience in development of high-speed analog layout in advanced finFET technology nodes Experience in the following layout design techniques: Optimization for signal integrity (ie. clock/data routes, differential routing, shielding) Implementation of ESD design constraints, latch-up risk mitigation Familiarity with custom digital layout (logic cell layout and associated logic path routing) Layout design for reliability (ie. EM, IR, etc…) Design to optimize for parasitic layout effects (ie. matching, reliability, proximity effects, etc…) Familiarity in design for porting techniques Full custom analog layout design tool: Custom Compiler (or equivalent) Verification tools: ICV, Star-RCXT, PERC (or equivalent) Intimate knowledge of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer or below. A solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of IC design, implementation flows and methodologies for deep submicron design. Experience in working with Jira/Atlassian (or other such) tools Strong working knowledge of MS Office Suite of applications Exposure to scripting (ie. TCL, PERL, etc…) Strong technical English communication skills Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Aerospace and Defense Account Manager, Sr. - 41445BR
jobDescription: We are seeking a sales professional to enhance relationships and grow business with important customers on the East Coast with a focus on Aerospace & Defense in the Washington, DC area. This strategic thinker and action-oriented person will leverage their relationships, industry knowledge, and understanding of Systems and SoC design to proliferate and expand Synopsys Solutions to achieve revenue and booking goals in the Aerospace & Defense segment. Emphasis will be placed on the ability to act as a leader capable of marshaling resources in Synopsys Business Units (R&D, Marketing and Field Support) and Sales Specialists and aligning them with technical and business executives at their key customer sites across the country. Activities include account planning, forecasting, lead generation, prospecting, qualifying and delivery of sales presentations and proposals to new or existing customers within the territory. Respond to information requests and inquiries from executives and global team members. Job Responsibilities And Activities Create opportunities to build a pipeline by understanding the needs of key customers, program sponsors and broader Government communities. Work in a team environment and build relationships at executive, senior technical management and key contributor levels. Create, drive and close multi-million-dollar, complex, technical sales campaigns. Leverage relationships with one or more large aerospace and defense companies, government program sponsors in defense, intelligence community and research community. Act as a leader capable of marshaling resources across Synopsys Business Units (R&D, Marketing and Field Support), a global Sales team, Services, Finance and Legal and aligning them with the technical and business needs of the customer. Coordinate the preparation of written proposals and work with internal organizations such as business units, legal, finance, and order processing for the purpose of closing business. Responsible for developing complex technical sales plans, which may involve competitive displacements or imaginative business agreements to meet or exceed pre-established quotas. Qualifications B.S. in Engineering or related field required (M.S. / M.B.A. or other advanced technical or business management degrees desired) Minimum 10 years of sales and/or business development experience in technical software and engineering services. Experience working with one or more leading Aerospace & Defense companies such as BAE Systems, Boeing Company, CAES, Honeywell Aerospace, Lockheed Martin Corp., Northrop Grumman Corp. and Raytheon Technologies. Ideal candidate will be located in the greater Washington, DC area; qualified candidates on the East Coast of U.S. will be considered as well. Ability to travel up to 20% of the time across North America At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Our design team in Boxborough MA is looking for an analog/mixed-signal design engineer to help with the development of high-bandwidth memory interfaces. Responsibilities Designs, develops and supports analog and mixed signal components for advanced physical memory interfaces. Collaborates with a diverse international team to determine the best approaches to solving related technical challenges. Works closely with our customers to enable their success. Requirements BS/MS/PhD in Electrical Engineering or a related field. 2+ years of experience in analog, mixed signal, memory or custom logic circuit design Solid understanding of CMOS design knowledge and techniques. Familiarity with HSPICE or other simulators Good technical communication skills Good teamwork, willingness to work and support others Opportunities SNPS is the world number one IP provider. Work with many experts from around the world. Chance to work with new technologies like: 2.5D/3D IC, Tbps interfaces, AI/ML, 5G applications Professional, innovative, fair and flexible working environment. Job Description & Requirements At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Solution IP group in Boxborough, Massachusetts is ramping up high-performance computing (HPC) demand, therefore we are looking for an enthusiastic engineer to join our Analog & Mixed-Signal Circuit Design & Methodology team. You will be working with an immensely creative cross functional team of analog and mixed signal circuit designers from a wide variety of backgrounds on design and methodology. This position requires hands on experience and working knowledge of mixed signal circuit design best practices, an understanding of silicon IP release requirements, solid scripting skills to automate flows and the ability to drive and train engineers to become experts with new methodologies. Job Responsibilities Review SerDes standards and architecture documents to develop analog sub-block specifications. Identify and refine circuit implementations to achieve optimal power, area and performance targets. Propose design and verification strategies that efficiently use simulator features to ensure highest quality design. Oversee physical layout to minimize the effect of parasitic, device stress, and process variation. Collaborate with digital RTL engineers on the development of calibration, adaptation and control algorithms for analog circuits. Present simulation data for peer and customer review. Mentor and Review the progress of junior engineers. Document design features and test plans. Consult on the electrical characterization of your circuit within the SerDes IP product. Required Qualifications Bachelor with in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar technical field In-depth familiarity with transistor level circuit design - sound CMOS design fundamentals. Silicon-proven experience implementing circuits for the TX, RX and Clock paths within a SerDes Detailed design experience with several of the following SerDes sub-circuits: receive equalizers, data samplers, voltage/current-mode drivers, serializers, deserializers, voltage-controlled oscillator, phase interpolator, delay-locked loop, phase-locked loop, bandgap reference, ADC, DAC Experience optimizing FinFET CMOS layout to minimize the effect of parasitic resistance and capacitance, and to reduce the effects of local device mismatch and proximity effects. Awareness of ESD issues (i.e. circuit techniques, layout). and design for reliability (i.e. electro-migration, IR, aging, etc.). Experience with EDA tools for schematic entry, physical layout, and design verification. High proficiency with spice simulators including HSPICE, Finesim and XA Knowledgeable in Verilog-A and/or System-Verilog for analog behavioral modeling and simulation-control/data-capture. Plus Qualifications Ability to provide automation for rapid and dynamic design needs is highly sought-after Experience with STA and cell characterization such as Nanotime, Primetime, SiliconSmart Experienced in STAR or similar extractor to debug extraction issues Extensive programming skills in languages such as Python, Perl, TCL and C/C++Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

You will be working with an immensely creative cross functional team of analog and mixed signal circuit designers from a wide variety of backgrounds on design and methodology. This position requires hands on experience and working knowledge of mixed signal circuit design principles, an understanding of silicon IP release requirements, strong scripting skills to automate flows and the ability to lead and train engineers to become experts with new methodologies. Required Qualifications Bachelor with 5 years' experience or MSEE (or PhD) with 2-4 years' experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar technical field Deep & extensive programming skills in languages such as Python, Perl, TCL and C/C++ required Ability to provide automation for rapid and dynamic design needs is highly sought-after Basic exposure with Analog & Mixed-Signal design flows especially with Synopsys Custom Compiler suites Proficiency with spice simulators including HSPICE, Finesim/Primesim and XA Understanding of behavioral Verilog models & experience in SystemVerilog for AMS circuits Plus Design experience in high speed interface PHY such as SERDES, DDR, HBM Experience with STA and cell characterization such as Nanotime, Primetime, SiliconSmart Experienced in STAR or similar extractor to debug extraction issues Experienced in physical verification to debug LVS issues at block and top level. Candidate with Machine Learning paradigms/techniques understandings with knowledge of applying it in modeling, circuit design flow & simulations is desirable Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability

Emulation has become indispensable part of SoC designs verification with growing design size and complexity. Synopsys is uniquely positioned to offer the most complete verification and emulation solution in the market today. The job responsibilities involve analysis of customer’s current verification methodology, deployment of Emulation solutions involved in-circuit and transaction level acceleration methodologies. This position requires one to lead and drive the technical Synopsys ZeBu emulation environment benchmarks. This is complete technical solutions deployment engineering position targeted for emerging emulation customers as well as established customers. The Emulation application engineer is responsible for product demonstrations, evaluations, competitive benchmarking, and customer success. He/She plays an active role in account planning jointly with engineers deploying verification tools and works as part of the account team to develop solutions to customer problems based on their insight into the customers' needs and issues. By delivering customer success for ongoing projects though deep technical influence and close interaction with customers/R&D, you will be able to demonstrate the differentiated emulation environment. Requirements Expert level engineers who have proficiency in SoC design methodologies and technologies, who have demonstrated experience in the complete design validation cycle, driven to help customers achieve their emulation verification goals. Great communication skills and proven ability to help our customers and our organization be successful. Strong trouble shooting and problem-solving skills required. Deep knowledge of RTL synthesis, mapping RTL to Xilinx FPGA based platform, scripting language, Unix/Linux development environment. Proficiency in HVL languages like C/C++/System C and System Verilog is desired. Knowledge of key protocol’s like PCIe, USB, Ethernet, AMBA, UART, SATA/SAS, DDR, flash memories and their usage in SoC environments is plus. Direct experience in SoC design porting on emulators, creating emulation friendly testbench environment and emulating SoC environment w/ debug is highly preferred. Minimum 3-5 Years of relevant experience required. Excellent customer interface, negotiation, communication and planning skills At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Provides technical and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability and adoption of products, platforms and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploys and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and analyzes feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement technical roadmap, specifications and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partners with customer technical leaders and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Leveling Differentiators Complexity and type of products/platform supported Balance of technical and customer relationship management capability Scope of responsibility and net impact of the role to the business

Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 (6 years in a row) in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Technical Support Engineer II Our products involve highly sophisticated, cutting-edge software algorithms to detect critical defects and security vulnerabilities in source code. Therefore, our technical support issues can be highly complex --- solving them requires intelligence, insight, and true technical expertise. Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain. All while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. Location and Work Schedule: Burlington, MA, Hybrid Schedule with at least 2 days in office per week. Responsibilities The Technical Support Engineer will be responsible for resolving customer problems. In this role, you will work closely with R&D and technical support staff to provide high-quality support to our customers. Tasks Essential To This Position Include You will be the Single Point of Contact for many of our strategic customers. You will be the customers trusted advisor and advocate. You will understand the customer’s environment and business goals and work closely with the account team when needed. Troubleshoot incoming customer problems through email and/or phone Work with support team and developers to provide resolution to customer issues Research and respond to customer requests. Provide detailed explanations to address questions and concerns from some of the world’s brightest developers and software architects Create knowledge items for recurring issuesMinimum Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or similar field Prior customer support experience in IT or Software Some experience troubleshooting complex application/software products Previous experience prioritizing multiple critical client support issues Must be able to work off-hour or on-call shifts on as-needed basis (occasional)Desired Skills (Nice to Have): Knowledge/experience with Linux concepts and CLI Knowledge/experience with Docker Container Based Applications Knowledge/experience with Web Application Servers Knowledge/experience with Open Source Software Knowledge/experience with Data Bases (ex. SQL) Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

HAPS is Synopsys' industry-leading FPGA-based prototyping system, providing state-of-the-art hardware and cutting-edge software to deliver the best-in-class integrated prototyping solution. See more details at: https://www.synopsys.com/verification/prototyping/haps.html Job Description The primary focus of the Applications Engineer (AE) is to support the usage and deployment of Synopsys HAPS Prototyping hardware Products. As a HAPS AE, you will help customers deploy HAPS HW platforms and will occasionally participate in pre-sales activity, including technical presentations. You will also work closely with the R&D to find solutions for technical issues seen in the field and will recommend and drive improvements in product capabilities and quality. You will be part of a team of expert engineers, among the most knowledgeable in the world with FPGAs. Requirements Strong communication skills are required. You should be proficient with HDL (Verilog/VHDL), Linux and have a strong FPGA background including experience with FPGA implementation. Experience using common lab equipment, such as oscilloscopes and logic analyzers is a plus. Knowledge of ASIC prototyping and emulation techniques and technologies is beneficial. Understanding of FPGA technologies like Xilinx or Altera will be a significant plus and knowledge of scripting/programming skills (TCL/Python, C/C++) is strongly preferred. Education & Experience Master’s Degree in Engineering. This person should independently resolve a wide range of issues in creative ways on a regular basis and customarily exercise independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. This person determines and develops approaches to solutions and can work both independently and collaboratively. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Description And Requirements At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. We’re looking for an RTL2GDS Full flow Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products. Provides technical and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability, and adoption of products, platforms, and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots, and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploy and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and understands feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement the technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partners with customer technical managers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications RTL to GDSII full flow knowledge is preferable. In depth knowledge of device physics. Strong interest in Advanced Node & Design methodologies. Must possess collaborative teamwork experience and the aptitude and motivation to work with other internal and customer groups. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Good scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python); knowledge of CAD automation methods. Preferred Experience BSEE or equivalent degree with VLSI related courses. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you! Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. We’re looking for a place and route applications engineer to join the team. In This Role You Will Help to promote and support Synopsys place and route tools on advanced technology node leading edge customer projects. Develop chip design flows to support the sale and adoption of Synopsys’ software, testing new product features and partnering with R&D on the development and promotion of new product enhancements. Provide opportunities for complex debug and resolution of advanced issues related to chip design across the areas of placement, optimization, clock tree synthesis, and routing. Build fundamental knowledge in the chip design space from RTL creation and simulation to final timing signoff and design tape out. Key Qualifications Users should have a background in electrical and/or computer system engineering as well as knowledge of chip design in the areas of design planning, placement, clock tree synthesis, and routing. 10+ years of direct chip design experience at more recent advanced technology nodes such as 7nm or below. Additional experience outside the Place and Route space such as RTL Synthesis, Formal Verification, RC Extraction, or Static Timing is welcome. Soft skills in presentation, communication, and customer relationship are important for this role. Strong scripting skills. Strong desire to grow technical knowledge Action oriented. Self-starter. Should be able to multi-task efficiently while working remotely. Preferred Experience BSEE/MSEE or equivalent with 5+ years of chip design experience Synopsys placement, clock tree, and route experience Knowledge of EDA design timing and DRC closure through signoff for tapeout Generate and present technical presentations Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We’re looking for an RTL2GDS Full flow Engineer who could lead Benchmark, evaluations to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products. Provides technical leadership and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability, and adoption of products, platforms, and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots, and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploy and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and understands feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement the technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Must possess collaborative teamwork experience and the aptitude and motivation to work with other internal and customer groups. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Hands-on experience in all aspects of synthesis, physical design static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS and power analysis. Knowledge of ASIC implementation domains outside of RTL2GDS including RTL coding, Verification, formal checking is a plus. Job Description And Requirements At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. We’re looking for an RTL2GDS Full flow Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products. Provides technical and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability, and adoption of products, platforms, and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots, and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploy and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and understands feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement the technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partners with customer technical managers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications RTL to GDSII full flow experience or knowledge is preferable. Strong interest and understanding of Advanced Node & Design methodologies. Must possess collaborative teamwork experience and the aptitude and motivation to work with other internal and customer groups. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Hands-on experience in all aspects of synthesis, physical design, STA, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS, and power analysis. Knowledge of ASIC implementation domains outside of RTL2GDS including RTL coding, Verification, formal checking is a plus. Good scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python); knowledge of CAD automation methods. Preferred Experience BSEE or equivalent, required with 2+ years of Synthesis, Place & Route experience, or MSEE, or equivalent with 1+ years of Synthesis Place & Route experience. Tool knowledge expected: Front end Synthesis tools & Back-end P&R tools (Design Compiler, ICC2, Fusion Compiler, Genus, Innovus) Tool knowledge (preferred): STA (Primetime, Tempus), IR drop (Redhawk, Voltus), Extraction (Star-RCXT, Quantus), Formal verification (Formality, Conformal) Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Emulation has become indispensable part of SoC designs verification with growing design size and complexity. Synopsys is uniquely positioned to offer the most complete verification and emulation solution in the market today. The job responsibilities involve analysis of customer’s current verification methodology, deployment of Emulation solutions involved in-circuit and transaction level acceleration methodologies. This position requires one to lead and drive the technical Synopsys ZeBu emulation environment benchmarks. This is complete technical solutions deployment engineering position targeted for emerging emulation customers as well as established customers. The Emulation application engineer is responsible for product demonstrations, evaluations, competitive benchmarking, and customer success. He/She plays an active role in account planning jointly with engineers deploying verification tools and works as part of the account team to develop solutions to customer problems based on their insight into the customers' needs and issues. By delivering customer success for ongoing projects though deep technical influence and close interaction with customers/R&D, you will be able to demonstrate the differentiated emulation environment. Requirements Expert level engineers who have proficiency in SoC design methodologies and technologies, who have demonstrated experience in the complete design validation cycle, driven to help customers achieve their emulation verification goals. Great communication skills and proven ability to help our customers and our organization be successful. Strong trouble shooting and problem-solving skills required. Deep knowledge of RTL synthesis, mapping RTL to Xilinx FPGA based platform, scripting language, Unix/Linux development environment. Proficiency in HVL languages like C/C++/System C and System Verilog is desired. Knowledge of key protocol’s like PCIe, USB, Ethernet, AMBA, UART, SATA/SAS, DDR, flash memories and their usage in SoC environments is plus. Direct experience in SoC design porting on emulators, creating emulation friendly testbench environment and emulating SoC environment w/ debug is highly preferred. Minimum 3-5 Years of relevant experience required. You will work in a collaborative environment, interfacing with customers, software development, sales, and product teams. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Customer Success – Optical Engineer - Imaging Synopsys Optical Solutions is looking for an optical engineer to work in the Customer Success group to provide technical support, training, and other technical content to customers. This position will emphasize supporting customers in North America using the industry leading imaging design and analysis software CODE V. The Applicant Should Have skills in the use of advanced optical design tools (CODE V preferred) Have a passion for helping engineers with diverse experience to solve their most challenging engineering problems Have a passion for communicating technical information in a variety of formats Be able to understand optical engineering issues associated with new and advancing technology applications and communicate complex problems quickly and accurately Enjoy interfacing with staff in software development, optical design engineering, sales, marketing, documentation, and development managers in a collaborative environment The primary responsibilities of the position include: Support Optical Solutions customers with a variety of technical issues over email, web meeting, and face-to-face Develop technical materials in various formats, including training sessions, webinars, user group meetings, customer meetings, written articles, and video The applicant should have the following qualifications: A proven track record of working with imaging systems modeling, analysis or design using commercial imaging design tools Excellent written, presentation, and verbal skills with the ability to communicate and teach technical information to others concisely and effectively A Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in any of the following disciplines: Optics, Optical Sciences, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and organizational skills Experience in advanced optical design tools with the ability to understand and use CODE V with mastery Experience in illumination tools, stray light tools, and photonics tools is a plus Ability to work on concurrent projects Ability to work in a team and autonomously Willingness for domestic and occasional international travel to support and train customers Synopsys OSG is a world-class, high-tech optical software and optical engineering services organization with an international client base and 15 offices worldwide. Primary North American offices are in Pasadena, California, Marlborough, Massachusetts. Remote offices can be considered. About Synopsys At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. This position will emphasize supporting customers in North America using the industry leading imaging design and analysis software CODE V. The Applicant Should Have skills in the use of advanced optical design tools (CODE V preferred) Have a passion for helping engineers with diverse experience to solve their most challenging engineering problems Have a passion for communicating technical information in a variety of formats Be able to understand optical engineering issues associated with new and advancing technology applications and communicate complex problems quickly and accurately Enjoy interfacing with staff in software development, optical design engineering, sales, marketing, documentation, and development managers in a collaborative environment The primary responsibilities of the position include: Support Optical Solutions customers with a variety of technical issues over email, web meeting, and face-to-face Develop technical materials in various formats, including training sessions, webinars, user group meetings, customer meetings, written articles, and video The applicant should have the following qualifications: A proven track record of working with imaging systems modeling, analysis or design using commercial imaging design tools Excellent written, presentation, and verbal skills with the ability to communicate and teach technical information to others concisely and effectively A Bachelors, Masters, or Ph.D. in any of the following disciplines: Optics, Optical Sciences, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics Excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and organizational skills Experience in advanced optical design tools with the ability to understand and use CODE V with mastery Experience in illumination tools, stray light tools, and photonics tools is a plus Ability to work on concurrent projects Ability to work in a team and autonomously Willingness for domestic and occasional international travel to support and train customers Synopsys OSG is a world-class, high-tech optical software and optical engineering services organization with an international client base and 15 offices worldwide. Primary North American offices are in Pasadena, California, Marlborough, Massachusetts. Remote offices can be considered. About Synopsys At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. jobTitle: Applications Engineer, Sr Staff - Custom Design PAE - 40199BR
jobDescription: As a Product Applications Engineer (PAE) for the Synopsys Custom Design and Reliability products, you will work independently and collaboratively with other team members to enable customer flows and successfully develop and deploy Custom Design solutions for key customers, address customer issues, provide training & methodology support and drive tool adoption. You will also define and drive the product direction by identifying designer needs and specifying tool capabilities for the next generation designs. Provides post-sales technical expertise during the installation, implementation, and maintenance of company products. Involved in defining detailed customer requirements, and implementing prototypes for them. Ensures that client’s needs have been met and that the product/solution is fully functioning according to specification. May provide pre-sales support to company sales staff and customer personnel. BSEE/MSEE with 15 years of experience in Custom IC core applications such as circuit design, simulation, layout. Scripting skills (TCL, Perl, Python) required along with multi-year experience in creating customized functionality in the custom design environment. Deep knowledge of schematic and layout tools with industry standard EDA tools and methods for the design, implementation, and verification of Custom IC and Analog mixed-signal chips, in particular for reliability analysis tasks (EMIR, physical verification, parasitic debug, etc.). Knowledge of the complete custom/mixed-signal design process and devices, understanding and experience with Open Access (OA), Custom & Analog layout design is required. Solid understanding of the digital implementation flow is desired. Good communication skills and the ability to interface with customers are essential. Management experience is required to lead teams to success. Have wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company goals to independently resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Understands customer wants and needs. Customarily exercises independent judgment and interpretation in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results. Frequently performs in project leadership role. Drives programs and business initiatives. Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and projects. Offers new solutions or direction and is able to encourage and motivate others to support new solution or direction. May advise senior management on specialized technical or business issues. May coordinate activities, may represent the organization as contact on business unit and/or company-wide projects. Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise. The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

As a Senior Applications Engineer, you will be working with our foundry team deploying new technology nodes for leading-edge customers. Your role will be critical as each technology node introduces new, complex layout design rules and other process nuances that impact the entire physical design implementation flow. You will work closely with a customer on understanding their node migration challenges, co-develop support with foundry and R&D, and test and improve end-to-end flows and algorithms to meet power/perf/area/runtime targets for the customer’s specific designs. You will be expected to analyze, debug and solve in-depth technical issues related to technology files, implementation methodologies, and flows. Requirements BS in EE/CS with 10+ years of relevant experience, MS with 7+ years of experience in developing and supporting advanced design implementation methodologies. Experienced physical designer with several years of EDA product development/deployment, full-flow benchmarking, and design tape-out experience. Hands-on familiarity with Synopsys and/or 3rd party tools including RTL/Physical Synthesis, Place & Route, and signoff products. Solid scripting skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to clearly narrow down and summarize findings. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas persuasively to cross-functional team members, management, and customers. Ability to multitask and partner across functional and global team environments. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. As a Senior Applications Engineer, you will be working with our foundry team deploying new technology nodes for leading-edge customers. Your role will be critical as each technology node introduces new, complex layout design rules and other process nuances that impact the entire physical design implementation flow. You will work closely with a customer on understanding their node migration challenges, co-develop support with foundry and R&D, and test and improve end-to-end flows and algorithms to meet power/perf/area/runtime targets for the customer’s specific designs. You will be expected to analyze, debug and solve in-depth technical issues related to technology files, implementation methodologies, and flows. Requirements BS in EE/CS with 10+ years of relevant experience, MS with 7+ years of experience in developing and supporting advanced design implementation methodologies. Experienced physical designer with several years of EDA product development/deployment, full-flow benchmarking, and design tape-out experience. Hands-on familiarity with Synopsys and/or 3rd party tools including RTL/Physical Synthesis, Place & Route, and signoff products. Solid scripting skills. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to clearly narrow down and summarize findings. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate complex ideas persuasively to cross-functional team members, management, and customers. Ability to multitask and partner across functional and global team environments. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. We are looking for an exceptional engineer with a background in Optical Proximity Correction (OPC) to work in partnership with customer teams to develop and deploy lithography simulation, pattern correction, and validation techniques for existing and advanced node technologies. Our customers are developing lead edge pattern techniques that include OPC, advanced RET (Reticle Enhancement Tech.), EUV, Inverse Lithography (ILT), Multi-Patterning, and Source Mask Optimization (SMO). Lithography, photomask, modeling, Python scripting, and machine learning experience are beneficial in the role. You will be working with the world’s top engineering teams to enable leading edge semiconductor technology. Responsibilities Assisting customers development of software prototypes to resolve advanced mask challenges Developing, deploying advanced calibration techniques for DUV, EUV lithography support Support debugging of customer issues and creation/testing of work arounds for production. Assist feature design, OPC advanced model creation and lithography simulations. Support Proteus lithography proximity correction and resolution enhancement tools Requirements M.S. or Ph.D. in Engineering, Physics, or Computer Science 3+ years of experiences in semiconductor industry 3+ years Tcl, Python scripting 3+ years Unix/Linux environment Desired Skills And Knowledge Optical Proximity Correction (OPC) and Source Mask Optimization (SMO) Python scripting, Unix Environment familiarity Photolithography theory, including optics, diffraction, phase shifting and resist modeling ILT (Inverse Lithography Technology) Design Rule Check (DRC) / Physical Verification Semiconductor Manufacturing processes The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors, all to help customers integrate more capabilities, meet unique performance, power, & area requirements of their target applications, and get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. Applications Engineer, Staff This critical position requires a highly motivated and experienced individual to oversee and drive customer success throughout the journey from integrating Synopsys leading-edge Interface IP, bringing-up silicon, and into production. This individual will be working across functional and Interface IP product teams, reporting to Executive management. Interface IP products include PCIe5/6, USB3.x/4, LP/DDR5/4/X, HBM3, Ethernet 100-800G, MIPI CDPHY /MPHY , HDMI 2.x , 224G SerDes , etc. The position offers opportunities to work with the latest Synopsys Interface IP, design/verification tools, and the latest industry applications on various hot market segments. Responsibilities Proactively drive customer success on key SoC projects Manage and coordinate value-added customer service activities Coordinate cross-functionally on critical customer communications Drive important initiatives, plan, track progress and provide Executive reporting Drive product and support process improvements from customer feedback Analyze and improve work processes between AE and other functional teams Key Qualifications BSEE required, MSEE preferred 8+ years experience on IP design or ASIC / SoC integration flow, silicon bring-up / characterization, product engineering, or project management Prefer to have technical knowledge with any Interface IP such as PCIe, USB, MIPI, DDR/LPDDR protocols Understanding of IC manufacturing, process technology and production signoff processes Excellent customer interaction and communication skills Good organization skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently and provide clear Executive reports Team player with ability to drive and align at different levels of organization and between functional teams Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. Provides technical and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability and adoption of products, platforms and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploys and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and analyzes feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement technical roadmap, specifications and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partners with customer technical leaders and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Leveling Differentiators Complexity and type of products/platform supported Balance of technical and customer relationship management capability Scope of responsibility and net impact of the role to the business

Emulation has become indispensable part of SoC designs verification with growing design size and complexity. Synopsys is uniquely positioned to offer the most complete verification, emulation, and prototyping solution in the market today. This Applications Engineer position offers a unique opportunity to work in both simulation and emulation. The job responsibilities involve exploration of customer’s current verification methodology, defining and developing solutions that fit in between simulation and emulation. In addition to end-to-end ownership of key accounts/initiatives, the position requires strong focus on product development and close collaboration with R&D teams. In a customer facing role, the Applications Engineer drives product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive platform benchmarking. You own key on-going engagement and serve as single key contact for all technical challenges seen on specific account/project. In a product facing role, Applications Engineer drives product development with R&D based on their insight into the customers' needs and Issues. You would be responsible for defining requirement specs, ramping up product validation team, product development and customer delivery tracking, internal technical evaluations, trainings etc. Leveraging your close interaction with customers, R&D, Marketing, and Sales teams, you will be able to demonstrate the differentiated emulation/verification environment influencing customer action for Synopsys ZeBu HW adoption. Requirements Minimum 8 years of experience in ASIC design and methodology with a good understanding of SystemVerilog/Verilog/VHDL. Direct experience in SoC design verification/validation using either simulation or emulation or both. Good understanding of RTL, testbench, synthesis, mapping RTL to Xilinx FPGA based platform, Unix/Linux development environment. Good understanding of synthesis and timing analysis concepts Knowledge of C/C++ and scripting languages like Tcl, Python is a plus Excellent customer interface, negotiation, communication and planning skills. Motivated to help customers achieve their verification/validation goals. Sound trouble shooting and problem-solving skills. Ability to lead high complexity technical tasks spread across multiple teams. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Synopsys is looking for someone to join our Applications Engineering team to provide technical support to SLM customers. You will work alongside R&D, marketing and sales team to enable customers onto the SLM platform. To be effective in the role, you will need to have a high degree of semiconductor technical knowledge and the ability to interact at all levels with both internal and external stakeholders. You will be empowered for ensuring the appropriate support and timely solutions are provided to our customers, whilst maintaining world class customer support. Responsibilities Include Develop reference flows based on customer usage of the products in their SoC designs. Working together with the customer support team based on customer use cases. Supporting various internal teams with technical knowledge of the available products and associated services. Running simulations and verification in order to to assist in debugging customer issues. Review and recommend, as part of continuous improvement, internal technical documentation to support the integration and the use of the available products to customers. This includes preparing specification databooks, application notes, internal technical reports and guidelines that will accompany the product documentation. Proactively identify, suggest and contribute to the development and improvement of support process, systems and delivery mechanisms as part of continuous improvement for services to customers. Support the development and delivery of product training to both internal and external stakeholders when required. Attend customer calls to support technical questions and integration of products onto customer SoC. Requirement Degree or equivalent in Electronic Engineering or related field. Professional and technical background within the semiconductor industry. Having strong semiconductor skills within one or more of the following areas: analogue circuit design (including the use of Synopsys and Cadence design tools), digital ASIC flow (including use of synthesis, place and route and ATPG tools), product testing, semiconductor physics. Must be solutions driven with experience of working in a similar customer focused role. Experience of building and maintaining customer relationships. A track record of working within a time sensitive commercial environment. The role requires the utmost diligence and attention to details. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. We’re looking for experienced Processor IP Field Applications Engineers to join our team. In this role you would be the technical business driver responsible for providing pre-sales technical support for Synopsys Processor product portfolio (ARC processors, subsystems, and ASIP tools). You would drive and manage the pre-sales technical interactions and communications with customers, presenting solutions and addressing customers’ technical questions, enabling them to make informed decisions. Responsibilities and Duties Drive presales customer technical discussions and evaluations of Synopsys processor IP solutions Support customer meetings and deliver technical presentations on Synopsys processor products and address customers’ questions Assess customer design requirements, identify their hardware/software technical challenges, propose appropriate strategies and solutions for customers, leveraging the broad Synopsys IP portfolio. Work with Sales to manage the Processor IP activities in the region to achieve a high customer satisfaction rate and to build durable customer relationships Coordinate and drive marketing/engineering teams to create supporting documents, user guides, benchmarks, and other proof-points to help secure technical win Communicate customer feedback to marketing/engineering teams to guide future product direction and/or definition Key Qualifications BS in EE, CE or related equivalent with 10+ years of work experience or MS EE, CE or related equivalent with 8+ year of work experience Good understanding of RISC and DSP processor architectures and the competitive landscape Good understanding of latest SoC architectures and system-level design practices for one or more market segments (mobile, storage, automotive, networking, IoT) particularly from Processor IP requirements perspective Experience in SoC/ASIC/FPGA design flow; Familiarity with RTL design/synthesis is a plus Proven presentation skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to organize, conduct and co-ordinate meetings involving multiple internal/external teams; summarize and communicate the key notes and the resulting action items after the meeting Prior experience in selecting, using, designing, or supporting internal or external IP is a plus Prior experience in an application engineering or another direct customer facing role is a plus Willing to travel (up to 20%) within NA Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Our Custom Design and Manufacturing Group is all about delivering high-value solutions to our customers while driving growth. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the applications engineering team that supports the industry-leading solutions for Physical Verification. The primary focus of the Application Engineer (AE) is to drive increased usage of the product by collaborating with R&D and the Sales team in a dynamic, innovative environment. Some of the tasks include conducting competitive benchmarks and evaluations where they articulate the superiority of our customer’s design team and management. In addition, AE’s deliver customer training, tape-out support, and collaborate on initiatives for product enhancements. The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. We’re looking for an Application Engineer to join a world-class AE team responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading physical verification solution. In this role, you will be a Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our Custom Design and Manufacturing Organization enabling the success of our customers in designing advanced chips on leading-edge process technologies. You will provide technical and engineering insight and direction to improving usability, applicability, and adoption of implementation products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer business needs. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer designs. Work directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement our technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partner with customers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions, and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications BS/MS EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 8+ years of experience. Hands-on experience with Physical Verification Experience with advanced technology nodes. Experience with signoff and physical design methodologies. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for world-class customer service. jobTitle: Applications Product Engineer, Staff - OPC Modeling Platform - 41188BR
jobDescription: This position holds product engineering responsibilities within the PMB (ProGen Model Builder) team. PMB is the official model calibration tool for Mask Solution Group. The simulation model is a key component of Synopsys’ mask synthesis product. We are seeking a senior engineer with significant lithography and software scripting experience to help develop the PMB tool and to provide hands-on expert product engineering support for field application engineers and customers. Responsibilities Include Solid knowledge on photolithography and mask synthesis process Coordinate and lead internal partner groups (R&D, QA & related applications team) to define and evaluate mask synthesis products and technologies for customer introduction and long-term roadmap deployment Work with key customers and field support teams to resolve difficult problems and to develop requirements for future model building tool needs. Prototype and explore new model building solutions or methods to guide development efforts Train internal teams and external customers We desire a candidate with extensive experience and knowledge in advanced photolithographic technologies to ensure new development work is optimal for leading-edge customers. Skills and experience should include: Very good knowledge of photolithography, OPC/RET principles, UNIX/Linux, and Python are required. Experienced engineer with proficiency in lithographic model technology and model building procedure. Prior direct experience with several (but not all) of the areas in the following list are strongly desired: EUV, machine learning, computation lithography, sub-resolution assist features (SRAF), rule-based OPC/AF, model-based OPC/RET, SMO, ILT, Design Rule Checking (DRC), pattern matching, lithography models (physical or compact) and OPC verification software. Knowledge of Synopsys’ mask synthesis software tools and industry best-practice software development methodologies are desired but not required. Great communication skills (written and verbal) and proven ability to help customers and development organizations be successful. Strong problem-solving skills required with the ability to work in a fast paced and distributed team environment. A self-motivated quick learner who can work independently, and be a team player when working within multi-regional cross functional teams Moderate travel (~10%) will be needed (to internal offices in the USA but also to customer sites overseas). Knowledge of Chinese (Mandarin) or Korean is a plus. The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. jobTitle: ASIC Digital Design Engr, Sr Staff - 38776BR
jobDescription: We are looking for a dynamic ASIC Verification Engineer to work as part of the DesignWare Verification team at Synopsys. You will be expected to use SoC ASIC or Custom IC design to specify, design and implement state-of-the-art verification environments for the DesignWare USB family of synthesizable cores. You will work with RTL designers and be part of a team of Verification Engineers. Key Responsibilities Your role includes definition of verification specifications, test bench infrastructure design and implementation test cases creation, checkers, assertions and coverage implementation based on test plan behavioral modeling, bus functional modeling and verification coverage metrics definition Performing simulation, random and focused stimulus generation and coverage review Contributes to technical reviews Generates documentation for test plans and verification environments. Key Qualifications BS in EE/CS with 7+ years of related experiences, or MS with 5+ years of experience in developing and debugging complex SoC testbench environments Verification experience and debug skills of IP cores and/or SOC RTL designs Experience in developing System Verilog, UVM, VMM or similar HDL based test environments Experience in developing and implementing test plans, extracting verification metrics, developing BFMs and similar verification components Understanding of USB3.0, USB3.1, USB3.2, USB4 and AMBA protocol Technical experience with assertion-based verification, coverage driven methodology and formal verification Familiarity with C/C++, and a sound background in data structures and algorithms is preferable Impressive communication skills, able to demonstrate research and problem solving skills Perform in a technical leadership role Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. Staff Physical Design Engineer We’re looking for Physical Design Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will be the technical lead, responsible for the Physical implementation of high speed interface IPs, sub-system, and test-chips, driving all aspects from RTL to GDS including timing and physical sign-off, in close interaction and collaborative team work with multiple functional groups (front end, analog, CAD) and the product team. Key Qualifications MSEE with 10 years Physical Design experience with recent contribution to project tape-outs, as a technical driver and as project lead. Has intimate knowledge of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Has solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of IC design, implementation flows and methodologies for deep submicron design. Has proven track record for technical steering of physical design Team for on-time delivery. Has good communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction, with peer groups as well as customers. Has good software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python); knowledge of CAD automation methods. Has a good understanding of industry standards in deep sub-micron designs Autonomous, timely decision maker and able to cope with interrupts.
