Job Description And Requirements The Black Duck Audit Group are the industry’s most trusted advisors when conducting technical due diligence solution for M&A and internal compliance. When speed and accuracy are critical, high-tech enterprises, startups, PE firms, tech investors and legal advisors choose Black Duck for open source, security, quality, and compliance audit services. Business Development Manager Oversees the development of strategic market/product line business plans and marketing programs to support sales in designated market segments, identifies volume and strategic customers, and develops partnerships. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities, develops strategic direction from market information, and creates compelling market analysis presentations. May conduct make-versus-buy analysis from a partnership/merger/acquisition perspective. Responsibilities Master Synopsys target market, business drivers and strategies Qualify potential business opportunities Execute the necessary activities to meet goals Leverage all contacts to identify other prospects through referrals Identify key stakeholders and position Synopsys appropriately Support field sales representatives in North America Requirements Typically requires a minimum of 5 years of related expertise. Possesses a solid understanding of specialization area plus working knowledge of one other related area. Exercises self-directed judgement in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions and resolves issues in creative ways. Executes projects from start to completion. Contributes to moderately complex aspects of a project while working on team-driven or task-oriented projects. Determines and develops recommendations to solutions. May guide more junior peers with aspects of their job. Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. Skills And Qualifications Excellent verbal and written communication skill, to a professional proficiency Interest in a high-tech sales career Proactive mentality and can work well in a high-growth, fast-paced environment Exceptional problem-solving skills Team player with a customer-focused attitude Excellent time management skills Previous experience in a software related enterprise is a plus Understanding of salesforce.com is a plus Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2021 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Job Description And Requirements The Black Duck Audit Group are the industry’s most trusted advisors when conducting technical due diligence solution for M&A and internal compliance. When speed and accuracy are critical, high-tech enterprises, startups, PE firms, tech investors and legal advisors choose Black Duck for open source, security, quality, and compliance audit services. Analyzes market data to identify trends/opportunities, develops strategic direction from market information, and creates compelling market analysis presentations. May conduct make-versus-buy analysis from a partnership/merger/acquisition perspective. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Systems Solutions Group (SSG) provides services including tool flow and methodologies, design creation and verification, and design implementation. Our customers range from start-ups to industry leaders, developing products for telecommunications, wireless, aerospace and defense, automotive, artificial intelligence computing, and high-performance computing markets. Our services projects range from collaborating with customers to provide specific design skills and assistance for an SoC project all the way through end-to-end SoC turnkey design from specification to parts. We are looking for a Business Development Manager to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be responsible for services business development activities from opportunity identification through order closure and project execution. Should have a high-level technical understanding and strategic perspective of Synopsys tool, IP and services offerings and be able to discuss offerings with our customers. Will work closely with sales, marketing, customers and services engineering to identify a services solution for each customer that brings value to the customer and meets margin goals. Will lead and drive opportunity qualification, solution development, scoping, planning, pricing, proposal, and Statement of Work (SOW). Will lead bid teams across business units for our most comprehensive opportunities. Will participate in account planning to strengthen pipeline of opportunities. Requirements Owns and drives the services pre-sales bid for specific opportunities working collaboratively with customers, sales, services and cross-Synopsys teams. Ensures proper scoping, proposal/SOW development and winning the project. Establishes customer expectations that enable successful project execution. Has demonstrated understanding of SOC Design, grasps technical details and is able to discuss these details with customer and internal experts. Has innovative mindset that can formulate new solutions or direction and is able to motivate others to support new solutions or direction. Represents the organization as the principle contact on business opportunity. Strong demonstrated written, oral and presentation skills in engineering, managerial and executive level presentations and communications, including internal and external customers. Ability to network with engineers and leaders across Synopsys teams to lead solution development. Experience developing technical proposals and SOWs is preferred. Experience in SOC Design Engineering is preferred. As a part-time function, must be able to provide Project Management support for small projects including interacting directly with the customer and Synopsys execution team to ensure status reporting, issue resolution and positive customer satisfaction. Able to help build marketing collateral suitable for pre-sales use. Will be able to travel on occasion for short periods of time, and occasionally work on-site at customer premises as required (as global situations permit). Typically requires a minimum of 12+ years of related experience. At this level, post-graduate coursework or knowledge base equivalent is desirable. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - Silicon Lifecycle Management - 40733BR
jobDescription: Business Development Manager Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) is a relatively new process associated with the monitoring, analysis and optimization of semiconductor devices as they are designed, manufactured, tested and deployed in end user systems. SLM is based on two underlying principles: gather as much useful data about each chip as possible and analyze that data throughout the chip’s entire lifecycle to gain actionable insights to improve chip and system related activities. The Synopsys SLM Platform provides insight into critical performance, functionality, reliability, safety and security issues for the entirety of a chip’s lifespan. This enables the optimization of operational activities for all participants throughout the life of the SoC. We’re looking for a Business Development Manager to join the Silicon Lifecycle Management team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will oversee the development of strategic market business plans and marketing programs to support sales in SLM and adjacent market segments. You will identify volume and strategic customers, develop relationships, formulate business strategy, and support sales campaigns. This includes positioning the benefits of key Synopsys’ product features, IP portfolio, and Design Services as an integrated solution for SLM customers. You will be expected to know Synopsys products/services and orchestrate technical messaging for maximum impact in the SLM and adjacent markets. You will be the subject matter expert for your area of responsibility and be willing to work in a fast pace environment to deliver innovative solutions. Key Qualifications BS with 10+ years, or MS with 8+ years of relevant experience in semiconductor, semiconductor manufacturing, or EDA industry Technical and/or business background in semiconductor IP, semiconductor test, or semiconductor analytics a plus Sales experience a plus. Essential that the individual demonstrates strong communication and project management skills Responsibilities Include Work with executives to develop the SLM and adjacent markets by being the subject matter expert on the Path Margin Monitors (PMM) and upcoming environmental monitors as well as the High Speed Access & Test (HSAT) interface that leverages current and future high-speed interfaces such as PCIe and USB to allow for improved test times and in-field testing Analyze market data to identify trends/opportunities, develop strategic direction from market information, and create compelling market analysis presentations Support sales enablement activities including but not limited to customer presentations, sales aids, roll out updates, feature releases, etc. Work with Marketing, Engineering, and Design Services teams to deliver on solutions for the targeted customer segment. Coordinate inputs from the customer, sales, and services teams to enable marketing to develop preliminary-proposals and SOWs. Responsible for business development activities from client identification through to final invoicing Develop win-win customer relationships through active engagement and support e.g. issue resolution, communication, prioritization Serve as customer advocate in internal engineering forums with a goal to deliver high quality solutions May conduct make-versus-buy analysis from a partnership/merger/acquisition perspective At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Sr. Partner Manager, State & Local Government and Education This position on the partner sales team is responsible for developing and growing and managing the Synopsys State, Local and Education (SLED) partner ecosystem. The position works collaboratively with the larger Synopsys global partner team that supports our SLED and other partner ecosystems. The primary goal is to achieve revenue targets through strategic business partnership and execution. This dynamic field-based role develops and implements joint selling strategies for Synopsys Application Security products and services, thereby growing mutual revenue. Sr. Partner Managers build sustainable business practices and cultivate relationships across Synopsys and partner business organizations through the development and execution of strategic partner business plans. Responsibilities Include A successful Sr. Partner Manager will have experience in executive level presenting and planning and will be a highly motivated teammate. Partner Management: You can develop strategic relationships with key partners to drive commitment to Synopsys products and solutions and to increase the revenue generated through ‘sell with' strategies with each partner. Meet partner sales and business plan targets. Pipeline Management: Drive joint Synopsys/partner pipeline from demand generation to close utilizing virtual partner and field sales teams. Effectively communicate, report, track and manage sales pipelines to senior management. Promote collaboration with internal and external resources to facilitate regular communication between partners and Synopsys. Partner Development: Drive development of partner services offerings and solutions to support Synopsys revenue growth and increase partner profitability. Increase partners’ Synopsys sales and delivery workforce through sales, presales & technical certifications. Partner Business Planning: Generate and drive sales and marketing plans (Partner Joint Business Plans) with all assigned partners, including services practice initiation, enablement, business development, and pipeline generation. Set goals and priorities with corporate strategy. Partner Enablement: Work closely with the Enablement team and technical partner resources to train and certify the partner’s sales, pre-sale and consultants on Synopsys offerings. Required Skills Background working in (or with) the State, Local and Education sector with in-depth knowledge of how SLED entities operate and procure software 5+ years experience working directly with key Resellers, System Integrators and Managed Service Providers in the SLED space. Understanding of the SLED procurement process and contract holders for various entities. Relationships and contacts at key contract holders and/or key influencers within the partner community that calls on SLED Experience in developing precise, comprehensive executive engagement plans that ensure successful execution strategies Exhibits credibility and executive presence, influencing and instilling confidence at all executive and management levels Proven experience in communicating value proposition in terms of partners’ and end users’ business needs Proven ability to integrate partner sales, Synopsys core sales and extended teams to facilitate joint selling efforts Demonstrated commitment and interest in both internal and external partner needs Preferred Skills Proven knowledge and experience in the enterprise software domain, and knowledge - ideally - of the Application Security segment Consistent record of achieving business goals in a highly competitive partner environment. Prideful professional with exceptional business acumen Demonstrates motivation, drive, and has exceptional business ethics B.S./B.A.

Synopsys IT cloud team is responsible for providing best in class EDA Infrastructure & Design environment in the public cloud, optimized to meet the scale and complexity of the EDA workload. As we expand and accelerate “Synopsys Cloud”, we are looking for a Cloud Engineering Manager who can be a change agent for our leading-edge transformation. You will manage a team handling a challenging and varied array of problems in how we gain further maturity in DevOps tools, processes, and Infrastructure Engineering capabilities. You will assist in designing and executing our cloud roadmap that consists of high-performing, innovative solutions. Responsibilities: Measure and optimize Cloud services & software performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating to continually improve. Evaluate and adopt new Cloud services in Servers, Storage/Backup, and Network for scalability, robustness, and uptime improvement in all global sites Implement, maintain, and consult on the observability stack that supports the needs of multiple internal stakeholders. Utilize your deep experience and problem-solving skills to help prevent and investigate production issues. Participate in the design and implementation of new system layers of high complexity EDA/HPC design environments. Researching and recommending specific systems, architectures, and applications, for cloud infrastructure solutions. Work closely with the IT, Product, and Engineering teams to define, discover, and implement requirements while providing an exceptionally stable and reliable platform on Synopsys Cloud. Desired Skills: Managed infrastructure-focused engineering teams on Cloud [ Azure Preferred] and have multiple years of experience focusing on one or more of the following areas: Build, Test, Deploy Developer Productivity Observability Reliability Engineering Cloud Infrastructure DevOps Domain Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure services on clouds such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization. Proven experience in High-Performance Computing environments for HPC/EDA workload is preferred. Proven problem-solving / troubleshooting skills. HA and Scalability knowledge and experience Experience & Certifications in a range of cloud services such as Azure Startup mentality: You are comfortable navigating fast-moving hyper-growth initiatives. BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent Relevant experience of 5+ yrs Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

able to articulate clear and concise messaging Fundamental knowledge of SharePoint 2013 and SharePoint online Attend discussion sessions to determine the communication needs and assess best solution Measure and apply metrics to written and shared content to assess effectiveness Collect design requirements to conceptualize visual communication tools Maintain accurate client interaction documentation Edit, clarify and proofread communication written by others as assigned Perform support tasks in the planning, layout and preparation of artwork for inclusion in technical manuals, reports, product brochures, displays and presentations Determine composition of technical illustrations and select views, angles, perspectives and projections necessary for presentation Assist in selection of techniques best suited to produce desired visual effects and recommend methods and mediums to convey desired effect Write user documentation Role Qualifications: Excellent written and spoken English Attention to detail is essential Fundamental understanding of web design capabilities and functions a plus Understand common use cases for different forms of communication As a skilled specialist, complete a wide range of complex tasks in resourceful and effective ways Determines methods and procedures on new assignments Works under the general guidance of management and key team contributors with independence in planning work Understands implications of work and makes recommendations for solutions Active listening, patience, attentiveness, adaptability and dependability Ability to build working relationships with colleagues across the company Understand the critical role effective communication plays in the business environment Education: Bachelor’s Degree or 4 years related experience preferred

COMPILER ENGINEERING MANAGER Position is opened in multiple locations. Overview At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Synopsys is a worldwide leading supplier of horizontal IP which is used by our customers to design semiconductor integrated circuits. The IP product portfolio includes ARC processors, including EV processors for embedded vision, high-performance Vector DSP processors, and industry leading neural network processors; USB, DDR, and Ethernet interface controllers and many more. For the ARC Processor team, we are looking for an experienced engineering manager who will lead creation of the next generation neural network model compiler targeting ARC processor architectures. This product is used by third party developers who run neural network-based workloads on SoCs with ARC Neural Network Processor IP inside. Key Responsibilities Manage compiler frontend (analysis of neural network topologies) and backend (generation of executable code for a neural processor) teams Lead development of compiler optimization algorithms Engage with open-source community to achieve efficient long-term collaboration focusing on added value Communicate with customers, internal and external stakeholders to maintain long term product roadmap Own delivery schedule and track related dependencies Close the feedback loop with hardware designers on improvements for next generation neural network processor ISAs Requirements Hands on experience with compiler development, understanding compiler theory and top-level compiler industry trends Experience with open-source technologies like LLVM / MLIR, TVM, Glow, xbyak, etc. used for ahead-of-time or just-in-time compilation of neural network models 5+ years of managerial / team leadership experience Experience with setting up collaborative ways of working in an open-source environment Ability to see a bigger picture and communicate with cross-functional teams about various engineering topics such as system architecture, detailed design, APIs, project schedules, testing strategies, etc. Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and organizational skills while managing a multisite team Excellent written and spoken English

Senior Security Consultant Job Description We’re looking for ethical hackers. Our Senior Security Consultants lead security engagements with a small team to analyze target systems, penetrate defenses, and exploit vulnerabilities. They think creatively about complex problems and communicate solutions to our clients in an easy to understand and meaningful way. Synopsys thrives on learning. Our consultants are exposed to a wide variety of technologies, attack techniques, and security countermeasures. They are assigned an industry-leading expert as a mentor, learn from their peers in a knowledge-rich environment, and share their own expertise with junior members of the team. We’re looking for people who want to accelerate their careers and make a strong impact on our team and our clients. Activities Skills You’re not expected to have all these skills on day 1, but here are some of the things you might get to work on while you’re here Application Penetration Testing Source Code Analysis Mobile App Security Threat Modeling Secure Software Design and Architecture Network Penetration Testing Embedded and IoT Security Analysis Cloud Security SSDLC and DevSecOps Technical Skills Qualifications and Experience Familiarity with software attack and exploitation techniques Understanding of common web application security issues i.e., OWASP Top 10 and SANS Top 25 Command of defensive programming concepts and security countermeasures Experience with one or more software programming languages and frameworks Experience performing manual penetration testing Consulting Skills Proficiency in organizing and prioritizing multiple tasks, completing them independently, and meeting delivery timelines Ability to lead a team , give direction, and ensure tasks are executed consistently Preferred: experience in a customer-facing role Communication Written communication skills applicable to preparing formal documentation, white papers, and case studies Ability to clearly articulate thoughts and present to both technical and non-technical audiences Travel up to 25% Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience Company Description Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Our ideal applicants would be at home in a collaborative and vibrant culture. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. CPU Design Engineer, Staff This role is for the ARC Processor group at Synopsys and will be part of the architecture and design R&D Team. As a member of the ARC design Team you will gain understanding of the leading vision and neural network processors and contribute to architecting and designing state of the art DSP and control processor features of ARC processor cores, as well as understand and implement requirements of designing for Functional Safety. You will leverage your processor architecture and design skills for out of the box thinking to meet Power, Performance, Area requirements. Primary Responsibilities Include Work with global design teams to develop and enhance ARC processors and related components Analyze requirements and develop architecture and micro-architecture specifications for portions of the design Collaborate with the modeling team to identify realistic use cases of application code, hardware benchmarks and analyze results Design and integrate processor modules using Verilog RTL code and develop test cases to check basic functionality Collaborate with the Verification team to support development of test plans to achieve functional coverage closure Analyze and optimize the design to achieve performance, speed, size, and power goals, working with the physical design teams Help design and implement Safety and Security Mechanisms for ARC Processor Cores Participate and Contribute to Functional Safety Audits As part of the largest EDA company, you will be in contact with remote teams on different continents and will work closely with customers located in Asia, Americas and Europe.Keywords FPGA, Verification, ASIC, Linux, Verilog, TCL, FMEDA, DFMEA, DFA, ASIL, ISO26262, IEC61508 Must Have Skills Masters/Bachelor or above degree in electronic/electrical engineering or computer science 8+ years of ASIC/SoC design experience Experience with processor / DSP designs, memory hierarchies, cache controllers, arithmetic units Familiar with ARC or other Processer Cores Familiar with Industry standard interfaces like AMBA-AXI, AHB Proficient with Verilog RTL based logic design Proficient with design tools for simulation, synthesis and timing analysis Familiar with tools for Verilog linting, including CDC/MCP checks Familiar with programming in C and assembly for test cases Familiar with compilers and debug tools, Familiar with a scripting language for automation Exceptional debugging and troubleshooting skills Excellent communication skills, teamwork skills, autonomy Ability to work simultaneously on multiple tasks Has a proven desire to learn and explore new technologies. Demonstrates good research and problem-solving skills. Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of understanding. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. CPU Performance Modeling Engineer, Staff This role is for the ARC Processor group at Synopsys and will be part of the architecture and design R&D Team. You will explore ways to improve the performance of leading vision and neural network processors including state of the art DSP and control functions. You will leverage your processor architecture, design and performance knowledge to propose enhancements, optimization and features for the next generation based on performance assessment and PPA impact. Primary Responsibilities Consult with architects to create executable specs by building domain specific functional models (C++) for next generation of ARC processors. Set team direction and propose methodologies towards developing a complete processor architectural functional model by integrating domain specific processor modules using C++ framework. Operate autonomously towards annotating timing/cycle information to functional models to build cycle approximate performance models Correlate performance model results against VCS based RTL simulations Partner with RTL design and Verification teams during the execution phase for formal/dynamic verification Demonstrate leadership in characterizing benchmarks, workloads and use cases (application code) and proposing microarchitectural optimizations for IPC improvements. As part of the largest EDA company, you will be in contact with remote teams on different continents and will work closely with customers located in Asia, Americas and Europe. Keywords: Performance modeling, C++, Architectural functional models, systemC, cycle approximate performance models, FPGA, Verification, ASIC, Linux, Verilog, TCL, Perl or Python Must Have Skills Masters/Bachelor or above degree in electronic/electrical engineering or computer science 8+ years of ASIC/SoC Performance modeling experience with excellent knowledge of Compute Architecture (Core) Experience with processor / DSP designs, memory hierarchies, cache controllers, arithmetic units Hands on experience on a popular simulation framework or Instruction Set Simulator (Eg. GEM5, Spike, QEMU) Excellent C++ and scripting (shell & python) skills with exposure to SystemC and assembly for test cases Ability to start things from scratch i.e (create a code base from file 0) and ability to infuse code into existing model. Familiar with Industry standard interfaces like AMBA-AXI, AHB Proficient in RTL design and coding with Verilog Familiar with RISC, CISC, VLIW ISA, compilers and debug tools Exceptional debugging and troubleshooting skills Excellent communication skills, teamwork skills and demonstrates autonomy Ability to work simultaneously on multiple tasks Has a proven desire to learn and explore new technologies. Demonstrates good research and problem-solving skills. Networks with internal and external personnel in domains of architecture, design (RTL/Physical) and verification Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2021 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Job Description And Requirements DAST Assessment Support Supervisor We are looking for a direct supervisor to drive and mentor our Dynamic Application Security Testing support team in the Software Integrity Group at Synopsys. In this role you will lead the team responsible for supporting our web application penetration testing teams and 3rd party partners. Responsibilities Provide leadership and strategy on all matters related to client case management and determining asset readiness for security testing Manage, develop, and train staff; develop and monitor goals; conduct performance reviews Coordinate with customer success teams to prioritize requests and provide status updates Validate eligibility for 3rd party testing of client assets and communicate weekly assignments Required Understanding of successful HTTP request and responses Advanced understanding of web application scoping (URL structure, domains, subdomains) Experience with Burp Suite, SalesForce, Jira, and Confluence Ability to work with leadership across various departments and teams Excellent time management skills Excellent work ethic Good technical acumen, ability to quickly digest concepts/ideals and apply practically Capability to communicate concepts, issues, and solutions to others Contributes to a positive and healthy team environment Self-motivated, enthusiastic , and promotes a can-do operating style Desired Basic understanding of web application vulnerabilities (OWASP top 10) Working knowledge of FQDN, TCP/IP Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Overview This is an exciting opportunity to pursue impactful and rewarding work focusing on design IP system/workflow development and user empowerment. We develop and support systems and workflows that help IP design teams design and validate their IPs. Come join our team where there are opportunities abound for challenging software development, creation of helpful educational material, and the forging of new and constructive cross-functional relationships with a large and varied user base. There are many learning and growth opportunities, as well as chances to optimize and innovate (e.g., using machine learning) these critical systems/workflows. Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for developing, integrating and releasing life-cycle automation tools for R&D teams. Devise and deploy content (including documentation, short videos, etc.) that describes key system details and empower users to understand and optimally utilize software systems and workflows Help forge and cultivate new relationships with IP design teams to help with system/workflow understanding and usage Will work on complex problems where understanding of situations and/or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Expected to review project details, refine problem descriptions, and develop novel technical solutions. Must provide and optimize system/utility support. Skills & Requirements Able to collaborate with development teams and facilitate high-quality releases. Hands-on experience with python programming, as well as shell/tcl/perl scripting. Familiarity with IP design and integration methodologies would be helpful. BE in CS/ECE/EEE with 3+ years or ME with 1+ years of relevant experience in python and shell/tcl/perl scripting Significant experience with software integration and release, build tools (make/gmake), and on branching, merging, software configuration. Experience with file management tools (Perforce, RCS, CVS, etc.). Must have excellent multitasking, teamwork, and communication skills. Jenkins, JIRA management and Verilog/VHDL experience is desirable. Business Area Description Our Software Security and Quality business is all about building secure software—faster. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain, all while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. About Synopsys At Synopsys, we are at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we are powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. That starts with our static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis so our customers can build security and quality into the DNA of their code at any stage of the software development lifecycle and across the supply chain, all while minimizing risks and maximizing speed of application development. Director, Executive Keynotes and Communications Position Summary We are looking for a highly experienced executive communication expert to drive the development, production, and delivery of key content for Synopsys’ President and COO, and other C-suite leaders. The successful candidate will play a strategic role in bringing Synopsys’ business and technology story to life for a variety of audiences, from customers and partners to investors, Synopsys employees, industry peers, and government officials. This is a high-impact position reporting directly to Synopsys’ Chief Marketing Officer and working closely with corporate staff, business group leaders, and marketing and communication functions across the business. We are seeking a technology-savvy, hands-on communications professional with a track record of delivering impactful executive communications, often to tight deadlines. You must be used to working in trusted partnerships with C-suite executives who are often time-constrained, requiring you to be comfortable with a high degree of independence. This person must be detail-oriented as well as creative and a natural team player. You’ll exhibit sound judgment, impeccable story-telling skills, and an ability to synthesize abstract, often complex concepts, into powerful narratives. You must be experienced at working across a variety of mediums from producing content for major keynote stages, to internal global town halls, blogs, film scripts and pitched media articles. Responsibilities Create, drive, and deliver compelling, original, executive-level content and presentations in partnership with the President/COO for internal and external audiences, including external keynotes, all-employee meetings, organization announcements, videos, and presentations or panels. Create original ways to communicate powerful messages that inform and engage a diverse, global audience internally. Attend and participate in industry technology and business conferences, collect, study, and articulate complex business and technology trends clearly, and formulate narrative recommendations that work for a wide variety of audiences internationally. Demonstrate the ability to manage complex and sometimes unexpected communications challenges while working calmly, with grace and humor, and maintaining sound judgment in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Job Qualifications BA/MA in Marketing, Communications, or related field. Minimum of 12 years of industry experience, with at least 5 years of related executive communications experience—including disciplines such as executive communications and organizational/employee communications. We will also consider product marketing experts with high potential, preferably from a large multinational company specializing in hardware/software technology. Exceptional interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills; experience working in a matrixed environment where collaboration and influence are required to drive results. Strategic, analytical thinker with keen tactical execution skills, attention to detail, and ability to turn complex, technology-heavy topics into digestible, compelling stories. Strong project management skills and ability to manage numerous deadline-driven projects simultaneously. Driven, self-organized team player with a demonstrated ability to achieve objectives in a fast-paced environment. Must be extremely comfortable and competent at designing PowerPoint presentations. Willingness to travel (up to 25%). At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Drive architecture for transistor level sign off products. Work closely with product R&D teams to make architectural improvements to drive performance, features, code robustness and scalability. Collaborate with Simulator and custom teams for integration with transistor level products. Engage with corporate Strategy team to drive One Synopsys initiatives.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. We’re looking for Product Engineers to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you would be a Machine Learning Product Engineer. Job Description Work with other Product Engineers and R&D to develop new DSO.ai features Develop new DSO.ai methodologies to improve PPA (this may involve exploring different methodologies and features across multiple designs, analyzing the results, and summarizing to R&D and ACs) Assist Synopsys field ACs to support customer tapeouts using DSO.ai Assist Synopsys field ACs to support customer evaluations of DSO.ai Work with other Product Engineers and R&D to develop and deliver training material, labs, and documentation for DSO.ai Develop QA testcases and perform quality testing for new DSO.ai releases Key Qualifications: Strong motivation to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills Working at a very detailed and collaborative level with R&D engineers, other Product engineers, field engineers, customers and executives Communicating complex ideas to users: internal and external, written and verbal, formal and informal Researching and innovating solutions in known and unknown areas Driving for improved customer success through novel techniques through all phases of the IC design workflow Preferred Experience Deep knowledge in developing and maintaining EDA design tool and chip design flows (logic and physical implementation, signoff and/or simulation tools) Attentive to stringent performance and quality requirements for production toolchains Extensive experience in EDA tool product and/or field engineering Strong communication skills, verbal and written; ability to produce design documents detailing product requirements BS/MS/Phd in EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 8+ years of experience. Knowledge of Machine Learning algorithms and data structures is a plus Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Embedded memory business is all about building high-performance low power / ultra high density designs to meet the demanding SOC requirement, We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying embedded memories to support the need of today’s SOC need and we design the next-generation memory architecture to meet the customer requirements. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance. A successful candidate will join Embedded memory team and be responsible for architecting the next generation memories and will also work with the team to verify the designs for robustness .The candidate should have extensive experience in overall memory designs and methodologies covering both front-end and back-end implementation We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why EM team is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Key Qualifications And Responsibility Key Qualification BS / MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience 15+ Year of relevant experience Solid understanding of industry-standard design tools. Good understanding of Digital Circuit design techniques in FinFet technologies. Proven experience on transistor-level circuit design and circuit behavior analysis Knowledge of high-performance and low power circuit designs Experience developing caches/SRAM design for low voltage and low power operating conditions. Exposure to complete design cycle of SRAM memory and compiler development Deep understanding of nanometer device physics, leakage mechanisms, technology interactions with device behavior. Hands-on experience running SPICE simulation, and capability to adapt to new simulation tools Strong proficiency in scripting language, such as, Perl, Tcl, Make, and automation methods/algorithms a certain plus Familiar with EMIR/Aging/Self heating and their impacts to circuit/layout implementations and signoff flows Great team-work, communication and analytical skills Willingness to collaborate closely with cross functional teams across the globe Responsibility : Define various architecture/topologies optimizing for power, timing, area, yield and deep dive with the team in optimizing for various memory architecture Work with the flow and methodology team to streamline design automation, data collection and analysis, and ensure high yielding silicon Supervise layout engineers and review layout for optimality. Support post-silicon effort to enable productization. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. Our Synopsys Cloud business combines the availability of advanced compute and storage infrastructure with unlimited access to EDA software licenses on-demand so our customers can focus on what they do best – design chips, faster. With cloud native EDA tools and pre-optimized hardware platforms, an extremely flexible business model, and a modern customer experience, Synopsys has reimagined the future of chip design on the cloud that doesn’t disrupt proven workflows. We’re looking for an EDA Cloud Salesperson to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be accountable for driving sales of Synopsys Cloud. You will work with customers to know about their EDA, compute, and storage requirements and work with technical experts to develop and position solutions. You will create business proposals and close business agreements. You will work with technical teams to ensure customer success and business growth. Key Qualifications Ability to manage complex business and technical engagements resulting in customer success and business growth Effective communication with a broad range of technical and non-technical people A good knowledge of semiconductor design and EDA tool flows. Preferred Experience A BS with at least 5 years of experience in IC Design, EDA flows, or Cloud sales is preferred. A history of success selling or supporting complex technical products and services preferably around the semiconductor industry Experience selling business value to executives. With cloud native EDA tools and pre-optimized hardware platforms, an extremely flexible business model, and a modern customer experience, Synopsys has reimagined the future of chip design on the cloud that doesn’t disrupt proven workflows. We’re looking for an EDA Cloud Salesperson to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be accountable for driving sales of Synopsys Cloud. You will work with customers to know about their EDA, compute, and storage requirements and work with technical experts to develop and position solutions. You will create business proposals and close business agreements. You will work with technical teams to ensure customer success and business growth. Key Qualifications Ability to manage complex business and technical engagements resulting in customer success and business growth Effective communication with a broad range of technical and non-technical people A good knowledge of semiconductor design and EDA tool flows. Preferred Experience A BS with at least 5 years of experience in IC Design, EDA flows, or Cloud sales is preferred. A history of success selling or supporting complex technical products and services preferably around the semiconductor industry Experience selling business value to executives. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We are Talent and Leadership Development, a fun, passionate group of people working together to drive organizational impact through learning and organizational vitality. Synopsys is at a point of inflection where culture, skills development and organizational effectiveness have a heightened role in our company’s future success. We seek to enhance organizational vitality by promoting employee wellbeing and inclusion, fostering collaboration and innovation, and driving employee professional growth. You are Passionate about your own learning and that of others. Excited by the opportunity to make a difference in an enterprise-focused role connecting employee engagement with enterprise success. You’ll thrive in this role if you love bringing ideas to life, don’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves and enjoy solving problems addressing both present and future needs. About The Role It’s an incredible time to be at Synopsys. Our company is growing and transforming itself to harness new customer solutions based on the unique technology capabilities across our product groups. As the Employee Engagement Manager, you’ll help drive and implement a holistic employee listening strategy. This includes managing the core employee listening and engagement process, from designing relevant measurement strategies to developing and administering surveys to generating insights and analysis to share with HR Business Partners and Senior Leadership on key focus areas such as engagement, retention, diversity and inclusion, development, etc. Above all, empathy and collaboration are needed. You’ll be working, consulting, and helping across many teams as an enabler with an opportunity to make a large impact. Key Job Responsibilities Survey Strategy, Administration and Governance (30%) Work with HR partners for requirements for Surveys and Action Planning Develop and socialize strategy for holistic employee listening surveys and action plans Identify relevant items and metrics to ask the right questions, provide meaningful insights and drive change Configure surveys as required (Pulse, Annual, Employee Life-cycle events like Onboarding, Exit, etc.) or custom surveys targeted to specific cohorts within the organization Partner with HR Communications on survey communications and launch Configure and maintain roles for various levels of users throughout the organization Partner with HR Tech for employee data integration, as needed Provide training to HR users Reporting and Analytics (50%) Configure and maintain reports and dashboards to be utilized by the Executive, Management, and HR stakeholders Identify, configure, and operationalize standard KPIs that could be measured and tracked periodically Derive, interpret, and communicate analyses and insights to technical and non-technical audiences Analyze textual data, apply principles of NLP to large volumes of open-ended comments and raise flags for potential ER issues, if needed Analyze usage and survey participation and provide insights to HR leaders helping them strategize on increasing participation Create strategy for additional tools for survey data analysis and reporting Apply statistical methods such as linear and logistic regression, correlation, etc. to correlate employee engagement with other signals like business productivity, revenue, and customer experience metrics Actions and Communication (20%) Advise and consult with HR and business partners on employee engagement, survey results, and action planning Create frameworks for enterprise or business-specific action plans based on survey results, work with HR partners to implement with accountability Develop and execute effective marketing to communicate actions and impact across several channels and audiences Position Requirements Must be able to work independently as well as within a team structure Must excel at meaning-making and synthesizing data and information into coherent storytelling, recommendations, and influence Work collaboratively in a relationship-oriented, matrixed, fluid, growing and complex environment and effectively manage stakeholder relationships Must understand employee experience/engagement research, synthesis, and presentation concepts Must have an understanding of communication strategies and tactics, and best practices Demonstrate exceptional judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data and business issues Must understand how employee experience and communication concepts work together to achieve maximum benefit for the organization Technical Skills And Experience (Must Have) Bachelor's degree or Master’s degree in Human Resources preferred. Experience in Statistics, Industrial and Organizational Psychology, Psychometrics, Sociology, Organization Development, or other Behavioral Sciences 3+ years of work experience directly supporting Employee Engagement/Experience survey administration 4+ years of hand-on experience in People Analytics and/or Employee Survey Analytics Strong understanding of survey methodologies, quantitative and qualitative research, and survey design principles Strong ability to understand sophisticated analytics topics and translate the analysis into simple language Experience with employee engagement surveys, employee lifecycle surveys, pulse surveys, etc. Intermediate to advanced knowledge of text mining, semantic analysis and experience working with both structured and unstructured data 2+ years of experience working with EX platforms like Glint Hands-on experience with data visualization tools like PowerBI or Tableau Experience in either R or Python or other statistical programming languages/software Ability to conduct statistical analysis independently Experience communicating and presenting to Senior Management Technical Skills And Experience (Desired) 2+ years of experience working with Glint Working knowledge of Success Factors and Vizier Experience working in a large, global organization, or one that is highly matrixed Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. ﻿Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We are Talent and Leadership Development, a fun, passionate group of people working together to drive organizational impact through learning and organizational vitality. Synopsys is at a point of inflection where culture, skills development and organizational effectiveness have a heightened role in our company’s future success. We seek to enhance organizational vitality by promoting employee wellbeing and inclusion, fostering collaboration and innovation, and driving employee professional growth. You are Passionate about your own learning and that of others. Excited by the opportunity to make a difference in an enterprise-focused role connecting employee engagement with enterprise success. You’ll thrive in this role if you love bringing ideas to life, don’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves and enjoy solving problems addressing both present and future needs. About The Role It’s an incredible time to be at Synopsys. Our company is growing and transforming itself to harness new customer solutions based on the unique technology capabilities across our product groups. As the Employee Engagement Manager, you’ll help drive and implement a holistic employee listening strategy. This includes managing the core employee listening and engagement process, from designing relevant measurement strategies to developing and administering surveys to generating insights and analysis to share with HR Business Partners and Senior Leadership on key focus areas such as engagement, retention, diversity and inclusion, development, etc. Above all, empathy and collaboration are needed. You’ll be working, consulting, and helping across many teams as an enabler with an opportunity to make a large impact. Key Job Responsibilities Survey Strategy, Administration and Governance (30%) Work with HR partners for requirements for Surveys and Action Planning Develop and socialize strategy for holistic employee listening surveys and action plans Identify relevant items and metrics to ask the right questions, provide meaningful insights and drive change Configure surveys as required (Pulse, Annual, Employee Life-cycle events like Onboarding, Exit, etc.) or custom surveys targeted to specific cohorts within the organization Partner with HR Communications on survey communications and launch Configure and maintain roles for various levels of users throughout the organization Partner with HR Tech for employee data integration, as needed Provide training to HR users Reporting and Analytics (50%) Configure and maintain reports and dashboards to be utilized by the Executive, Management, and HR stakeholders Identify, configure, and operationalize standard KPIs that could be measured and tracked periodically Derive, interpret, and communicate analyses and insights to technical and non-technical audiences Analyze textual data, apply principles of NLP to large volumes of open-ended comments and raise flags for potential ER issues, if needed Analyze usage and survey participation and provide insights to HR leaders helping them strategize on increasing participation Create strategy for additional tools for survey data analysis and reporting Apply statistical methods such as linear and logistic regression, correlation, etc. to correlate employee engagement with other signals like business productivity, revenue, and customer experience metrics Actions and Communication (20%) Advise and consult with HR and business partners on employee engagement, survey results, and action planning Create frameworks for enterprise or business-specific action plans based on survey results, work with HR partners to implement with accountability Develop and execute effective marketing to communicate actions and impact across several channels and audiences Position Requirements Must be able to work independently as well as within a team structure Must excel at Synopsys is hiring an Executive Assistant to provide administrative support to a Senior Vice President of Engineering and their team. This position requires thorough understanding of company operations, policies, and procedures. Handles details of a highly confidential and critical nature. Collects and prepares information for use in discussions/meetings of executive staff. Makes high level contacts of a sensitive nature inside and outside the company. May track department personnel and organizational changes as they occur. Develops presentations and spreadsheets as needed. Maintains calendar for executives as required. Assists with travel arrangements and processing of expense reports. May scribe and publish staff meeting minutes in a timely manner. Takes on special projects as directed. Requirements 8+ years of direct experience providing administrative support at an executive level. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, organizational and inter-personal skills. A team player, flexible, intuitive, self-motivating, detail-oriented, and highly organized. Works well autonomously, prioritize, and exercise sound judgment. Able to multi-task and maintain professionalism while working with a variety of confidential information. Exceptional computer skills are essential, including knowledge of MS Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and SharePoint. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. jobTitle: Executive Assistant, SVP, Enterprise Marketing and Communication (CMO) - 42311BR
jobDescription: As the Executive Assistant for SVP, Enterprise Marketing and Communication (CMO), you support the head of marketing at Synopsys. You will represent the transformational role of marketing at Synopsys working with other corporate executives globally. If you are looking to join a fast-growing marketing team, have excellent interpersonal skills, and have a passion for organizational leadership, transformation, and high technology, this position may be just the right fit for you. Responsibilities Keep CMO organized and on track by preparing, alerting, and time-managing for daily, weekly commitments Calendar management and constant prioritization with a constant flow of changes and while coordinating with other executive assistants Understand CMO’s short and long-term priorities for self and organization, and help them balance in accomplishing both whenever possible Plan and Arrange travel – plan and coordinate all travel-related details and optimize time when traveling. Think beyond just the intended meeting for site visits by researching and suggesting additional meetings or engagements that can be combined to optimize travel plans. Be responsive 24x7 for the few emergencies that may occur Oversee the collection and consolidation of materials for the Board of Directors and other important engagements Orchestrate a variety of team event arrangements both onsite and offsite Develop documents and correspondence (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) to support or jump-start CMO’s work Be a role model and provide leadership, training, and inspiration for other administrative staff – how do we continue to add value? What can we do to optimize operations within the department? Ensure a sense of standard, coverage, and community among group administrative assistants Collaborate extensively to provide quality support for Finance and other executives to ensure uninterrupted coverage and a consistent customer support approach Liaise with IT and other application providers to ensure current understanding of productivity tools, WebEx, EC, etc. Organize team repositories for documents, videos, articles Be tech-savvy in order not to rely on IT to keep CMO’s office running smoothly Be curious about how the Finance department and company work. Be a perceptive, systemic thinker with an eye for detail and the motivation to help, collaborate, optimize and drive for the best results. Represent the office of the CMO and Synopsys with integrity, confidence in a welcoming and helpful demeanor. Qualifications Bachelor of Business Administration desirable. MBA is a potential plus that can broaden the breadth of the role and opportunity for impact 5-7 years of experience supporting (public company) senior executive (GM, CMO, GC, CEO) 10 plus years of high-tech industry experience (software and/or semi-conductor experience preferred) Excellent written and presentation preparation skills Operations experience (budgets, planning, process, collaboration tools, project management) Self-starter with exceptional project and time management skills. The ability to multitask and prioritize across projects to meet deadlines Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint super-user is a plus Masterful problem-solver and an organizational whiz with great attention to detail Passion for marketing and contributing to an innovative organization This is an in-office position, based in Sunnyvale, CA. As part of the Synopsys IP group you’ll be responsible for developing, designing and implementing sub-systems in a FPGA. We are looking for an outstanding and self-starter Hardware Engineer to join our innovative USB R&D group. This position requires solid knowledge of FPGA Design & Verification, HW validation & debug, and excellent communication skills, as well as being a team player. Responsibilities RTL and FPGA design, implementation and timing closure using Xilinx & Synopsys development tools. Verify the design in simulation using Verilog, SystemVerilog, UVM (Universal Verification Methodology). Create user documentation. Create test plans for USB IP. Bringup and validate the design in the lab & generate test reports. Perform HW validation tasks and debug IPs. Read, understand and modify SW drivers and scripts. Qualifications Sound understanding and experience in FPGA Design. Sound understanding and experience in Verilog/SystemVerilog for RTL & Verification. Experience in the following protocols: AXI, USB, and PCIe (Highly desired) Experience using lab equipment, such as protocol analyzers, oscilloscopes and logic analyzer. Experience with AMBA/USB/PCIe VIP. Experience developing and integrating IPs such as PCIE, USB, and DDR Experience in Linux, C, C++, and scripting languages (Perl, Python, TCL) (Highly desired) Experience in data structures and algorithms Experience in Universal Verification Methodology (UVM) (Highly desired). Understanding of ASIC/FPGA design flow and circuit design practices. Understanding and experience in mixed-signal PCB schematics and layout. Motivated self-starter. Leadership skills and ability to effectively work in a team environment. Excellent problem-solving skills and judgment. Follow-up and monitoring skills. Excellent written and oral presentation skills.Educational/Experience Requirements: Min B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Group Dir, Applications Engineering At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We’re looking for a Group Director of Application Engineering to join the team. This is an exciting opportunity to drive a high-performing applications engineering team that drives the adoption of our industry-leading tools and flows used in chip design. The Director of Application Engineering will play a critical role in our Field Organization enabling the success of our customers designing advanced chips on leading-edge process technologies. You will steer a team that is enabling some of our top customers with a portfolio of advanced tools and flows to deliver innovative, high-quality solutions in both a pre-sale and post-sale capacity. You will work closely with customers and multiple internal groups including R&D, product engineering, program management, and sales teams to drive alignment, define initiatives, and deliver growth through customer success. Key Qualifications A self-directed and energetic team leader with excellent oral and written communication skills. Direct knowledge of the chip design process, including customer needs, and challenges Ability to interact with and influence a wide variety of customers and functional groups, including engineering, marketing, and sales Proven ability to lead and manage at senior levels with or without direct authority Ability to persuade key decision-makers and manage strategic communication Influential leader, interacting internally and externally with executive-level management Networker with key contacts outside own area of expertise MSEE or equivalent required with minimum of 15+ years of relevant semiconductor or EDA industry experience Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. You will steer a team that is enabling some of our top customers with a portfolio of advanced tools and flows to deliver innovative, high-quality solutions in both a pre-sale and post-sale capacity. You will work closely with customers and multiple internal groups including R&D, product engineering, program management, and sales teams to drive alignment, define initiatives, and deliver growth through customer success. Key Qualifications A self-directed and energetic team leader with excellent oral and written communication skills. Direct knowledge of the chip design process, including customer needs, and challenges Ability to interact with and influence a wide variety of customers and functional groups, including engineering, marketing, and sales Proven ability to lead and manage at senior levels with or without direct authority Ability to persuade key decision-makers and manage strategic communication Influential leader, interacting internally and externally with executive-level management Networker with key contacts outside own area of expertise MSEE or equivalent required with minimum of 15+ years of relevant semiconductor or EDA industry experience Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. A successful candidate will join the Machine Learning Center of Excellence (ML CoE) team and be responsible for creating AI-based design optimization applications for cutting-edge chip design. The AI-based applications are to drive optimal decisions by autonomously exploring a very large search space at architectural-, micro-architectural-, RTL-, circuit-, and physical design-levels. By leveraging the success of DSO.ai, the world first AI application for chip design, the candidate will bring the AI-based optimization capabilities into a variety of EDA tools that go beyond physical implementation. The candidate will work broadly with product groups across Synopsys, taking on a leading role in working independently on pathfinding new chip design methodologies, demonstrating new concepts, and productizing them in collaboration with the broader team. A mature level of broad technical understanding of EDA flows as well as a self -driven personality and good communication skills, to foster broad collaboration, is expected Key Qualifications Advanced EDA flow automation across multiple tools, using Perl/Python/Tcl, or shell scripts Knowledge of best practices with respect to overall chip design Expertise in at least one area of chip design at the architectural-, micro-architectural-, RTL-, circuit-, and physical design-level. Identify bottlenecks and propose solutions for enhancing power, performance, and area in chip design Preferred Experience Knowledge of industry standard RTL design, synthesis, pnr, design verification, ATPG, custom-circuit design, and signoff flows. Knowledge of low power design techniques and their trade-offs Knowledge of computer architecture Knowledge of machine learning BS/MS/Phd in EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 15+ years of experience. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability
