The Design Specialist Solutions Engineer for GPU designs will be an expert in physical design methodologies and drive reference flow development & adoption for high performance cores using the latest technology nodes. The solutions engineer role includes the following responsibilities : Development of reference methodologies for the latest and greatest high performance graphics cores across the start-of-the-art technology nodes Successful deployment of reference flows across multiple customers helping them to achieve superior Power/Performance/Area targets Influencing product definition and direction of R&D by providing feedback regarding customer challenges and tool experiences Actively participating in account strategy & conducting hands-on competitive benchmarks to increase the Synopsys tool usage by working with Sales and AEs The Solutions Engineer for Graphics design must be adept at diagnosing and resolving technical challenges in the physical design space. Educational/Experience Requirements MSEE with hands-on experience in all aspects of physical design including data preparation, placement, clock tree synthesis, routing, floorplanning, timing and DRC closure, and low power physical implementation. Experience with modern technology nodes (16nm and below) is required. Experience with library preparation and techfiles is desirable. Must possess at least three years of recent hands on experience in the place & route domain using Synopsys or competing Place&Route tools (Fusion Compiler experience is preferred). Knowledge of areas ASIC implementation domains outside of place & route, including logic synthesis, static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS and power analysis is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. Previous experience working with customers is a strong plus. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex and a strong desire to help customers exploit new technologies is required Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Staff Application Engineer – Inverse Lithography Technology (ILT) This position holds product/applications engineering responsibilities within the Inverse Lithography Technology (ILT) mask synthesis product team. ILT is the most advance mask solver used by many leading-edge wafer fab companies. We are seeking an experienced and creative Engineer with significant OPC/RET, lithography and software scripting experience to help develop new RET/AF/ILT methods and to provide hands-on expert product engineering support for RET/AF/ILT tool usage. Responsibilities include Work with multi-functional and across company teams (R&D, QA & related applications team) to define and evaluate mask synthesis products and technologies for customer introduction and long-term roadmap deployment Work with key customers and field support teams to resolve difficult problems and to develop requirements for future RET/AF/ILT needs. Prototype and explore new RET/AF/ILT solution methods to guide development efforts Work with internal teams and direct training of external customers We desire a candidate with extensive model-based OPC/RET/verification, rule-based geometry processing and software scripting experience in advanced technologies to ensure new development work is optimal for leading-edge customers. Skills and experience should include: MS (or equivalent experience) in electrical engineering, material science or physics, PhD preferred. 10+ years of engineering experience Very good knowledge of photolithography, OPC/RET principles, UNIX/Linux, and Python Expert user of RET/AF/ILT software to understand current capability and limitations Proficiency in mask OPC/ILT methodologies and technologies, with demonstrated experience in the complete mask tape out cycle. Capability to lead multi-functional teams effectively. Self-motivated, attention to detail, and good communication skills. Strong problem-solving skills required with the ability to work in a fast paced and distributed team environment. Moderate travel (~10%) will be needed (to internal offices in the USA but also to customer sites overseas). The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. IO Validation R&D Engineer This position is an R&D role for silicon validation of I/O circuits and IP. As a leader the engineer will create test plans, supervise hardware specification and design, and plan both ATE tester based testing and bench top testing. They will collaborate with the IO design team to plan new test chips and matching hardware, working with teams based in India, Malaysia and California. The successful candidate will supervise IP qualification tests to collect, examine and report measurement data. Data will be gathered on ATE and lab bench-top equipment. Duties Supervise and perform silicon qualification, validation, characterization, debug of IO circuits such as GPIO, I2C, LVDS and other IO standards. Test program generation and data collection on ATE testers such as Advantest 93K; Automation of bench top lab equipment using Python, LabView or other tools. Validate reliability of IP by performing various tests such as HBM, CDM, Latch-up and HTOL. Generate characterization reports and presentations showing IP performance and functionality. Develop, standardize, and improve silicon test methodologies. Address customer issues by providing detailed debug, guidance, and drive issues to resolution. Job Requirements Electrical or Computer Engineering degree; Experience with scripting and programming languages such as Matlab, Python, Visual Basic, Verilog, TCL, PERL; Experience in operating test instruments and making precision measurements with lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, pattern generators, data acquisition systems; Deep knowledge of IO testing; Ability to debug/resolve complex silicon problems/issues, attention to detail, excellent organization and communication skills, self-motivation; Hands-on lab/debug experience with validating of digital / analog blocks; Familiarity with reading and troubleshooting board schematics and layouts. Knowledge of hardware/PCB design; Analog IC knowledge an asset but not mandatory; Previous knowledge of ATE programing is a plus. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. In this role, the Program Manager manages IP development for key programs and successfully executes the programs against established commitments. Acts as the focal point of contact and manages all external and internal communications to cross-functional teams spanning geographical and organizational boundaries. Plans and directs schedules; identifies and escalates issues; drives problems to resolution; identifies and manages risk. Programs may include new development or porting of different IPs to different foundry process technology nodes. The PMO at Synopsys works closely with various teams to meet customer-specific IP development requirements. We work cross-functionally with internal development teams (Sales, Marketing, FAE, CAE, and R&D) and have exposure and visibility on a global scale throughout the organization. In this role, the program manager acts as the main interface of Synopsys with our tier one customers and within our internal development teams to ensure we deliver to our customer requirements to meet their SOC goals and targets. The position requires a technical understanding of analog and digital SOC design flows and methodologies, IC manufacturing process, and process technologies. Experience with embedded memory and standard cell design is a plus but not required. Position Requirements BSEE or equivalent with 5 to 10+ years of relevant experience. Candidate must have a solid background and proven track record in program management in analog/digital SOC design. Understanding IC manufacturing, process technology, design flow and sign off process is a must. Having experience in, dealing with, and communicating at different levels of the organization is also key to this position as it’s a highly visible role. Exceptional verbal/written communication, leadership, interpersonal, and teamwork skills are required to succeed in this role. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. In this role, the Program Manager manages IP development for key programs and successfully executes the programs against established commitments. Acts as the focal point of contact and manages all external and internal communications to cross-functional teams spanning geographical and organizational boundaries. Plans and directs schedules; identifies and escalates issues; drives problems to resolution; identifies and manages risk. Programs may include new development or porting of different IPs to different foundry process technology nodes. The PMO at Synopsys works closely with various teams to meet customer-specific IP development requirements. We work cross-functionally with internal development teams (Sales, Marketing, FAE, CAE, and R&D) and have exposure and visibility on a global scale throughout the organization. In this role, the program manager acts as the main interface of Synopsys with our tier one customers and within our internal development teams to ensure we deliver to our customer requirements to meet their SOC goals and targets. The position requires a technical understanding of analog and digital SOC design flows and methodologies, IC manufacturing process, and process technologies. Understanding IC manufacturing, process technology, design flow and sign off process is a must. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. In this role, the Program Manager manages IP development for key programs and successfully executes the programs against established commitments. Acts as the focal point of contact and manages all external and internal communications to cross-functional teams spanning geographical and organizational boundaries. Plans and directs schedules; identifies and escalates issues; drives problems to resolution; identifies and manages risk. Programs may include new development or porting of different IPs to different foundry process technology nodes. The PMO at Synopsys works closely with various teams to meet customer-specific IP development requirements. We work cross-functionally with internal development teams (Sales, Marketing, FAE, CAE, and R&D) and have exposure and visibility on a global scale throughout the organization. In this role, the program manager acts as the main interface of Synopsys with our tier one customers and within our internal development teams to ensure we deliver to our customer requirements to meet their SOC goals and targets. The position requires a technical understanding of analog and digital SOC design flows and methodologies, IC manufacturing process, and process technologies. Experience with embedded memory and standard cell design is a plus but not required. Position Requirements BSEE or equivalent with 5 to 10+ years of relevant experience. Candidate must have a solid background and proven track record in program management in analog/digital SOC design. Understanding IC manufacturing, process technology, design flow and sign off process is a must. Having experience in, dealing with, and communicating at different levels of the organization is also key to this position as it’s a highly visible role. Exceptional verbal/written communication, leadership, interpersonal, and teamwork skills are required to succeed in this role. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2021 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . MANAGER APPLICATION SECURITY Join the team as our next Manager Application Security. We are seeking a manager that is responsible for providing understanding and best practices around application security. Experienced in reviewing customer applications, configuring them to work with our product portfolio, examining potential threats and vulnerabilities, creating proof of concepts, and guiding our customers on security risks and how to resolve them. Responsibilities Provide leadership and strategy on all matters related to identifying and remediation of application vulnerabilities Develop relationships with teams across engineering and products to understand their priorities, provide feedback to help with scale, and help prioritize enhancements and triage bugs Effectively communicate vulnerability risks and remediation methods to business owners, developers, and up to the executive level Manage, develop, and train staff; develop and monitor goals; conduct annual performance reviews, and administers salaries for the staff Plan, track, and report on the successful delivery of high impact and highly cross-functional security programs and initiatives Demonstrate a sense of urgency and ownership to drive solutions and tasks to completion Required 5+ years of management or team lead in security testing experience Demonstrate subject matter understanding with common web application vulnerabilities, such as the OWASP Top 10 and business logic flaws; ability to explain all vulnerabilities and weaknesses and discuss effective defensive techniques Proven experience building and leading diverse security teams at a SaaS based company Proven track record of managing and developing career paths for high functioning application security engineering teams Experience with Burp Suite, Salesforce, Tableau, Jira, Confluence Desired Relevant Industry/Cyber Security Certification. Practical experience with a Scripting Language – RegEx, JS, Perl, C#, C, C++ Certified in at least one or more of the following certifications: CISSP, SANS Certifications, OCSP, Programming Certifications or similar Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Location: Can work remotely in US Employment Type: Full Time Salaried Employee Normal Working Hours: Mon-Fri, 8 hours/day, 40 hours per week, exempt Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 (6 years in a row) in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Responsibilities The Manager of Security Consulting requires a unique mix of planning, leadership, management, and consulting skills. You are accountable for scoping/pricing engagements, successful project delivery, quality management, profitability, customer satisfaction, and employee management, with overall responsibility for specific growth annually within the account base. In this role you will: Provide direct contribution to the transformation of processes, technology platforms, training methods, staff growth, and organizational culture to enable continued market leadership in application security testing Develop strong and lasting relationships with clients, actively look for opportunity during delivery to grow follow-on work to clients, assist in scoping/pricing new business, ensure engagements are properly executed, and serve as an effective escalation point for client issues and problems on engagements Provide client support to multiple clients from service delivery, periodic client reviews, and follow through/closeout of engagements Work in collaboration with the technology leadership to grow staff capability, provide feedback on delivery execution runbooks, tooling, and value derivation by clients Balance client services with effective resource utilization in partnership with the resource management organization and technology practice leaders Possess sufficient knowledge in applications security so as to guide service execution so as to be seen by the client as an industry expert, conduct scoping/pricing where necessary, and be able to present our position with confidence and credibility Instill a purpose of driving client satisfaction in the oversight of engagements Provide motivation, career development, and guidance to a diverse team of consultants in the organization as well as providing mentorship to other staff where necessary Oversee the accuracy, completeness, and compliance to internal and external expectations of the project deliverables Ensure the completion of internal processes required to effectively manage the business Participate in the transformation of processes, measurements, metrics as needed to optimize the business for scale and growth Participate in the adaptation of service definitions and processes to invent new market solutions and delivery methods to emerging market trends Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, or related technical discipline Work experience managing cyber security consultants, professional services, or similar. Involvement in scoping/selling consulting services, with some experience selling cyber security consulting services (preferably application security but not required) Confident and effective relationship builder Sufficient application security knowledge to effectively design our services solutions for specific client needs and ability to estimate scope/cost/pricing Understanding of software development processes, technologies, architectures, and practices, and software risk management Willingness to travel as needed Benefits Work From Home Competitive Total Compensation Annual Performance Bonus Paid Vacation and Wellness Days Group Retirement Savings Plans and Employer Contributions ESPP Comprehensive Health Benefits Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. The Manager of Product Marketing is accountable for pre-sales technical marketing programs for specific product(s) or product line(s) to establish, enhance, or distinguish product placement within the competitive arena. Drives technical engagements for the product, work with technical teams to understand, explain and position the product to solve customer needs. Support the development of effective sales collateral, pricing and packaging strategies, competitive analysis, product roll out and positioning, and technical sales training. Interacts with customers, R&D, and Application Engineering teams and sets product plans in the marketplace. Makes technical presentations on the product(s). Creates and maintains technical presentation material, white papers, and other related collateral. Responsibilities Uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways Exercises a high level of independent judgment and interpretation in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria to obtain results Performs in project leadership role Drives programs and business initiatives Establishes methods and procedures on new assignments and projects Offers new solutions or direction and can encourage and motivate others to support new solution or direction May advise senior management on specialized technical or business issues May coordinate activities of other people as a team lead Represents the organization as the primary contact on business unit and/or company-wide projects for products or markets under their responsibility Interacts with management and senior external personnel on matters requiring coordination across internal groups Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise Requirements Requires a minimum of 5+ years of related experience. At this level, post-graduate coursework or knowledge base equivalent may be desirable. Relevant experience in a technical marketing role for software products in the high-tech industry Technical orientation and knowledge of ASIC design process Technical expertise in USB, PCIe PHYs and protocols, their applications and use cases Ability to understand customer motivation, articulate advantages of existing products and define future products that consist competitive advantage for the target applications. Innovative energetic manager with a definitive style and attentiveness to current and future customer and market trends Proven ability to work in a matrix environment Track record of launching, managing and growing products Exceptional communication skills Ability to work in collaborative environment, network with industry leaders that help define the future of the industry under their product domain Experience in the EDA industry is preferred At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

General Responsibilities This is a position that requires you have a unique blend of business development, account management, and deep technical knowledge. As Synopsys engages with clients to propose and deliver our software security services and products, you will have direct responsibility for developing strong and lasting relationships with clients. You will also be effectively identifying and selling follow-on work to clients, assisting sales in selling new business to clients, ensuring contracts are properly managed and serving as an effective escalation point for client issues and problems on engagements. Qualifications & Experience Solid experience with software development or software application security Thorough knowledge of SDLC Sufficient applications security knowledge to effectively communicate the value of our services to the client and translate that to revenue Understanding of software development processes, technologies, architectures, and practices, and software risk management Proven ability to deliver solution strategies and implementations to clients Superior and highly effective client interface skills Demonstrated understanding and ability to manage to Time & Material, Cost Plus, and Fix-Priced engagements Experience running small consulting/delivery teams and project execution Ability to create presentations, proposals and SOWs Written communication skills include: formal documentation, statements of work, proposals, sources sought and request for information responses, white papers, case studies Expected to manage client profitability and revenue growth. Managed Revenue of $1.5+ million annually Client billability for this position will be at approximately 40-60% Willingness to travel (up to 30%) Education and Certifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent. Master’s Degree preferred Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), recognizing our vision and ability to execute. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most robust products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate deficiencies across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Qualifications & Experience Solid experience with software development or software application security Thorough knowledge of SDLC Sufficient applications security knowledge to effectively communicate the value of our services to the client and translate that to revenue Understanding of software development processes, technologies, architectures, and practices, and software risk management Proven ability to deliver solution strategies and implementations to clients Superior and highly effective client interface skills Demonstrated understanding and ability to manage to Time & Material, Cost Plus, and Fix-Priced engagements Experience running small consulting/delivery teams and project execution Ability to create presentations, proposals and SOWs Written communication skills include: formal documentation, statements of work, proposals, sources sought and request for information responses, white papers, case studies Expected to manage client profitability and revenue growth. Managed Revenue of $1.5+ million annually Client billability for this position will be at approximately 40-60% Willingness to travel (up to 30%) Education and Certifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent. Master’s Degree preferred Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), recognizing our vision and ability to execute. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most robust products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate deficiencies across their entire SDLC. Synopsys is looking for a passionate candidate to join our enterprise and marketing communications team. In this role, you will develop and execute a wide range of impactful marketing programs for Synopsys' EDA products. You have experience utilizing all elements of the marketing mix including public relations, web, digital, e-marketing, social media, and more to reach the desired audience. A strong understanding of the dynamic semiconductor industry and its technologies are required Responsibilities Include Driving impactful product messaging and positioning Developing communication strategies that align with business unit goals Development of articles, success stories, press releases, web, e-marketing and more Presentation creation Developing and executing social media campaigns Metrics reporting, data analysis and insights Managing new product launches Executing sales enablement campaigns Required Skills High-energy, results-driven individual with a minimum of 5 years experience Product marketing or marketing communications experience Knowledge of digital design and verification tools Ability to translate highly complex technical content into crisp messaging Planning and strategy development to yield measurable results Ability to exercise independent judgement Strong aptitude to work collaboratively with cross-functional business teams Fluency with Microsoft Office applications Bachelor’s degree Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential. This hybrid position is preferably based in Mountain View, CA. Ability to be on-site 2-3 days per week. Other locations negotiable. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

The Business Applications team is looking for a Master Data Management Architect. The team is responsible to analyze, design, develop, implement, and support several key business applications, Integrations, Analytics and middleware services. We collaborate with several key business owners in HR, Payroll, Legal, Marketing, Finance, Sales, Order Management, Engineering, Go To Market and other stake holders. Your Responsibilities Accountable for the development, maintenance, and enhancement of business applications. Collaborates with customers, IT colleagues, and other stakeholders. Identify user requirements, assesses available technologies and recommends solution options. Provides research and programming expertise along with the design and development of business applications. Formulates and defines application scope and priorities to solve business issues. Prepares detailed specifications for configuration and execution of large scape projects. Design, code, test, debug, and documents programs and processes. Monitors and reports statuses of project activities. Identify issues that inhibit meeting project goals and implements corrective actions.Requirements: Typically requires a minimum of 5+ years of related experience on Informatica MDM platform. Knowledge of.NET and Java based web applications or equivalent. Knowledge of Dell Boomi Integration and API Platform and microservices is a plus. Possesses a full knowledge of specialization area plus working knowledge of multiple related areas. Autonomously resolves a wide range of issues on a regular basis. Performs in project leadership role. Contributes to complex aspects of a project. Establishes and develops approach to solutions. Provides regular updates to manager on project status. Represents the organization on business unit and/or company-wide projects. Guides more junior peers with aspects of their job. Frequently networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community

Digital Design business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance. We eliminate months off their project schedules. Duties And Responsibilities Responsible for designing and developing next generation ECO (engineering change order) software. Develops software tools including operating systems, compilers, routers, networks, utilities, databases and internet-related tools, etc. Establishes hardware compatibility and/or influences hardware design. Works on problems of diverse scope where research of data requires evaluation of various factors. Assignments are given in the form of targets. Exercises judgment within broadly defined practices and policies in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Expected to review project areas, refine problem descriptions, and develop novel technical solutions. Designs and implements sophisticated algorithms to solve complex problems. Write paper for technical conferences. Must be very knowledgeable in one technical area. Requirements BS in EE/CS with 18+ years of relevant experience, MS with 15+ years of relevant experience in programming software for operating systems, utilizing machine assembly and/or job control languages, and thorough understanding of software capabilities. Experience in the development of complex software projects, familiarity with C/C++ coding, and a background in data structures and algorithms. It is essential that you have a desires to learn and explore new technologies and are able to demonstrate good problem-solving skills. Prior experience of static timing analysis, netlist optimization, and physical synthesis flow is required. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. Emulation has become indispensable part of SoC designs verification with growing design size and complexity. Synopsys is uniquely positioned to offer the most complete verification, emulation, and prototyping solution in the market today. This Applications Engineer position offers a unique opportunity to work in both simulation and emulation. The job responsibilities involve exploration of customer’s current verification methodology, defining and developing solutions that fit in between simulation and emulation. In addition to end-to-end ownership of key accounts/initiatives, the position requires strong focus on product development and close collaboration with R&D teams. In a customer facing role, the Applications Engineer drives product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive platform benchmarking. You own key on-going engagement and serve as single key contact for all technical challenges seen on specific account/project. In a product facing role, Applications Engineer drives product development with R&D based on their insight into the customers' needs and Issues. You would be responsible for defining requirement specs, ramping up product validation team, product development and customer delivery tracking, internal technical evaluations, trainings etc. Leveraging your close interaction with customers, R&D, Marketing, and Sales teams, you will be able to demonstrate the differentiated emulation/verification environment influencing customer action for Synopsys ZeBu HW adoption. Requirements Minimum 12 years of experience in ASIC design and methodology with a good understanding of SystemVerilog/Verilog/VHDL. Direct experience in SoC design verification/validation using either simulation or emulation or both. Good understanding of RTL, testbench, synthesis, mapping RTL to Xilinx FPGA based platform, Unix/Linux development environment. Good understanding of synthesis and timing analysis concepts Knowledge of C/C++ and scripting languages like Tcl, Python is a plus Excellent customer interface, negotiation, communication and planning skills. Motivated to help customers achieve their verification/validation goals. Sound trouble shooting and problem-solving skills. Ability to lead high complexity technical tasks spread across multiple teams. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Synopsys Inc. is looking for a full-time candidate to work on the industry's leading and fastest emulation system, Zebu Server, which offers the industry's largest design capacity, supporting SOC chips as large as 10 billion gates based on high-density FPGA technology. In Zebu emulation flow, the design under test is partitioned into multiple parts, each of which is compiled into a low-level binary bit-stream that can be downloaded and run on an underlying FPGA in the emulation hardware. Someone that fills this position will work in a global multi-site team specializing in areas such as logic partitioning, placement and routing, pin assignment, static timing analysis, and timing performance optimization to design and develop the next-generation emulation backend technologies used in Zebu software tools. The responsibilities include innovating good ideas to solve challenging practical problems, developing a software program based on the selected innovative idea, and demonstrating its effectiveness of it by running benchmarking designs and comparing the results. Requirements BS in CS/EE with at least 15 years of relevant experience, MS with at least 10 years of relevant experience, or related Ph.D. with at least 7 years of relevant experience. Experience with some/all of the EDA technologies like Partitioning, Placement, Routing, Physical Synthesis, and Timing for FPGAs or ASICs. Industrial experience in software development for CAD systems. Thorough familiarity with commercial software development. Experience in the development of complex software projects involving multiple project teams. Experience developing software in C/C++, with a proven background in data structures and algorithm development. Knowledge of parallel processing including multi-threaded applications. Experience with Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence (ML/AI) techniques a plus. Ability to motivate engineers, to arbitrate between conflicting demands, and to deliver quality software on time. You will be a member of the Advanced Node Methodology Pathfinding team which is responsible for rapid (Power, Performance, Area) PPA closure on high-performance designs, using Fusion Compiler/IC Compiler II. This is an individual contributor role, where you would be working very closely with R&D and Foundry Partners, and should be able to isolate potential issues to help enhance the algorithms to greatly improve PPA and Runtime for the customer’s specific designs. We are seeking someone who will be able to connect the dots between the customer’s design needs, PPA closure, and the underlying capabilities of the EDA engines. Responsibilities Working closely with the R&D and Foundry Partners on bleeding edge of technology, and help enhance EDA engines for improved PPA in Fusion Compiler/ICC2. Pathfinding: Hands-on analysis on engine issues and providing quick solutions (usually TCL/Perl prototypes) to show that EDA engines can be extended to meet the Foundry/customer’s needs. Engaging with early new node customers and supporting the deployment of latest technologies. Requirements BS/MS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related discipline. Desired Skills RTL2GDS flow and methodology specialist with 15+ years of EDA product development/deployment, full-flow benchmarking, design tapeout experience. Strong understanding of advanced node technologies (7nm, 5nm, 3nm). Experience on high performance cores would be a plus. Strong understanding of Physical design engines (Placement, Optimization, Routing) and how they interact with each other to deliver high quality QoR (Quality of Result). Ability to be proactive and have a strategic mindset in addition to having tactical problem-solving experience. Leadership skills to drive solutions within R&D and help implement enhancements in ICC2 and Fusion Compiler.

Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Member of Technical Staff Responsibilities Candidate would oversee the complete design of large full custom analog mixed signal layout blocks. Working collaboratively with circuit design engineers to meet product schedules. Driving the creation from the beginning floor planning stage to routing, physical verification (LVS/DRC/ERC), running in-house quality checks and final checklist. Will need to direct and review work from other team members locally and across sites giving daily guidance and feedback. Will also need to pass on weekly status to the program managers. The candidate would also contribute to the overall development of layout flows, automation and methodology within the layout organization. Requirements Typically requires a minimum of 15+ years of related experience. Has a solid desire to learn and explore advanced deep submicron technology nodes. Demonstrates good investigation and problem-solving skills. Has good communication and documentation skills. Builds productive internal/external working relationships. Contacts are primarily within business unit and occasional organizational and external customer contacts on routine matters. Would need to work semi-autonomous and be able to direct and collaborate with remote layout resources. Must have a solid working knowledge of DRC, LVS and be able to debug results. Prior knowledge and proficiency of schematic driven layout editor tools such as Virtuoso XL or Custom Compiler SDL is required. Must be familiar with creating quality layout with consideration for device matching, DFM and current requirements (EMIR). Should be familiar with using foundry design rule manuals to debug DRC errors. Working knowledge of PERC, latch-up risks and related ESD components for I/O pads is highly desired. Other pluses are: TCL, SKILL, Python or other language scripting. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. NVM Architect (Principal Engineer) Job Description The Synopsys Non-Volatile-Memory team is looking for an experienced Memory Architect to lead the development of our next generation NVM IP. In this role, the candidate will have the opportunity to work on an extremely wide range of process technologies, ranging from complex BCD process nodes to 3nm and beyond. The ideal candidate must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills, independent and self-motivated, detail oriented, and able to work with a multi-national cross-functional teams. Responsibilities Lead NVM IP design in multiple technologies and foundries Architect CMOS-based non-volatile memory IP modules Conduct memory feasibility study including power, performance, and area estimate Working with layout designers with floor planning of memory array and analog blocks Working with Technology team to define Electrical Design Specification Supervise Layout and Design Engineers execution Providing technical assistances in resolving technical issues Work with Product Engineer to perform silicon verification, test and debug to analyze the new IP on silicon Perform block, chip and system-level simulation as needed Skills and Experience Required 20+ years of industry experience as a memory or non-volatile memory circuit designer Familiar with TestChip tapeout flow Demonstrated track record of leading successful NVM designs into high volume production Strong transistor level analog design and analysis with sense-amplifier, charge pump, high voltage regulator, and bandgap reference circuit design Good understanding of Non-Volatile Memory design, Memory architecture Strong knowledge of CMOS device physics Familiar with circuit simulation tools (HSIM, HSPICE, etc.) is required Must have prior experience with Custom Complier or equivalent tools (Schematic, and Layout edit) Experience with statistical design methodology (generating and analyzing Monte-Carlo results) Hands-on experience of Si debugging (FIB, micro-probing, post layout RC extraction, etc.) Experience with Low power design and power management circuitry Experience with FinFET design is a plus About Us Synopsys, Inc. (Nasdaq:SNPS) is the Silicon to Software™ partner for creative companies developing the electronic products and software applications we rely on every single day. As the world’s 15th largest software company, Synopsys has a long history of being a global leader in electronic design automation (EDA) and semiconductor IP and is also growing its leadership in software quality and security solutions. Whether you’re a system-on-chip (SoC) designer building advanced semiconductors, or a software developer writing applications that require the highest quality and security, Synopsys has the solutions needed to deliver exceptional, secure products for the era of connected everything. The company is headquartered in Mountain View, California, and has approximately 113 offices located throughout North America, South America, Europe, Japan, Asia and India. Since 1986, Synopsys has been at the heart of accelerating electronics innovation with engineers around the world having used Synopsys technology to successfully design and create billions of chips and systems that are found in the electronics that people rely on every single day. The Synopsys Optical Engineering Services team is part of Synopsys’ Optical Solutions Group. We are one of the most capable, influential, and experienced optical engineering service providers in the world. We have some of the most recognized and talented optical engineers serving an extensive list of clients engaged in some of the most challenging optical development projects on the planet. Synopsys’ Optical Solutions Group has an opening for a full time Senior Staff Optical Systems Engineer. The successful candidate should have excellent optical development, integration, and testing skills as well as substantive interdisciplinary engineering expertise. An ideal mix would include familiarity with CODE V, LightTools, and/or RSOFT tools as well as optical test/assembly, electro-optics/photonics, and understanding of optics and related disciplines in order to develop and allocate end-to-end performance functionality across entire sub-systems /systems. The optical systems engineering work will involve elements of first order layout/architecture, radiometry, signal to noise (S/N) analysis, electro-optical (E-O) analysis and specification, optical design, mechanical and optical tolerancing, performance testing, thermo-optical engineering, materials science, opto-mechanics, and cost-modeling over a broad range of commercial and government electro-optical-mechanical-firmware-software systems. We also have selected needs in the development of specialized software tools, and so candidates with these interests are encouraged to apply. We recognize no one candidate will likely cover all areas, but successful applicants should be interested in personally performing engineering analysis and development work in as many of the areas listed above as possible, and wish to continue to learn and grow in areas of lesser skill. Responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, providing the following services to external clients: Helping establish specifications for their hardware products Flowing system requirements down & up through interdisciplinary sub-systems via error budgets/analysis Performing trades analysis to establish cost effective system design direction Developing system performance models Developing system cost models Working with 3 rd party vendors to achieve required specifications/solutions Participation in design reviews and briefings Statement of work and proposal preparation The work may be as a sole contributor, or as a lead/chief engineer dependent upon client needs and candidate skills. Applicants Should Have The Following Qualifications A bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in optics or an optics-related field (e.g. physics or engineering) Several years’ experience using CODE V, LightTools, or similar optical/illumination design software. Ideal experience would be as a Lead Optical Systems Engineer with a career spanning a broad range of commercial and/or military/government systems and technologies Several years of prior interdisciplinary systems engineering work at various levels of project development, from formulation, through hardware specification, and on through design, model-based performance predictions, build, and test The ability to multi-task, working on several different projects simultaneously Articulate; excellent communication skills; works well with people A proven record of accomplishments with excellent references U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status is required, to enable the candidate access to ITAR-controlled projects. An existing U.S. Security Clearance or the desire to obtain a Clearance Join the leading provider of lens and illumination design and optimization software that has been delivering cutting edge optical system designs to its customers for over 50 years. Interact with some of the most talented engineers, marketers, and software developers in the optics field both inside the company and in our expansive customer community. Impact and extend the development our optical systems software. The Optical Solutions Group within Synopsys, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that provides competitive salary with excellent benefits.

Synopsys Optical Solutions Group (OSG) has an opening for a Technical Intern position in Software Development. CODE V and LightTools use state-of-the-art optical algorithms for the layout, design and analysis of image forming and Illumination optical systems. The RSoft Photonic Device Tools comprise the industry's widest portfolio of simulators and optimizers for passive and active photonic devices, and are integrated with Synopsys CODE V and LightTools for rigorous modeling of nano-textured optical structures and diffraction analysis. We are seeking a candidate who is self-motivated, enthusiastic about working with multiple software subsystems for support RSoft Photonics Device Tools, CODE V or LightTools and has a strong commitment to delivering excellent software on schedule. As a member of the Software Engineering team, the successful candidate will be responsible for helping full life cycle of OSG software development. Responsibilities Working closely with cross-functional software product teams on Developing robust and flexible software architecture and designs, delivering high quality code Performing and assisting in QA & testing Optical and Photonic software products Providing technical information to assist in the development of product documentation, authoring and participating in software design and code reviews Working closely with Technical Support to provide quick turnaround, high quality support to customers Required Qualifications 2+ years of optical systems modeling, analysis, and design experience using commercial optical or photonic design tools in an academic or professional environment with excellent references Currently pursuing a Bachelors, Masters or Ph.D. degree in Optics, Photonics, Optical Sciences, or other related technical discipline Strong software programming skills and proven programming experience with engineering projects Demonstrated ability to work on multiple concurrent projects and ability to work well in a team as well as independently Excellent written and verbal skills with the ability to communicate highly technical information to others in the company Experience In Any Of The Following Is a Plus Object-oriented Programming Experience C++ programming experience Optical Design Experience with RSoft Device, CODE V, LightTools or other software tools in the related fields Microsoft Visual Studio and Microsoft COM Programming Software processes such as Agile or Lean S/W Dev. Synopsys OSG is a world class, high tech optical software and optical engineering services organization with an international client base and offices worldwide. This position is for the successful candidate to start in May 2023 working either On-site in one of the Synopsys OSG office sites in the U.S. (Pasadena, CA, Marlborough, MA, Ossining, NY) or remotely in the U.S About Synopsys At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Synopsys is searching for a well-rounded individual to join the Payroll Team as the Payroll Lead. This is a hands-on payroll processing position responsible for all aspects of payroll in a high paced environment. The Payroll Lead should be able to collaborate, support, and train payroll staff by providing guidance and positive leadership skills. Have solid payroll knowledge and the ability to make effective decisions. In addition, the ideal candidate must have strong communication skills, be team oriented and have strong interpersonal/human relation skills with the ability to work effectively with all levels of management. Duties and Responsibilities Ensure timely payroll processing of the U.S. multistate bi-weekly payroll for 4800+ employees. Oversee the preparation and processing of the Canadian bi-weekly payroll. Serves as liaison to employees and with third party payroll vendors to ensure payroll processing accurately reflects company pay policies. Work closely with payroll staff members on payroll preparation activities. Coordinates third party payroll system implementations and upgrades. Support internal and external payroll audit requests Assist with payroll internal reporting requests. Handle stock related activities to include ESPP, NQ’s, and RSU special payroll runs. Ensure compliance with federal and state payroll requirements Stay current on payroll industry changes and updates. Assist manager with special projects/tasks as needed. Serve as a liaison with HR, IT, and Stock Assist in the reconciliation of bi-weekly, quarterly, and annual Payroll Tax Returns. Assist in Payroll Year End planning, processing and execution. Maintain and keep department policies and procedures updated. Assist with Tax items that includes amended tax returns as needed/required. Requirements BS and 8+ years of related experience, CPP or FPC certification a plus Knowledge and good understanding of Wage and Hour Laws, IRS and state regulations. Solid knowledge of multi state pay related practices and local ordinances. Exercise independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. Ability to work in a rapidly evolving and fast paced environment. Represents the organization on business unit and/or company-wide projects Guide and support more junior peers with aspects of their job. Ability to prioritize multiple projects, goals, and deadlines. Excellent inter-personal, verbal, and written communication skills. Strong organizational and planning skills. Ability to multi-task, is detail oriented, and solves problems analytically. Able to interact with different levels of management and people with different personality styles. Must be proficient working with large payroll systems that integrate or interface with other systems. Experience with ADP Vantage, ADP Reporting, SAP/ Success Factors, and ADP Time Management preferred. Must have strong Excel skills. At Synopsys, we are at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. In addition to EDA tools and IP, we provide different types of design services. Our System Solutions team enables our customers with end-to-end SoC designs in advanced technologies. Deliver tool flows. Provide expertise in design methodology creation and implementation. Create design flows and methodologies. Provide customer specific design assistance. Support RTL-to-GDSII implementation for blocks, sub-systems, and full SoCs. Execute full turnkey SoC designs from specification-to-parts. Our customers range from start-ups to industry leaders, commercial and government agencies. Our customers develop products for high-performance computing, automotive, aerospace & defense, and more. We have an immediate opening for a Staff SoC engineer specializing in physical implementation to join our team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be primarily responsible for hardening blocks, IPs, Subsystems and/or Top-level implementation and closure. Our engineers typically own end-end implementation which would require good understanding of Synthesis, Formal/Timing/EMIR closure, Floor planning, PG Grid while having deep technical understanding of P&R concepts, tools, and methodologies. The role may require you to work autonomously with customers providing design assistance or be part of a larger team owning full design implementation in a turnkey fashion. Experience in driving a technical team for block level implementation and/or hands-on experience with top-level implementation such as RTL/Bumps/PG etc. is desired. You will have the opportunity to drive large, cross-geographical RTL2GDS projects which requires good communication and problem solving and program management skills. Key Qualifications Must excel in Physical implementation, teamwork, customer focus, and communication Will have demonstrated experience as a senior technical contributor, planning and leading Physical Design teams Recent experience in advanced technology nodes (such as TSMC 7-/5-/3-nm, Samsung 7-/5-/4-/3-nm, etc.) SoC experience in high performance designs (Power, Performance) Demonstrate intimate knowledge of the Synopsys tools, flows and methodologies required to execute design projects Requirements: BS with 8-10 years relevant experience. MS with 7+ years relevant experience Desired Qualifications Experience in at least one or more of the areas such as HPC, AI/ML, Automotive, Aerospace and Defense is highly preferred Hand-on experience in design implementation doing physically aware synthesis, PG planning, Floor planning, MSCTS, Place and Route Good understanding of clock specifications, power intent/UPF, DFT requirements, constraints, and formal verification Deep understanding of Physical verification and EMIR issues and fixes Experience directing technical teams to execute RTL2GDS Experience creating work-around scripts and/or exposure to flow development Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Key Qualifications Must excel in Physical implementation, teamwork, customer focus, and communication Will have demonstrated experience as a senior technical contributor, planning and leading Physical Design teams Recent experience in advanced technology nodes (such as TSMC 7-/5-/3-nm, Samsung 7-/5-/4-/3-nm, etc.) SoC experience in high performance designs (Power, Performance) Demonstrate intimate knowledge of the Synopsys tools, flows and methodologies required to execute design projects Requirements: BS with 8-10 years relevant experience. MS with 7+ years relevant experience Desired Qualifications Experience in at least one or more of the areas such as HPC, AI/ML, Automotive, Aerospace and Defense is highly preferred Hand-on experience in design implementation doing physically aware synthesis, PG planning, Floor planning, MSCTS, Place and Route Good understanding of clock specifications, power intent/UPF, DFT requirements, constraints, and formal verification Deep understanding of Physical verification and EMIR issues and fixes Experience directing technical teams to execute RTL2GDS Experience creating work-around scripts and/or exposure to flow development Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. In addition to EDA tools and IP, we provide different types of design services. Our System Solutions team enables our customers with end-to-end SoC designs in advanced technologies. Deliver tool flows. Provide expertise in design methodology creation and implementation. Create design flows and methodologies. Provide customer specific design assistance. Support RTL-to-GDSII implementation for blocks, sub-systems, and full SoCs. Execute full turnkey SoC designs from specification-to-parts. Our customers range from start-ups to industry leaders, commercial and government agencies. Our customers develop products for high-performance computing, automotive, aerospace & defense, and more. We have an immediate opening for a Staff SoC engineer specializing in physical implementation to join our team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be primarily responsible for hardening blocks, IPs, Subsystems and/or Top-level implementation and closure. Our engineers typically own end-end implementation which would require good understanding of Synthesis, Formal/Timing/EMIR closure, Floor planning, PG Grid while having deep technical understanding of P&R concepts, tools, and methodologies. The role may require you to work autonomously with customers providing design assistance or be part of a larger team owning full design implementation in a turnkey fashion. Experience in driving a technical team for block level implementation and/or hands-on experience with top-level implementation such as RTL/Bumps/PG etc. is desired. You will have the opportunity to drive large, cross-geographical RTL2GDS projects which requires good communication and problem solving and program management skills. Job Description This role will be supporting procurement for the Hardware Manufacturing and Production team for a large volume product family. Below are some of the key tasks and responsibilities for this role performed on a weekly or daily basis: Coordinate with Management on raw material availability and purchasing plan. Responsible for managing and utilizing material requirements (MRP) to plan and execute purchase orders in system. Provide weekly updates and reports of output and performance to management. Constant communication with key stakeholders and management. Communicate and be able to track gaps in procurement process and schedule. Will be responsible for acquiring quotes directly from our vendors, suppliers, and contract manufacturers (CM’s), maintaining and updates order acknowledgement, ship dates and expediting where needed. Strong customer service skills, demonstrate judgement, tact, and diplomacy in dealing with internal and external customers Strong analytical skills to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions Research past due and or mismatch invoices and assist in reconciling invoices to PO’s for payment Ability to take initiative and work independently toward defined goals, maintain procurement goals at highest level Attention to details is a must Perform other related duties as assigned Requirements Must have 5-10 years SAP experience 3+ years’ experience with Hardware Procurement. Clear understanding of ISO and SOX requirements. Fluent in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Office, and ERP Reporting. Communicates effortlessly and efficiently at all levels Ability to adapt quickly (think outside of the box), problem solve and provide input on process and procedure enhancements.

jobTitle: Product Engineering Director, Custom Design Environment - 39684BR
jobDescription: Product Engineering Director The PE Director leads the Product Engineering function for the PrimeWave Design Environment, focusing on analog and signal integrity applications: Defines innovative new capabilities by developing product specifications in collaboration with customers and R&D. Leads, mentors, and develops a team of 3-5 Product Engineers; grows the team’s headcount and capability over time. Ensures feature success through the software lifecycle, including specification, testing and documentation Manages the product definition for major and minor releases Establishes close partnership with customers; communicates roadmaps; executes demos Develops workshops, reference flows and other product collateral Qualifications Extensive experience in product, application or R&D roles in design environments like Cadence Virtuoso, Synopsys Customer Compiler, Cadence ADE, Synopsys PrimeWave. Demonstrated understanding of simulation engine integration Experience in analog and mixed-signal environments. Signal Integrity is a plus. Ability to script in TCL or SKILL is a bonus. Experience in people management, team building and recruiting The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. Synopsys is hiring a Product Line Manager to support our Logic Libraries. The successful candidate will develop the resources, programs and processes to meet the financial plan for Synopsys’ Logic Libraries product line. The candidate will be responsible for the definition of business models, pricing and packaging strategies for the product line, overall positioning, and creation of internal and external collateral. The candidate will work closely with the Senior PMM and TMM, R&D team, Application Engineering (AE) organization, Sales and key customers to identify and drive strategic business opportunities. Responsibilities Definition and promotion of products that will result in sustainable growth within product line responsibilities Creation of strategic and tactical marketing plans Generation of marketing requirements documents Creation of product roadmaps New product rollouts TAM/SAM analyses Sales channel communication and training Demand creation/promotional initiatives Business development/customer meetings Promotion of product lines through participation in industry events such as panels, positioning articles, and seminars Requirements Energetic, results-driven individual Proven product management ability Excellent understanding of semiconductor design, logic libraries and their usage in ICs Deep insight into the interplay between logic libraries and the Synopsys design flow as applicable to hardening CPUs, GPUs, DSPs, and SoCs Experience with strategic market analysis and product planning in the EDA (Electronic Design Automation) industry Demonstrated marketing expertise in product positioning, value proposition articulation and creation of compelling collateral Proven ability to develop and manage relationships with key customers and strategic partners Track record of creative marketing programs and successfully launching new products Strong organizational and program management skills Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment Excellent oral and written communication skills Domestic and international travel required to meet with customers and support field organization. jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager - Silicon Lifecycle Management - 40643BR
jobDescription: The Product Marketing Manager is an accomplished achiever in driving marketing strategy, positioning, messaging and go-to-market success for Synopsys’ Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) family of solutions. This role offers a unique opportunity to play a principal role in architecting the development of SLM In-Field solutions and collaborating to shape the long-term business growth. The position requires a seasoned marketing professional with extensive experience in EDA solutions as well as the broader software industry. The successful candidate will have a proven track record in driving new products strategy and management. This role will be responsible for engaging customers and partners, identifying unmet needs and new profitable opportunities, gathering market requirements, defining product roadmap, leading the creation of relevant sales and marketing assets, and driving all other marketing activities. They will work with the leadership team to present proposals, review strategy and initiatives, and drive alignment on priorities. Responsibilities Define and execute strategic goals and drive go-to-market Create a compelling strategy, including solutions for public cloud and on-premises models Work with sales and product teams to develop pricing models, key messaging, and compelling value propositions Create sales collateral and tools that align with the buying process and help move prospects and customers through the sales cycle Work with sales/account teams, including assisting on calls, to drive adoptions and grow revenue Serve as a subject matter professional, creating and delivering presentations with confidence. Speak and present both internally and externally to influence and promote the story of the solution Requirements: 10+ years of combined experience in EDA and data analytics solutions – marketing, engineering or related field in the technology sector Understanding of the data analytics and related ML/AI technologies, and experience in transformations to cloud models by leveraging proven tools (e.g., SaaS) Familiarity with semiconductor / EDA industry and the overall ecosystem New product introduction (NPI) experience is preferred Excellent presentation, communications and interpersonal skills Ability to prioritize and manage your time to address many responsibilities in a fast-paced, professional environment High degree of initiative – capable of working unsupervised or in collaboration Motivated, reliable, responsive, customer-facing Ability to travel as required for role Proficient in Microsoft Office applications Our Hardware Analytics and Test business is all about testing and optimizing the value of silicon chips throughout their life. The TCAD team in our Silicon Engineering Group is all about developing physics-based simulators to accelerate the development of new semiconductor technologies, from leading edge digital and memory to analog/RF, power and opto-electronic devices. Our customers use our simulators to investigate new device concepts, often incorporating new materials and operational mechanisms, with the customer benefit of reducing technology development cost and time. We’re looking for a Sr TCAD Product Marketing Manager for Power Electronics to join the team. In this role you will be a key contributor to the TCAD team, combining your technical skills and business acumen to drive major product initiatives in power electronics. You will work cross-functionally with R&D, sales and applications engineering, and will function as a spokesperson for the TCAD product line in power electronics targeting the rapidly growing system applications in vehicle electrification, renewable energy, and smart grid. Key Job Functions Tracks industry trends, and identifies development priorities for Synopsys TCAD products Identifies and articulates product value propositions for Synopsys TCAD products Investigates power electronics industry landscape and synthesizes information as input for product development Defines product requirements, packaging and pricing strategies Creates collateral and communicates externally in customer meetings, seminars and other public events Supports sales in customer qualification, presenting solutions and in driving customer success and satisfaction in the usage of the Synopsys TCAD products Creates and tracks revenue forecasts, and prepares business cases for strategic planning; advises senior management on specialized technical or business issues Champions and develops innovation Champions projects, programs, and significant business initiatives that affect the organization's long-term goals and objectives Required Experience A minimum of 5 years of industry experience as a designer of power devices and circuits in Si, SiC or GaN technologies Proven ability to work in a matrix environment Excellent communication and public speaking skills Preferred Experience Relevant experience in a product marketing role for EDA products A track record of successfully launching, managing, and growing products Post-graduate degree in EE, Physics or Material Science Experience using TCAD tools, preferably Synopsys TCAD tools At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. The TCAD team in our Silicon Engineering Group is all about developing physics-based simulators to accelerate the development of new semiconductor technologies, from leading edge digital and memory to analog/RF, power and opto-electronic devices. Our customers use our simulators to investigate new device concepts, often incorporating new materials and operational mechanisms, with the customer benefit of reducing technology development cost and time. We’re looking for a Sr TCAD Product Marketing Manager for Power Electronics to join the team. In this role you will be a key contributor to the TCAD team, combining your technical skills and business acumen to drive major product initiatives in power electronics. You will work cross-functionally with R&D, sales and applications engineering, and will function as a spokesperson for the TCAD product line in power electronics targeting the rapidly growing system applications in vehicle electrification, renewable energy, and smart grid.
