Emulation and Prototyping has become indispensable part of SoC designs verification with growing design size and complexity. Synopsys is uniquely positioned to offer the most complete verification, emulation, and prototyping solution in the market today. The job responsibilities involve analysis of customer’s current verification methodology, deployment of Emulation and/or Prototyping solutions involved in-circuit and transaction level acceleration methodologies. This position requires one to lead and drive the technical Synopsys HAPS emulation environment benchmarks. This is complete technical solutions deployment engineering position targeted for end-to-end ownership of key accounts/projects. The prototyping application engineer drives product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive benchmarking. He/She plays an active role in account planning jointly with engineers deploying verification & prototyping tools and works as part of the account team to develop solutions to customer problems based on their insight into the customers' needs and issues. He/She owns key on-going engagements and serves as single key contact for all technical challenges seen on specific account/project. Leveraging your close interaction with customers, R&D, Marketing, and Sales teams, you will be able to demonstrate the differentiated prototyping environment influencing customer decision for HAPS adoption. Requirements Minimum 3-5 years of experience in Simulation, Emulation, Prototyping or ASIC design/verification using SystemVerilog/Verilog/VHDL required. Good knowledge of SoC design methodologies and technologies, with experience in the complete design validation cycle, driven to help customers achieve their emulation verification goals. Great communication skills and proven ability to help our customers and our organization be successful. Strong trouble shooting and problem-solving skills. Good knowledge of RTL synthesis, mapping RTL to Xilinx FPGA based platform, scripting language, Unix/Linux development environment. Working knowledge of C/C++/System C is a plus Knowledge of key protocol’s like PCIe, USB, Ethernet, AMBA, UART, SATA/SAS, DDR, flash memories and their usage in SoC environments is a plus. Direct experience in SoC design porting on emulators and/or prototyping solution, creating FPGA friendly interfaces, adoption of testbench environment and prototyping SoC environment w/ debug is highly preferred. Excellent customer interface, negotiation, communication and planning skills At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. This is an exciting opportunity to pursue impactful and rewarding work focusing on design IP system/workflow development and user empowerment. We develop and support systems and workflows that help IP design teams design and validate their IPs. Come join our team where there are opportunities abound for challenging software development, creation of helpful educational material, and the forging of new and constructive cross-functional relationships with a large and varied user base. There are many learning and growth opportunities, as well as chances to optimize and innovate (e.g., using machine learning) these critical systems/workflows. Duties and Responsibilities · Responsible for developing, integrating and releasing life-cycle automation tools for R&D teams. · Devise and deploy content (including documentation, short videos, etc.) that describes key system details and empower users to understand and optimally utilize software systems and workflows · Help forge and cultivate new relationships with IP design teams to help with system/workflow understanding and usage · Will work on complex problems where understanding of situations and/or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. · Expected to review project details, refine problem descriptions, and develop novel technical solutions. · Must provide and optimize system/utility support. Skills & Requirements · Able to collaborate with development teams and facilitate high-quality releases. · Hands-on experience with python programming, as well as shell/tcl/perl scripting. · Familiarity with IP design and integration methodologies would be helpful. · BE in CS/ECE/EEE with 3+ years or ME with 1+ years of relevant experience in python and shell/tcl/perl scripting · Significant experience with software integration and release, build tools (make/gmake), and on branching, merging, software configuration. · Experience with file management tools (Perforce, RCS, CVS, etc.). · Must have excellent multitasking, teamwork, and communication skills. · Jenkins, JIRA management and Verilog/VHDL experience is desirable. Every day, Quality Assurance (QA) activities are becoming increasingly complex and essential to software development. In this context, Synopsys has an exciting opportunity for a software engineer or software developer looking for a role as QA Engineer. This person will drive the implementation of standardized QA processes across different product teams. The role will include, but is not limited to, developing test automation strategies, creating performance and stress testing strategy, implanting test coverage across the systems, and leading quality improvements. The environment includes high performance computing, machine learning, and GPU usage. We are looking for a hands-on and technically qualified engineer, who is passionate about the quality aspect of software products. You should be comfortable with ambiguity, willing to roll-up your sleeves to perform the necessary definition, set-up tasks, and have a high level of ownership and accountability. Ideal candidates should have a proven track record of designing and creating tests strategies for complex software systems. Desired Skills & Experience Knowledge of both Agile and Water Fall development lifecycles and how they pertain to Quality Assurance Experience with all aspects of software testing (Functional, Integration, Unit, Regression, User Acceptance, and Release Management) Familiar with defect lifecycle tracking and participating in the day-to-day QA activities Experience reviewing requirements and functional specifications with multiple teams to ensure consistency and accuracy Able to work with other departmental staff to achieve QA and project team objectives Ability to concurrently manage multiple projects, often with changing requirements as dictated by product needs Must be detail oriented, reliable, and have the ability to work in both a team environment or alone with limited direction and supervision Proficient finding the root cause of defects in a complex software system Experience monitoring and reporting product testing status and metrics including code coverage, test plan completion, test cases completion and performance data Comfortable assessing risks and offer mitigation plans to ensure on-time delivery Has demonstrated a desire to pursue a career in QA engineering Requirements BS/MS in electrical/computer science engineering or equivalent, plus a minimum 3 years experience. Proficiency in programming and maintaining script in various languages (shells, Perl, Python) within a Unix/Linux environment. Familiar with developing QA automation frameworks and associated web infrastructure. Prior knowledge and experience testing EDA tools would be a benefit. As part of the Synopsys IP group you’ll be responsible for developing, designing and implementing sub-systems in a FPGA. We are looking for an outstanding and self-starter Hardware Engineer to join our innovative USB R&D group. This position requires solid knowledge of FPGA Design & Verification, HW validation & debug, and excellent communication skills, as well as being a team player. Responsibilities RTL and FPGA design, implementation and timing closure using Xilinx & Synopsys development tools. Verify the design in simulation using Verilog, SystemVerilog, UVM (Universal Verification Methodology). Create user documentation. Create test plans for USB IP. Bringup and validate the design in the lab & generate test reports. Perform HW validation tasks and debug IPs. Read, understand and modify SW drivers and scripts. Qualifications Sound understanding and experience in FPGA Design. Sound understanding and experience in Verilog/SystemVerilog for RTL & Verification. Experience in the following protocols: AXI, USB, and PCIe (Highly desired) Experience using lab equipment, such as protocol analyzers, oscilloscopes and logic analyzer. Experience with AMBA/USB/PCIe VIP. Experience developing and integrating IPs such as PCIE, USB, and DDR Experience in Linux, C, C++, and scripting languages (Perl, Python, TCL) (Highly desired) Experience in data structures and algorithms Experience in Universal Verification Methodology (UVM) (Highly desired). Understanding of ASIC/FPGA design flow and circuit design practices. Understanding and experience in mixed-signal PCB schematics and layout. Motivated self-starter. Leadership skills and ability to effectively work in a team environment. Excellent problem-solving skills and judgment. Follow-up and monitoring skills. Excellent written and oral presentation skills.Educational/Experience Requirements: Min B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field. We’re looking for a junior designer to join the DDR/HBM PHY architecture team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this position, you will be part of a team that plans and executes the design for the next-generation DDR and HBM PHYs in the Synopsys IP portfolio. The job entails working with senior engineers to evaluate ideas, draft specifications, and enable a larger team of design engineers bringing new ideas into silicon. You will leverage your cross-domain education in computer architecture, digital design, and analog design to create leading-edge products through running feasibility studies, coding trial designs, documenting ideas, and incorporating feedback throughout the design process. You will join a supportive, multi-person engineering team engaged in these activities across Synopsys’ DDR and HBM PHY development projects. Job Responsibilities Through the guidance of a senior engineer, determine the features and functions of ongoing and future designs to create best-in-class products Develop models representing the performance features of interface design sub-components Create descriptions, drawings, and documentation for interface design components Solve design execution problems tied to the product definition Perform feasibility studies through the evaluation of trial designs Document results, conclusions, and technical insights into performance, power, area, and functional parameters Interact and communicate with design teams performing digital design and verification, analog circuit design and verification, and layout design Evaluate how marketing desires and industry trends impact product design Key Qualifications And Experience Possesses a bachelor’s degree in computer or electrical engineering with industry experience through an internship or research project focused on computer architecture or a master’s degree in these fields Understands digital/analog mixed-signal system functional components, such as PLLs, DLLs, DACs, FIFOs, state machines, and logical pipelines Understands the fundamentals of analog circuit functions and parameters Able to generate documentation through written engineering specifications Able to communicate the functions of integrated circuit components Well-versed in Verilog coding and digital test bench creation Able to draw schematics, run SPICE simulations, and evaluate simulation results Able to work in a multi-site team environment to communicate ideas, understand problems, and seek solutions Able to work autonomously with high-level guidance Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

We’re looking for a junior designer to join the DDR/HBM PHY architecture team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this position, you will be part of a team that plans and executes the design for the next-generation DDR and HBM PHYs in the Synopsys IP portfolio. jobTitle: R&D Engineer, Senior - Custom Design Automation - 40757BR
jobDescription: Synopsys’ Custom Design Group is looking for a problem solver to join our teams in Sunnyvale, CA. This is a unique opportunity to join our team and contribute to innovative projects in the areas of routing for our Custom Layout solution. This team is at the forefront of market-shaping innovation and the role holds a broad set of challenging development responsibilities. In return, there is an excellent career growth path for people who excel in this technically engaging and rewarding environment. The candidate will join a highly experienced and talented software development team that is innovating new design flows to address the challenges of the ever-changing chip design world. Responsibilities include the design of complex algorithms, efficient data structures in an agile environment. You will investigate the EDA product/engine for applicability of AI/ML techniques in collaboration with the product/engine owners. Subsequently, you will provide consulting help to the product team with building and implementing the best-in-class Machine Learning based solutions that demonstrate the promised routability and performance improvements. Responsibilities The successful candidate will work in the Custom Design Automation R&D team to implement various routing product capabilities. Software design and architecture. Specify, design, implement and test in a complex development environment. Design and code review of peer work. A pragmatic approach to solving problems and collaboration Innovate and advance the state-of-the-art technology in place and route while working with industry-recognized experts Machine Learning-based P&R solution research and development Job requirements MS in CS/CE/EE degree. Experience in C/C++ programming skills along with excellent problem solving and algorithm development skills with a desire to learn and explore new technologies. Familiar with the software development process, debugging tools, and configuration management concepts. C/C++ Programming language, Shell, TCL, Perl, Python. Team-worker and great learner with CURIOSITY and PASSION! Proven communication and interpersonal skills. Prior experience or education in developing algorithms and software for physical design automation in the areas of routing strategies and/or experience with custom design is a plus. The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. We are seeking a talented R&D engineer, with expertise in scientific computing and software development, who will join the Synopsys TCAD team to develop mesh generation software for physics-based simulation platforms, including fast and accurate simulation of nano-scale semiconductor devices, interconnects and circuits consisting of many interconnected devices. Software Engineer - Emulation We’re looking for a smart Software Engineer to join the team building the Zebu family of emulators, the industry’s leading emulation systems. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you would be optimizing the performance of the fastest and highest capacity emulation systems in the world. You’d leverage your strong understanding of large-scale software development, combinatorial algorithms, physical design and/or timing analysis to further improve the performance achievable with the ZeBu compiler. You’d be working as part of an elite globally distributed team to design and develop the next generation emulation backend technologies to further optimize the performance and capacity of the ZeBu compiler. The ZeBu family of emulators can support SoC designs as large as 10 billion gates. In the ZeBu emulation flow, the design under test is partitioned into multiple parts, each of which is compiled into a low-level binary bit-stream that can be downloaded and run on an underlying FPGA in the emulation hardware. This compilation is done in a manner that achieves the highest possible hardware throughput for the testbenches used to validate the design. Key Qualifications You hold an MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering. You have 2+ years of software development experience in developing and testing large C++ applications in Unix-based environment. You have experience with efficient algorithm and data structure design. You have highly developed interpersonal skills and the ability to work well either in a team-based environment or independently. Preferred Experience: You have built EDA tools in one or more of static timing analysis, physical synthesis, partitioning, or place-and-route for large capacity and high-performance designs. You have experience in building and/or using emulation or hardware prototyping systems. You understand digital logic design, FPGA architecture, and hardware description language. Job Summary Seeking a highly motivated and innovative digital design engineer with excellent theoretical and practical background in high-speed digital circuits and FPGA design. We are looking for a team-oriented, self-motivated contributor with a keen technical mind and an eye for detail. You will be expected to explore new technologies and techniques to enhance our current and future product lines. Defining detailed test plan and implementing verilog simulation testcases to verify design functionality. Debug product, test and resolve design issues on hardware platforms Define hardware and firmware interfaces, protocols for circuits. Proficient in FPGA timing closure/area optimization techniques Hands on Experience with bringup of FPGA designs Knowledge of ASIC and FPGA design flows is desirable. Excellent organization and communication skills for interacting between different design groups. Desire to learn and explore. Proficiency in C/C++ and scripting languages is a plus. Prior understanding and experience of EDA tool development and hardware design would be a BIG plus! The Physical Design Specialist Solutions Engineer will be an expert in physical design methodologies and drive reference flow development & adoption for high performance cores using the latest technology nodes. The solutions engineer role includes the following responsibilities : Development of reference methodologies for the latest and greatest high performance cores across the start-of-the-art technology nodes Successful deployment of reference flows across multiple customers helping them to achieve superior Power/Performance/Area targets Influencing product definition and direction of R&D by providing feedback regarding customer challenges and tool experiences Actively participating in account strategy & conducting hands-on competitive benchmarks to increase the Synopsys tool usage by working with Sales and AEs The PDS must be adept at diagnosing and resolving technical challenges in the physical design space. Educational/Experience Requirements MSEE with hands-on experience in all aspects of physical design including data preparation, placement, clock tree synthesis, routing, floorplanning, timing and DRC closure, and low power physical implementation. Experience with modern technology nodes (16nm and below) is required. Experience with library preparation and techfiles is desirable. Must possess at least three years of recent hands on experience in the place & route domain using Synopsys or competing Place&Route tools (Fusion Compiler experience is preferred). Knowledge of areas ASIC implementation domains outside of place & route, including logic synthesis, static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS and power analysis is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. Previous experience working with customers is a strong plus. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex and a strong desire to help customers exploit new technologies is required

jobTitle: R&D Engineer, Sr II - OPC Modeling - 40599BR
jobDescription: Job Description The Synopsys Proteus OPC modeling team is responsible for the design, development and productization of full-chip software tools for modeling and simulating lithography and etch processes (e.g., optical proximity effects, mask and wafer topography effects, resist effects, etc). As part of the R&D team, you will help develop and improve modeling components, exploring new modeling techniques and modernize the infrastructure. You will get to address challenging problems in advanced software engineering as you help develop innovative and highly efficient software architectures, interfaces, algorithms and data structures. The Responsibilities Include Maintaining and improving existing functionalities Working with field support team and customers to understand new technical requirements Designing innovative, physics-driven model solutions by analyzing customer data Creating specifications for prototyping, and developing new modeling solutions Collaborating with cross functional teams to integrate modeling solutions into existing products Qualification Requirements Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills with strong desire to explore new technologies Solid programming skills in C++ and Python and familiar with data structures and algorithms Strong background in physical modeling, statistical analysis and optimization Experience in numerical computation Good communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment MS in CS/EE/physics/applied math or related fields with 5+ years, or PhD with 3+ years of experience Nice To Have Experience in computational lithography, image processing, or machine learning Experience in the development of large, complex software projects The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. jobTitle: R&D Engineer, Sr II - OPC Modeling - 40599BR
jobDescription: Job Description The Synopsys Proteus OPC modeling team is responsible for the design, development and productization of full-chip software tools for modeling and simulating lithography and etch processes (e.g., optical proximity effects, mask and wafer topography effects, resist effects, etc). As part of the R&D team, you will help develop and improve modeling components, exploring new modeling techniques and modernize the infrastructure. You will get to address challenging problems in advanced software engineering as you help develop innovative and highly efficient software architectures, interfaces, algorithms and data structures. The Responsibilities Include Maintaining and improving existing functionalities Working with field support team and customers to understand new technical requirements Designing innovative, physics-driven model solutions by analyzing customer data Creating specifications for prototyping, and developing new modeling solutions Collaborating with cross functional teams to integrate modeling solutions into existing products Qualification Requirements Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills with strong desire to explore new technologies Solid programming skills in C++ and Python and familiar with data structures and algorithms Strong background in physical modeling, statistical analysis and optimization Experience in numerical computation Good communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment MS in CS/EE/physics/applied math or related fields with 5+ years, or PhD with 3+ years of experience Nice To Have Experience in computational lithography, image processing, or machine learning Experience in the development of large, complex software projects The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. Join a growing global team at Synopsys focused on developing common platform for design execution. The team is working on innovative methodologies to implement designs that can deliver more performance with lesser power. The innovative techniques involve tapping into advance technologies and tool features to improve quality of results and make implementation process simpler and predictable. Description Expert physical designer with 10+ years of VLSI/EDA product development/deployment, full-flow benchmarking, design tapeout experience. Deeply trusted by customer as the on-site R&D that can be counted on to deliver quick solutions (usually TCL/Perl/Python solutions). This engineer has a good understanding of how the underlying algorithms within the tools work and is able to bridge the algorithms in the tool to the customer’s specific design style. By being able to work on both sides of the problem, this engineer is able to determine how to update/improve the algorithms to greatly improve power/performance/area/runtimes for the customer’s specific designs. The engineer is able to connect the dots between what the customer’s design needs are for rapid PPA closure and the underlying capabilities of the engines within the tool. The engineer is expected to be proactive, have a strategic mindset in addition to tactical problem solving. Requirements BSEE/MSEE or equivalent with 10+ years in developing and supporting advanced design implementation methodologies Requires the ability to understand and explain relevant technical issues, and thorough knowledge of RTL2GDS flows and methodologies Hands-on familiarity with Synopsys and /or 3rd party tools including RTL/Physical Synthesis, Place & Route and Signoff products Excellent customer interface, negotiation, planning and verbal and written presentation/communication skills required Customer sensitivity and the desire to help customers exploit new platforms and technologies are essential for success in the position Strong scripting skills Travel as needed Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. The Physical Design Specialist Solutions Engineer will be an expert in physical design methodologies and drive reference flow development & adoption for high performance cores using the latest technology nodes. The solutions engineer role includes the following responsibilities : Development of reference methodologies for the latest and greatest high performance cores across the start-of-the-art technology nodes Successful deployment of reference flows across multiple customers helping them to achieve superior Power/Performance/Area targets Influencing product definition and direction of R&D by providing feedback regarding customer challenges and tool experiences Actively participating in account strategy & conducting hands-on competitive benchmarks to increase the Synopsys tool usage by working with Sales and AEs The PDS AE must be adept at diagnosing and resolving technical challenges in the physical design space. Educational/Experience Requirements BSEE with 4 years of experience in ASIC design, with hands-on experience in all aspects of physical design including data preparation, placement, clock tree synthesis, routing, floorplanning, timing and DRC closure, and low power physical implementation. Experience with modern technology nodes (16nm and below) is required. Experience with library preparation and techfiles is desirable. Must possess at least three years of recent hands on experience in the place & route domain using Synopsys or competing Place&Route tools (Fusion Compiler experience is preferred). Knowledge of areas ASIC implementation domains outside of place & route, including logic synthesis, static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS and power analysis is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. Previous experience working with customers is a strong plus. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex and a strong desire to help customers exploit new technologies is required

jobTitle: R&D Software Engineer - Custom Design & Layout - 40175BR
jobDescription: We are looking for an exceptional C++ developer with background in, or interest to learn about Custom Design and Layout in the Integrated Circuit field. In this role, you would be responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, and debugging software programs for analog and mixed-signal implementation.  Responsibilities   Design new solutions to high value problems in Custom Design and Layout areas for which solutions do not exist or are underserved today (e.g. physically aware design, layout automation, etc.). Work with technologists within Synopsys in adjacent areas and lead customers to help define and implement innovative solutions Improve existing system and provide solutions in Synopsys Custom products Work with corporate application engineers to understand customers’ need and to provide solutions Write well-designed, well-tested, high quality C++ programs Write design specifications, review code for peer members Requirements   MS Computer Science or Electrical Engineering 4+ years of Experience in the following: Software development: C++, TCL, Python, Linux, build and revision control systems, spec writing/reviewing Software design: data structures, algorithms, event-driven systems Desired Skills   EDA tool and flows Circuit analysis, layout principles, semi-conductor manufacturing Advanced math, statistics, and machine learning techniques Our Custom Design & Manufacturing business is about building software solutions (tools, flows) for custom design, analog and mixed signal design. The custom product is used by our IP team extensively for all their products. We work closely with our signoff extraction, verification, and simulation teams to build differentiated solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon analog and mixed-signal designs. And, we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. The Infrastructure team owns the core components that have an impact on all aspects of this highly-scalable software platform. In this role, you will join an experienced software development team and contribute to exciting new technologies in computational lithography, enabling leading semiconductor companies that shape our lives. Responsibilities Design efficient data structures and algorithms, analyze software issues and deliver robust software Design, architect, and create functional specifications for new software components and modules. Facilitate and take the lead on large complex projects, break it down into smaller pieces, distribute to developers, and track project progress. Work with product engineering as well as field support teams and customers to understand new requirements and provide solutions Maintain and improve existing functionality, focused on quality, reliability, and performance Collaborate closely with other members of the team and cross-functional working groups, including Application Engineers, Quality Assurance and Technical Publications Requirements MS, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, or Physical Sciences with 7+ years of related programming experience Strong programming skills and experience with C/C++ Strong background in data structures and algorithms and state-of-the art programming techniques. Experience with distributed systems, computational geometry, GPU programming, multi-threaded applications a plus. Familiarity in developing software on Linux Desire to learn and explore new technologies, demonstrate good analysis and problem-solving skills Good oral and written skills for communication and documentation The Custom Design and Manufacturing Group provides market leading solutions for Custom Design, Circuit Simulation, Physical Verification, Process Technology Development, Advanced Lithography, and Manufacturing, driving the successful adoption of our best-in-class technologies and platforms at our broad and growing set of customers and partners across diverse market segments. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Synopsys, the 15th largest software company in the world, is seeking a Midwest Regional Sales Manager to drive bookings for the Synopsys Software Integrity Group Business Unit (SIG) as a result of our growth. This individual contributor must be highly motivated and a proven sales executive in the area of software tools and security services with demonstrated experience selling to software development and security teams. The Regional Sales Manager will work closely with Sales Engineering and Consulting teams to drive end-to-end solutions for our prospects and customers. The main goal for this position is the selling of enterprise software and consulting agreements within several named accounts, and in so doing create a means for achievement of the revenue target. The Regional Sales Manager is responsible for ensuring SIG’s customers successfully realize the full value of the SIG’s software and services. As such, the position requires extensive relationship building activities along with driving engineering and security cases that ensure the customer is obtaining the maximum value. To achieve this along with further adoption, the Regional Sales Manager must have exceptional skills and experiences in the selling of complex solutions in large and complicated customer environments. Preferred Experience Software engineering tools experience Security software sales experience Global, named or large enterprise account management experience Responsibilities Drive top-line sales revenue in a named list of accounts, as well as a geographic footprint Drive adoption of enterprise agreements in the targeted named accounts to ensure long term relationships and maximum contract value Collaborate with global team members to foster a solid sense of community and information sharing among named accounts Focus on relationship building with executives Guide prospects through a methodical sales process to facilitate selection of Synopsys solutions Ensure customer success Represent SIG at local and/or industry events Maintain accurate Salesforce information Travel as necessary to client locations (approximately 50% of time traveling Required Skills & Knowledge Minimum 8 years enterprise software sales experience, particularly in the Midwest U.S. Proven track record of exceeding software sales revenue targets Proven ability to manage complex sales cycles Proven ability to sell multiyear enterprise licensing agreements Proven track record selling six-or-seven figure deals Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with executive selection makers Excellent critical thinking and problem solving skills Excellent communications and presentations skills About the Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leS in application security, provides SAST, SCA, and DAST solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender preference, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Covered Veteran in accordance with federal law. In addition, Synopsys complies with applicable state and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Synopsys Inc. also provides reasonable accommodation to team members with a disability in accordance with applicable laws.

Regional Sales Manager – Consulting Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk . Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . This individual contributor must be highly motivated and a proven sales executive in the area of software security consulting services with demonstrated experience selling to software development and security teams. The Regional Sales Manager - Consulting will report to the National Director and will work closely with his or her assigned Regional Sales Representatives, Sales Engineers, and Consulting team. A principle goal for this position is the selling of consulting agreements within their designated regions, and in so doing create a means for achievement of the revenue target. The Regional Sales Manager - Consulting is responsible for ensuring SIG’s customers successfully realize the full value of the SIG’s software and services. As such, the position requires extensive relationship building activities along with driving engineering and security cases that ensure the customer is obtaining the maximum value. To achieve this along with further adoption, the Regional Sales Manager - Consulting must have strong skills and experiences in the selling of complex solutions in large and complicated customer environments. Responsibilities Drive top-line consulting sales revenue in a named list of accounts, as well as a geographic footprint Collaborate with global team members to foster a strong sense of community and information sharing among named accounts Strong focus on relationship building with executive decision makers Guide prospects through a methodical sales process to facilitate decisions Ensure customer success Represent SIG at local and/or industry events Maintain accurate Salesforce information Travel as necessary to client locations (approximately 50% of time traveling) Required Skills & Knowledge: Minimum 6 years enterprise software security consulting sales experience Proven track record of exceeding consulting sales revenue targets Proven ability to manage complex sales cycles Proven ability to sell multiyear enterprise consulting agreements Proven track record selling six-or-seven figure deals Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with executive decision makers Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communications and presentations skills Preferred Experience Software security consulting sales experience Software security software sales experience Global, named or large enterprise account management experience Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. We are seeking an energetic applicant to join our Sales Development team to generate qualified prospects. Success in the role requires ambition with significant time on the phone following up on leads. General Responsibilities Learn target market, business drivers, and strategies to present Synopsys products as a value add solution. Reach out to and follow up with respondents from a variety of marketing programs. Execute the necessary daily activities as set forth by management, including phone calls and emails at a high quality to meet your monthly goals Identify key targets in our database and initiate contact, leveraging research resources and referrals Nurture and manage leads until they are qualified as sales-ready Identify decision makers and company goals to position Synopsys appropriately Track all activity in our CRM system to support account and management teams, confirm activity and lead qualification reports, and provide ISR with solid prospect background on role, need and intrigue to ensure high-quality prospect transition into the sales process Qualifications And Experience Experience conducting business and building relationships in phone & email, with excellent phone, interpersonal, verbal & written capabilities Client-oriented writing skills Experience managing multiple priorities simultaneously, maintaining a high-volume pace with the ability to “switch gears” quickly as the prospecting conversation warrants Over-the-top motivation and creativity to reach prospects and create conversations Professional persistence & ability to “think on your feet” and make a compelling introduction. Organizational skills and a results-oriented self-starter attitude Proven track record of meeting and exceeding goals – this position manages a qualified lead and pipeline quota and bonuses for exceeding quota Working knowledge of MS Office applications, Salesforce.com and internet navigation Applicable language skills are a plus (Dutch, French, German, Spanish and Swedish) BS or BA degree and at least of 1-year business experience. Experience in sales is preferred. Security Consultant Job Description We’re looking for ethical hackers. Our Security Consultants conduct security engagements alone or in a small team to analyze target systems, penetrate defenses, and exploit vulnerabilities. They think creatively about complex problems and communicate solutions to our clients in an easy to understand and meaningful way. Synopsys thrives on learning. Our consultants are exposed to a wide variety of technologies, attack techniques, and security countermeasures. They are assigned an industry-leading expert as a mentor, learn from their peers in a knowledge-rich environment, and share their own expertise with junior members of the team. We’re looking for people who want to accelerate their careers and make a strong impact on our team and our clients. Activities Skills You’re not expected to have all these skills on day 1, but here are some of the things you might get to work on while you’re here Application Penetration Testing Source Code Analysis Mobile App Security Threat Modeling Secure Software Design and Architecture Network Penetration Testing Embedded and IoT Security Analysis Cloud Security SSDLC and DevSecOps Technical Skills Qualifications and Experience Familiarity with software attack and exploitation techniques Understanding of common web application security issues i.e., OWASP Top 10 and SANS Top 25 Command of defensive programming concepts and security countermeasures Experience with one or more software programming languages and frameworks Experience performing manual penetration testing Consulting Skills Proficiency in organizing and prioritizing multiple tasks, completing them independently, and meeting delivery timelines Bonus: experience in a customer-facing role Communication Written communication skills applicable to preparing formal documentation, white papers, and case studies Ability to clearly articulate thoughts and present to both technical and non-technical audiences Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience Company Description Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Our ideal applicants would be at home in a collaborative and vibrant culture. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Job Location: Can work remotely in US Employment Type: Full Time Salaried Employee, Individual Contributor Normal Working Hours: Mon-Fri, 8 hours/day, 40 hours per week, exempt About The Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 (6 years in a row) in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating application security testing in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Job Summary The Project Manager, has direct responsibility for developing strong and lasting relationships with our application security testing clients. The Project Manager will also work with Synopsys Application Security consultants and technical subject matter experts in order to assist in the execution and delivery of planned application security project deliverables, such as tracking, organizing, and monitoring the progress through completion. The Project Manager will also assist in gathering requirements and requests on a daily basis from our existing AppSec clientele, as well as monitoring emails, scheduling meetings, and managing administrative and project management tasks. Responsibilities Establish and nurture a trusted business advisor and tactical management relationship with a set of named AppSec clients Gathering requirements from our AppSec clients Manage planning, prep, and delivery of all assessment projects for specific AppSec clients Maintain a project backlog Ensure high-quality delivery while adhering to project scope, objectives, and margin requirements Make effective decisions and trade-offs under pressure Work through issues/risks with clients in assessment planning, preparation, and delivery Develop resource plans and facilitate the onboarding/off-boarding of resources Schedule and kick off each assessment projects Direct technical resource priorities to satisfy client commitments and SLAs Monitor and track assessment team progress and report back to AppSec clients Host conference calls and daily meetings with clients and the assessment team Facilitate review of findings with clients and the technical assessment team Receive and track periodic, on-going requests from clients regarding specific project needs Address and monitor all incoming customer communications Escalate all items including those urgent in nature, from the client to the appropriate Synopsys resource or manager Work in close contact with technical staff members to understand Synopsys service offerings and determine the best course of action within the project lifecycle Audit deliverables and evaluate team performance Minimum Qualifications (Required) 2-3 years of experience in a project management role Proven ability to consistently respond to customer needs in a timely and effective manner Excellent client facing written and verbal communication Scheduling, budget, and invoice management experience Issue management and resolution experience Experience with MSWord, Excel, Outlook, Project, and other general office applications Desired Qualifications (Not Required) Bachelor’s Degree PMP Certification Experience managing Software Security or IT Projects Experience with Project Management activities on security projects: network, infrastructure, and application preferred Experience working with SharePoint or Confluence Previous Consulting experience Benefits Work From Home Competitive Total Compensation Annual Performance Bonus Paid Vacation and Wellness Days Group Retirement Savings Plans and Employer Contributions Comprehensive Health Benefits To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Location: Can work remotely in US Employment Type: Full Time Salaried Employee, Individual Contributor Normal Working Hours: Mon-Fri, 8 hours/day, 40 hours per week, exempt About The Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 (6 years in a row) in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. We're looking for a Senior Analog Design Engineer to join our team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will work on the design, development, and refinement of Multi-Gbps NRZ & PAM4 SERDES IP. You will be part of a fast-growing analog and mixed signal R&D team developing high speed analog integrated circuits in the latest FinFET process nodes. Working from SerDes standards to block specifications, you quickly identify potential circuit architectures and successful design strategies. You will work with a cross functional design team of analog and digital designers from a wide variety of backgrounds. Our environment is best in class with a full suite of IC design tools supplemented by custom, in-house tools supported by an experienced software/CAD team. Job Responsibilities Review SerDes standards to develop analog sub-block specifications. Identify and refine circuit architectures to achieve optimal power, area and performance targets. Propose design and verification strategies that efficiently use simulator features to ensure highest quality design. Oversee physical layout to minimize the effect of parasitics, device stress, and process variation. Present simulation data for peer and customer review. Document design features and test plans. Consult on the electrical characterization of your circuit within the SerDes IP product. Propose solutions for post-silicon design updates. Job Requirements PhD with 1 years, or MSc with 3 years of practical analog IC design experience; degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering or other relevant field of study. In depth familiarity with transistor level circuit design - sound CMOS design fundamentals. Detailed design experience with one, and familiarity with several other SerDes sub-circuits: receive equalizers, samplers, voltage/current-mode drivers, serializers, deserializers, voltage-controlled oscillator, phase mixer, delay-locked loop, phase locked loop, bandgap reference, ADC, DAC Aware of ESD issues (i.e. circuit techniques, layout). Familiarity with custom digital design (i.e. high-speed logic paths). Knowledge of design for reliability (i.e. EM, IR, aging, etc.). Knowledge of layout effects (i.e. matching, reliability, proximity effects, etc.). Experience with tools for schematic entry, physical layout, and design verification. Hands-on experience with physical layout of high-speed circuits is a plus. Knowledge of SPICE simulators and simulation methods. Knowledgeable in Verilog-A for analog behavioral modeling and simulation-control/data-capture. Experience with TCL, Perl, C, Python, MATLAB, or other scripting languages is desired. Good communication and documentation skills Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Our design team in Boxborough MA is looking for an analog/mixed-signal design engineer to help with the development of high-bandwidth memory and other die-to-die interfaces. In this role you will collaborate with Synopsys experts worldwide to solve emerging technical challenges related to the latest 2.5D/3D multi-chip technologies. Responsibilities Designs, develops and supports interposer and top metals layout for Synopsys IPs targeting 2.5D/3D multi-chip applications Works with cross-functional teams to ensure all the performance and reliability requirements are met for the product Improve and creates new design flows to ensure best quality for interposers and covercells Supports customers with their multichip integration process. Requirements BS/MS/PhD in Electrical Engineering or a related field. 5+ years of experience in analog, mixed signal, memory or custom logic circuit design Experience with layout and good understanding of layout effects on circuit performance. Good understanding of signal integrity and power integrity concepts Great team player, willing to support others and to mentor junior engineers Great technical communication skills Scripting experience for design automation is a plus Opportunities SNPS is the world number one IP provider. Work with many experts from around the world. Work with the latest technologies and applications Professional, innovative, fair and flexible working environment. Competitive salary and benefits Strong support from company for team building and social activities About Us At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Our Systems Design Group is all about enabling our customers to adopt a software first approach to building high-performance silicon chips as well as larger systems containing such chips. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for design and verification of advanced silicon chips, software bringup and hardware/software integration - eliminating months off customers’ project schedules. We are looking for an experienced Applications Engineer to support and grow customer deployment of our virtual prototyping solutions for early SW development and SoC architecture design, addressing our customers’ need to accelerate innovation and development. In this role you will partner with sales and customer technical leaders to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Typical activities include product demonstrations, evaluations, training, support for product usage, and tracking of issues reported by customer. Additionally, you will provide inputs to R&D to enhance our products and promote Synopsys technology in trade shows and seminars. Key Qualifications BS (MS preferred) in EE or CS Proficiency in C/C++ programming and software development tools, scripting (python, tcl) 5+ years’ experience in a customer facing role related to one or more of the following areas: embedded software development, architecture design, SystemC modeling & simulation Fast Learner, independent and proactive, strong problem solving and communication skills. The role requires travel (about 25% of the time). Preferred: Experience with eSW (e.g. boot loaders, drivers, firmware, Linux, RTOS) for Arm processors Experience with SoC architecture and performance verification such as: DDRC, Interconnect. Ideal to have experience with ESL/Virtual Prototyping area, but not a must 7+ years’ software industry experience including experience in an Applications Engineering role US Citizen or Permanent Resident At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software development. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

We are looking for an experienced Applications Engineer to support and grow customer deployment of our virtual prototyping solutions for early SW development and SoC architecture design, addressing our customers’ need to accelerate innovation and development. In this role you will partner with sales and customer technical leaders to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Typical activities include product demonstrations, evaluations, training, support for product usage, and tracking of issues reported by customer. Additionally, you will provide inputs to R&D to enhance our products and promote Synopsys technology in trade shows and seminars. Key Qualifications BS (MS preferred) in EE or CS Proficiency in C/C++ programming and software development tools, scripting (python, tcl) 5+ years’ experience in a customer facing role related to one or more of the following areas: embedded software development, architecture design, SystemC modeling & simulation Fast Learner, independent and proactive, strong problem solving and communication skills. The role requires travel (about 25% of the time). Preferred: Experience with eSW (e.g. boot loaders, drivers, firmware, Linux, RTOS) for Arm processors Experience with SoC architecture and performance verification such as: DDRC, Interconnect. Ideal to have experience with ESL/Virtual Prototyping area, but not a must 7+ years’ software industry experience including experience in an Applications Engineering role US Citizen or Permanent Resident At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software development. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Senior Applications Engineer - Foundation IP This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast-paced Applications Engineering team that is responsible for supporting our customers in the Synopsys Intellectual Property (IP) domain. This position requires a highly motivated and experienced person to work with Synopsys’ worldwide customer base on integrating our leading edge Foundation IP product line into their SoC designs. Responsibilities Understand the IP applications for customer specific SoC Keep abreast of the latest ASIC/SoC design flows and EDA tools Provide expert advice and support to configure and resolve IP integration challenges including simulation, synthesis, floorplan, STA, DFT and silicon bring-up Provide integration training to customers and conduct reviews on their major SoC milestones Provide feedback to Synopsys R&D for continuous product improvements Participate in R&D design reviews to align development with future customer needs Required Skills BSEE, MSEE preferred, and 5+ years relevant experience Good understanding of the latest SoC architectures and system-level design practices for one or more market segments (HPC, mobile, storage, automotive, networking, IoT), from the IP requirements perspective Hands-on experience on RTL coding in Verilog, simulation, synthesis, static timing analysis, equivalence checking Domain knowledge of embedded memories, logic libraries and IO libraries Experienced with SoC design flows Silicon debug and troubleshooting skills Experience in common scripting languages Good deductive and technical problem-solving skills in tandem with solid written and verbal communication skills High degree of self-motivation and personal responsibility Customer sensitivity, the ability to multitask and set priorities, helpful and caring attitude towards customers, and the desire to help customers in exploring new technologies are essential for success in the position Nice To Have Skills Domain knowledge of memory test and repair and DFT Prior AE experience

Synopsys Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. Synopsys offers a global portfolio of silicon IP which spans from pre-designed blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security to embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Senior Applications Engineer This position requires a highly motivated and experienced team member to work with Synopsys’ customers on integrating leading edge DDR Interface IP into their ASIC SoC/systems. These systems are generally next generation products utilizing our DDR5/4 or LPDDR5/4 IIP. The position offers opportunities to work on Synopsys IP and the latest Industry specifications/applications on market segments. The Application Engineer provides integration guidance to Synopsys’ customers throughout their System on Chip flow to resolve technical challenges, perform integration reviews at key milestones and support silicon/system bring-up. Key Qualifications BSEE or equivalent background required, MSEE preferred Requires 4 years of related design or customer experience Experience in one or multiple steps on IP design or integration flow of ASIC / SoC design: simulation/verification, RTL synthesis, physical design, timing closure silicon bring-up/characterization in a system environment etc...Preferred Experience Technical understanding of any Interface IP such as PCIe, USB, MIPI, HBM, DDR, LPDDR. We support all areas along the ASIC design flow: Protocols, Specification, Design, Verification, Implementation and Integration Excellent organization and solid communication skills are required for customers interactions. Proven track record in meeting tight schedules and handling multiple projects concurrently Prior design, verification or applications experience with DDR Controller IP is a plus This position can be based in Sunnyvale, CA, Austin, TX, Ottawa, ON or Boxborough, MA. Some travel (up to 20%) will be required for training and on-site customer support. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Senior ASIC Digital Design Engineer Job Responsibilities Understand Standard Specifications/ the functional specifications/ feature enhancements for the product and create micro-architecture and detailed design documents for some of the components of the design with medium complexity. Be an individual contributor in the Design Tasks – RTL coding of design, debug, verification coverage improvement in the directed Verilog Test Bench, etc. Create/ work on designs using Low Power Design Methodology and automotive safety Need to understand Standard Specifications/ the functional specifications/ feature enhancements for the product and create micro-architecture and detailed design documents for some of the components functions/ product features for the DesignWare family of synthesizable cores in protocol areas such as AMBA (AMBA2, AXI, CHI)/ SD/eMMC/DDR/PCIe/Ethernet/ USB/ MIPI Creates deliverables which do not require close review or supervision by a Senior Technical Lead. Do technical review of Functional specification, micro-architecture and RTL Code. The candidate should be able to analyse the coverage metrics and improve them with definition of additional test cases in directed environment, for features of the protocol/ product specs. The candidate will work in a project and team-oriented environment with teams spread across multiple sites, worldwide. Preferred Experience Typically requires a minimum of 5+ years of related experience. Prior knowledge and experience of CAD tool usage are required. Key Qualifications Has a strong desire to learn and explore new technologies. Demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills. Possesses a full understanding of specialization area plus working knowledge of multiple related areas. Independently resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways on a regular basis. Customarily exercises independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. Performs in project leadership role. Contributes to complex aspects of a project. Determines and develops approach to solutions. Work is independent and collaborative in nature. Provides regular updates to manager on project status. Represents the organization on business unit and/or company-wide projects. Guides more junior peers with aspects of their job. Frequently networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. You will be a member of the high-performance IT Engineering Application team. This team provides development and support for the company-wide usage of Jira, Confluence, Fisheye, BMC Helix ITSM and Stack Overflow applications. This position requires access to or use of information which is subject to export restrictions, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants for this position must be “U.S. Persons” within the meaning of the ITAR. “U.S. Persons” include U.S. Citizens, U.S. Lawful Permanent Residents (i.e. 'Green Card Holders'), Political Asylees, Refugees or other protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). You will Be responsible for the development, maintenance, and enhancement of the Atlassian (Cloud) applications and other applications as you broaden your professional development Partner with internal customers, IT colleagues, and other stakeholders Identify user requirements, assess available technologies, and recommend solution options. Provide application design and development across business units Formulate and define application scope and goals Create and modify procedures to solve business issues Prepare detailed specifications for configuration execution Perform writing of programs and design, code, test, debug, and document programs Monitor and report statuses of project activities Identify issues that inhibit meeting project goals and implements corrective actions Requirements This position typically requires a minimum of 5+ years of related experience with a BS or MS degree. Senior Business Analyst-Salesforce Synopsys is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Applications/IT team who will be responsible for analyzing, designing and delivering business processes through our core application suite (i.e., Salesforce, Oracle CPQ). We are looking for a smart and passionate individual who will work closely with our internal IT team and interface with our key business stakeholders. This individual will have strong business acumen and is expected to participate in cross-functional efforts designed to improve effectiveness through process analysis, business process redesign, and ensure successful implementation of resulting system improvements. Throughout all projects and maintenance initiatives, the senior business analyst meets regularly with the business stakeholders and SMEs, project team, sales support, and enterprise technology to accomplish the objectives presented in the below description. Requirements Strong background and experience supporting CRM applications in a high-tech environment Continuously engage with the business, technology, and the key stakeholders to stay informed of the customer/business needs. Exemplify agile principles, encourage best practices, and assist team to continue to develop and mature in agile methodologies. Ensures criteria for story and defects are entered into backlog ticketing system such as Jira. Maintains requirement documentation for reference (master documents) Collaborates well with the scrum master and the development team Hosts requirement grooming or dev breakout sessions when necessary Manages stories with the testers and aligns plans accordingly Refactor IT functional processes into solution requirements Align with Release Manager and Scrum Master on release plan coordination Identify, communicate and facilitate resolution to any production support, user requests or triaged support tickets Provide ownership for communication of the status of deliverables and timelines to interested parties proactively. Should be able to document issues thoroughly, maintain current status, and escalate issues appropriately. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience. IT Business Analyst background 5 years (minimum) of work experience as a Business Systems Analyst or in a comparable function - experience with conducting as-is process analysis through stakeholder interviews, identifying pain points, and recommending process improvements Experience working in agile delivery and teams (SCRUM) desired Demonstrated understanding of business process development and improvement initiatives Self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, hardworking, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task various projects and balance priorities Ability to work well either independently or as part of the wider team in geographically disparate locations Strong organizational/time management skills and ability to prioritize workload effectively About The Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html. Senior Business Analyst-Salesforce Synopsys is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to join our Business Applications/IT team who will be responsible for analyzing, designing and delivering business processes through our core application suite (i.e., Salesforce, Oracle CPQ). We are looking for a smart and passionate individual who will work closely with our internal IT team and interface with our key business stakeholders. Exemplify agile principles, encourage best practices, and assist team to continue to develop and mature in agile methodologies. Ensures criteria for story and defects are entered into backlog ticketing system such as Jira. Maintains requirement documentation for reference (master documents) Collaborates well with the scrum master and the development team Hosts requirement grooming or dev breakout sessions when necessary Manages stories with the testers and aligns plans accordingly Refactor IT functional processes into solution requirements Align with Release Manager and Scrum Master on release plan coordination Identify, communicate and facilitate resolution to any production support, user requests or triaged support tickets Provide ownership for communication of the status of deliverables and timelines to interested parties proactively. Should be able to document issues thoroughly, maintain current status, and escalate issues appropriately. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or other related field, or equivalent work experience. IT Business Analyst background 5 years (minimum) of work experience as a Business Systems Analyst or in a comparable function - experience with conducting as-is process analysis through stakeholder interviews, identifying pain points, and recommending process improvements Experience working in agile delivery and teams (SCRUM) desired Demonstrated understanding of business process development and improvement initiatives Self-motivated, detail-oriented, organized, hardworking, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task various projects and balance priorities Ability to work well either independently or as part of the wider team in geographically disparate locations Strong organizational/time management skills and ability to prioritize workload effectively About The Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. The Sr Business Analyst, Business Intelligence will be an integral member of the Business Intelligence & Analytics CoE (Center of Excellence) at Synopsys. The BI&A team is chartered with defining and executing an enterprise business intelligence strategy. This includes BI solutions, data exploration and dashboard development in partnership with business and IT stakeholders. In this hand-on role, the Sr Business Analyst, BI will help us on our journey to become a more analytics driven company. Grounded in business, the candidate is also fluent in technology, able to assess current technical environment and develop technology requirements and conceptual solutions to meet business goals. The ideal candidate is a self-assured professional with broad skills in dissecting and solving complex business problems, executing complex analysis, writing and presenting findings. Candidate is comfortable working with all levels of the organization, from the executive suite to the front line, and is equally comfortable working autonomously. Responsibilities Collaborate with the key stakeholders to develop the BI (Business Intelligence) processes, strategy, and analytics roadmap for the organization. Support the identification and structuring of business and operational Key Performance Indicators and dashboards Partner with the business leaders and data owners to understand their needs and challenges and recommend visualization solutions that can be easily communicated and interpreted by users Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making Drive continuous improvement through automation, data quality, and system enhancements. Outline specific project plans and milestones for BI, Data & Analytics initiatives. Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis. Present detailed analysis and insight through professional quality Dashboards to stakeholders, including executive staff. Provide guidance and insight on BI development techniques and prototyping. Provide leadership and education on the value and use of information & operational data. Provides hands-on support to provision data from a variety of internal sources.
