The Sr Business Analyst, Business Intelligence will be an integral member of the Business Intelligence & Analytics CoE (Center of Excellence) at Synopsys. The BI&A team is chartered with defining and executing an enterprise business intelligence strategy. This includes BI solutions, data exploration and dashboard development in partnership with business and IT stakeholders. In this hand-on role, the Sr Business Analyst, BI will help us on our journey to become a more analytics driven company. Grounded in business, the candidate is also fluent in technology, able to assess current technical environment and develop technology requirements and conceptual solutions to meet business goals. The ideal candidate is a self-assured professional with broad skills in dissecting and solving complex business problems, executing complex analysis, writing and presenting findings. Candidate is comfortable working with all levels of the organization, from the executive suite to the front line, and is equally comfortable working autonomously. Responsibilities Collaborate with the key stakeholders to develop the BI (Business Intelligence) processes, strategy, and analytics roadmap for the organization. Support the identification and structuring of business and operational Key Performance Indicators and dashboards Partner with the business leaders and data owners to understand their needs and challenges and recommend visualization solutions that can be easily communicated and interpreted by users Conceptualize, develop, and maintain dashboards and visualizations that inform both tactical and strategic decision making Drive continuous improvement through automation, data quality, and system enhancements. Outline specific project plans and milestones for BI, Data & Analytics initiatives. Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis. Present detailed analysis and insight through professional quality Dashboards to stakeholders, including executive staff. Provide guidance and insight on BI development techniques and prototyping. Provide leadership and education on the value and use of information & operational data. Provides hands-on support to provision data from a variety of internal sources. Contribute to the design and support of the BI environment, including information & data acquisition, management and delivery solutions. Participate in the definition of the global data strategy. Promote and facilitate the development of self-service capabilities for the business in the access and reporting of data. Provide global support and train users on BI tools and methodologies. Stay abreast of new and emerging BI, Data and AI/ML/NLP technologies and their potential application. Identify and implement industry best practices. Requirements: 7+ years of business analytics or finance experience Excellent Data Visualization skills and experience with SQL Requires solid knowledge and experience with reports and dashboards development (experience with Tableau software a plus). Solid project management expertise or prior managerial skills Requires experience reviewing and writing Technical & Business Requirements in relation to Business Intelligence, data Management or software development projects. Preferred experience in operational, management or financial reporting as a Business Systems Analyst. Demonstrated background and proficiency with various BI tools and data platforms Experience with Cloud BI & DW solutions Experience in data quality, data governance, data architecture, including data modeling Experience in statistical and other tools/languages (R, Python…) Experience with AI/ML solutions and Predictive Modeling Excellent statistical thinking, problem solving, organizational and time management skills. Proven knowledge of project & program management techniques and tools (Agile/Scrum master certification preferred, experience with Jira a plus). Sound initiative, proactive and ability to meet deadlines. Ability to be flexible and to handle multiple projects in an organized and timely manner. Ability to innovate and to effectively deal with rapid change in a positive manner. Influential in driving process change within the company. Proven customer service and support focus. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent organizational skills. BS/BA is required, MBA preferred. Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out: https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Job Overview: You are a curious person and have great attention to detail. You are a seasoned professional and eager to apply and increase your knowledge of software development by using modern technologies to build modern SaaS products. You thrive in a busy environment, are self-assured, methodical, and are not afraid to ask questions. You are willing to iteratively improve products, research new ways of doing business and are a good communicator. We encourage heavy collaboration between cross functional teams to build products that assist our customers to manage their application security posture. We value a collaborative team culture, autonomy, and a proven sense of ownership. Senior DevOps Engineer Main Responsibilities Building, maintaining, and optimizing SaaS products using a variety of modern technologies and coding languages Delivering resilient, secure, and efficient cloud-based platform through agile development Providing guidance and tooling to develop micro-services onto Kubernetes based platform Building, maintaining, and optimizing CI/CD pipelines for microservice based workloads Implementing actionable monitoring solutions for cloud platform and applications Participating in on-call rotations and respond to operational incidents Collaborating across teams and executing infrastructure, platform projects from inception to production Key Requirements BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, with graduate-level continued education, or equivalent 5 or more years of experience in the fields of SRE, DevOps or production engineering Solid Programming skills (using OO languages, or even Python or Go Lang) Solid use of Command Line (CLI) and Bash scripting on Linux Expertise in working with public cloud infrastructure providers (Azure/ AWS/ GCP) Experience developing cloud native CI/CD workflows such as GitHub actions and Azure DevOps Hands on experience in provisioning infrastructure as code using terraform Expertise with designing, implementing, and automating the application deployments to Docker and Kubernetes Experience in building observability system for log aggregation, analytics, monitoring, distributed systems tracing and alerting Hands on experience with gitops tools such as Argo CD, Flux, Flagger Working knowledge of programming in Go, NodeJS, Python or equivalent, and shell scripting Experience with Git, JIRA, and confluence or equivalent Working knowledge of service mesh, Api gateway and proxies Demonstrated history of ability to resolve a complex range of issues in imaginative as well as practical ways, and drive teams in technical design & implementation Nice-to-have: Knowledge of IP networking, VPN's, DNS, load balancing and firewall Developer experience on Kubernetes Knowledge of progressive delivery; canary deployments and feature flags Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Senior Digital Engineer Responsibilities Design, Implementation, Verification, and Physical Synthesis of NVM (Non-volatile Memory) controllers for both OTP (One Time Programmable) and MTP (Multiple Time Programmable) products at leading technology nodes. Maintenance of digital control blocks, chip test systems, circuit models, and design for test circuits, as well as participation in all phases of the design cycle. The design cycle includes modeling, RTL (Register Transfer Language) coding, verification, synthesis, and P & R (Place and Routing). In addition to these duties, the position involves creating custom software to debug, validate, and qualify next-generation NVM IP (Intellectual Property), as well as providing technical support to internal customers, AEs (Application Engineers), and customers during their product integration phase. Requirements BS in EE or related field 5+ years’ experience in a related field Familiarity with Verilog, digital verification and synthesis a must. Familiarity with place & routing and Synopsys tools (VCS, Formality, CustomCompiler) preferred. Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Senior Engineering Manager We’re looking for an Experienced Design Leader to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? Our preference is for this person to be based in Oregon but will consider remote. In this technical management role you will be leading the activities of a talented design team. Management responsibilities will include driving initiatives, priority-setting, tracking and following through on projects, enabling communication and cohesion across multi-site teams, other managers, and upper management. Building a working relationship with cross-functional teams and customers will also be part of this role. On the technical side, you will drive the technical roadmap, provide technical guidance to the R&D team members, and have an opportunity for your own technical feature development. Key Qualifications BS/MS/Phd in EE, CE, CS or related field. At this level, post-graduate degree is desirable with 8+ years technical of technical experience and management experience. Must have prior domain knowledge in logic synthesis Must have hands-on experience in complex C/C++ software development processes on Linux platform. Have proficiency in designing data structures, algorithms, and specs for sophisticated/complex software products. Be familiar with script languages such as TCL, Perl, Unix shell scripts. Has a significant role in developing, modifying, and executing company policies. Advise senior management on specialized technical or business issues. Exceptional proven communication skills. Comfortable interacting with senior management or executive levels on difficult matters concerning several functional areas, multiple business units, and/or customers. Requires the ability to change the thinking of, or gain acceptance from, others in sensitive situations, without damage to the relationship.Preferred Experience: RTL high-level optimizations is desirable. Digital circuit power analysis and optimization experience are pluses. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. We’re looking for an experienced signal integrity engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this position, you will be part of a team that designs the next-generation DDR and HBM PHYs in the Synopsys IP portfolio. The position entails evaluating the electrical performance of memory interconnect channels, evaluating strategies for improved signaling at ever-increasing data rates, generating reports, and communicating results, trends, and recommendations to internal design teams and to customers. You will leverage your understanding of off-chip signaling, interconnect construction, channel modeling, signal and power delivery analysis, and electromagnetic behaviors to drive Synopsys’ evolving portfolio of leading-edge products. You will join a collaborative, multi-person engineering team covering an array of DDR and HBM PHY development projects. Job Responsibilities Perform interconnect assessments using the latest modeling techniques to predict channel data rates and signal margins Assess strategies for system performance optimization, including signal margins, power, and FFE, DFE, and CTLE equalization techniques Assess power delivery systems to optimize power integrity for supply stability and jitter minimization Document findings in reports and design guidelines Communicate results and insights to design teams to improve PHY design Communicate results and recommendations to customers to enable them to optimize their system performance Interact with design teams and customers to refine and apply signal and power analysis methods to refine strategies and address problems Understand Synopsys’ DDR and HBM PHY roadmap and create strategies for improved performance Track industry developments through activities at standards committees and through memory vendor roadmaps Key Qualifications And Experience Proven understanding of high-speed interface signaling operation, such as s-parameters, channel loss, crosstalk, equalization techniques, jitter, and power delivery modeling Must have a minimum of 3 years of related experience Well-versed in signal and power delivery analysis methods, including eye diagram construction through statistical modeling, return loss, impedance matching, and resonant system analysis Skilled in generating and communicating results, findings, conclusions, and recommendations within a design team and to external customers Well-versed in signal and power integrity analysis tools, HSPICE, IBIS, IBIS-AMI Knowledgeable in board-level construction and on-chip IO design operation Able to work across a multi-site team to communicate ideas, understand problems, and find solutions to create a leading-edge design Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Responsibilities Perform interconnect assessments using the latest modeling techniques to predict channel data rates and signal margins Assess strategies for system performance optimization, including signal margins, power, and FFE, DFE, and CTLE equalization techniques Assess power delivery systems to optimize power integrity for supply stability and jitter minimization Document findings in reports and design guidelines Communicate results and insights to design teams to improve PHY design Communicate results and recommendations to customers to enable them to optimize their system performance Interact with design teams and customers to refine and apply signal and power analysis methods to refine strategies and address problems Understand Synopsys’ DDR and HBM PHY roadmap and create strategies for improved performance Track industry developments through activities at standards committees and through memory vendor roadmaps Key Qualifications And Experience Proven understanding of high-speed interface signaling operation, such as s-parameters, channel loss, crosstalk, equalization techniques, jitter, and power delivery modeling Must have a minimum of 3 years of related experience Well-versed in signal and power delivery analysis methods, including eye diagram construction through statistical modeling, return loss, impedance matching, and resonant system analysis Skilled in generating and communicating results, findings, conclusions, and recommendations within a design team and to external customers Well-versed in signal and power integrity analysis tools, HSPICE, IBIS, IBIS-AMI Knowledgeable in board-level construction and on-chip IO design operation Able to work across a multi-site team to communicate ideas, understand problems, and find solutions to create a leading-edge design Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

The Synopsys Information Security team is searching for a Senior Security Operations Engineer who will be an integral part of the Security Operations group Key Responsibilities Responsible for the implementation, administration, and maintenance of the SIEM platform. Own security logging strategy. Collaborate with application owners to define and establish logging standards and requirements. Onboard new log sources to the SIEM via syslog, endpoint agents, and APIs. Develop Parsers, data enrichments, and normalization pipelines for the log data. Design and implement archiving and data recovery strategy for log data. Develop advanced SIEM correlation rules, reports, and dashboards to detect emerging threats. Create and maintain documentation related to the SIEM platform and the various parsers developed. Collaborate with CSIRT and SecOps team to develop/tune threat detection rules, dashboards and visualization charts. Ensure the data quality and identify any gaps in the security event collection. Participate in overall ongoing development of the SIEM and implement new features/enrichments in the SIEM. Monitor SIEM health, monitor usage and data growth. Develop data analytics and machine learning capabilities for security use cases. Qualifications Experience with implementing and managing on-prem and cloud Elastic SIEM Infrastructure. Experience with developing parsers, data enrichments and normalization pipelines. Experience in developing and expanding SIEM solutions and content is a must. Experience with SOAR solutions to manage incidents and remediation workflow. Experience with ELK stack along with Kafka. Solid understanding of Elastic Common Schema , JSON format and Syslog. Machine learning and data science background a plus. Understanding of MITRE ATT&CK Framework and Cyber Kill Chain. Practical experience with at least one development or scripting language/framework (e.g. PowerShell, Python, Bash) and regular expressions. Familiarity with various cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP). Ability to document and explain technical details in a concise, understandable manner. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, GSEC, GMON, GCDA or Security+ preferred. 8+ years of working experience with Elastic SIEM in an Information Security role At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Senior Manager, Media and Analyst Relations - 42095BR
jobDescription: Senior Manager, Media & Analyst Relations Synopsys inspires technology creation across every market and sector; our tools and IP part of the journey of almost all advanced chip designs as they progress from concept to reality. As a result, our storytelling possibilities are near limitless. So, if you love technology and love to write about it even more then look no further – this job is for you. We are looking for a professional news writer to join our media & analyst relations team based in Sunnyvale, California. You will devise, research and write a raft of stories based around the move to multi-die chip solutions, AI’s role in HW/SW co-design, design automation, autonomous vehicles and so much more. Alongside the writing of news releases, blogs, social posts, and other creative content, you will be a key member of the media relations team and all that involves. The successful candidate may be working as a technology sector journalist and looking to make a move into a major tech sector company’s comms department. Or you may be a media relations professional famed for your ability to turn data and detail into compelling copy. Whoever you are, it will be a huge advantage to be familiar with the semiconductor industry, Electronic Design Automation in particular, and understand how to turn potentially formulaic writing into stories people want to read. In return we promise you a career that will be well-rewarded and incredibly satisfying as you will be part of an enthusiastic and growing team that is well-set for the future. This role is based out of our Sunnyvale office, California, within the broad Enterprise Brand & Communication department. You will partner with marketing colleagues across the business as well as SMEs and other functional managers. Preferred Experience An ability to translate complex technology stories into well-written targeted communications highlighting Synopsys’ solutions to a broad range of audiences. News releases, blogs, social and digital materials, and other content as required An attention to detail, exceptionally well-organized and naturally collaborative. An ability to foster relationships at all levels across the organization from marketing to engineering and special interest groups The ability to deal with tight deadlines, multiple stakeholders and demonstrate a “can-do” (“Yes, If”), problem-solving attitude. An ability to help the Media and Analyst Relations team to drive best practice across the business and have fun! Key Qualifications: 10+ years in communications disciplines with 5+ years working with the semiconductor sector. Experience in EDA is preferable Exceptional communication, writing, and editing skills and familiarity with AP style Ability to write compelling news releases and help with media outreach for various technology announcements Strategic thinker and problem-solver who can contribute to strategy development and program execution Work effectively in a matrixed global environment Bachelor’s degree, preferably in journalism or public relations Candidates must provide high-quality writing samples and pass a writing test. The role is predominantly onsite in Sunnyvale, California (with some flexibility to work remote) At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability

Senior Manager of Business Applications- Salesforce About Synopsys – Software Integrity Group Synopsys Software Integrity Group (SIG) is the recognized market leader in application security products and services, and we’re laser focused on helping organizations build trust in their software. We’re looking for a dynamic and highly motivated Business Applications leader to join our team to help define, improve, and implement our go to market tool stack. Are you good at translating complex technology into compelling and easy-to-understand business strategy for a high growth business unit within one of the top 15 global software companies? If so, then Synopsys’ Software Integrity Group is the place for you. Position Overview As Senior Manager of Business Applications you will drive a multi-year strategy starting with a significant digital transformation/ reimplementation project around Salesforce and associated technology stack. You will ensure the strategy not only supports this transformation but will scale and optimize with the growth of the company. You are a 'customer-first' thinking leader and will be responsible for the end-to-end provision of world class solutions and supporting daily operations for all layers of BT GTM spanning across Marketing, Sales, Sales Ops, Finance, Customer Success, and Support, Professional services, Partner and Order management and Products. Key Responsibilities Translate SIG’s strategy into a technology roadmap to deliver innovative, world class measurable solutions around improving customer experience, supporting revenue growth and increasing employee productivity. Lead, mentor and grow a high performing business applications team, implementing cutting-edge methodologies, drive agile release cycles and keep the tech stack relevant. Advance and maintain the enterprise-wide Salesforce CRM (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Oracle CPQ and Communities). Advance and maintain additional tech stack that is integrated with Salesforce technologies including Tableau, Kimble, Churn Zero, Clari, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Salesloft, Marketo, DocuSign, Ziftone and ZoomInfo, among others. Develop collaborative relationships with leaders and stakeholders across the organization to prioritize initiatives, align on industry best practice solution designs, and successfully implement elegant and scalable systems. Partner with Governance Team to prioritize key initiatives Interface daily with cross-functional teams and management; provide premium end user support of Salesforce and associated technologies. Provide transparency and ongoing communication into systems roadmaps, priorities, milestones, launches, etc. Drive a low code/ no code (Customizations) approach to align or help adopt business processes within the SaaS framework to provide agility, speed and scalability. Required Experience/Skills Bachelor or master's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field. 6+ years experience in either software, system or enterprise architecture disciplines 6+ years of solid Salesforce experience (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Oracle CPQ, Communities) including one full life cycle implementation, day-to-day operations, and integrations with other technologies. 6+ Years of experience in managing Go-to-Market / Customer experience ecosystem (i.e. Salesforce, Clari, Tableau, Kimble, Churn Zero, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Salesloft, Marketo, DocuSign, CPQ, ZoomInfo, etc.). Are an experienced engineering leader who is comfortable managing SaaS and homegrown systems Experience in driving strong relationships and business partnerships with key commercial leaders. Business consulting experience preferred. Proven success in a high growth, fast-paced, rapidly changing, team-oriented environments with active M&A's (system and data integrations). Demonstrated experience leading and developing team of Salesforce business analysts, admins etc. and creating high performance global teams. Experience working with 3rd party vendors and assess appropriate next generation technology recommendations. Demonstrated experience leading and delivering complex, enterprise-wide projects. Excellent business requirements definition skills and proof of impact What Synopsys Software Integrity Group Offers You We care about our people. SIG offers a flexible work environment, competitive vacation policy. We care about our team's health and wellness Creativity is ingrained in our culture. We are innovative collaborators by nature. We thrive in exploring how things can be differently both in our internal processes and to help our clients Diversity is important to us. Growing, maintaining, and promoting a diverse team is a top priority for us. We foster and encourage diversity through our Employee Resource Groups and provide access to resources and education to support the education of our team, facilitate dialogue, and foster understanding. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender preference, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Covered Veteran in accordance with federal law. In addition, Synopsys complies with applicable state and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Synopsys Inc. also provides reasonable accommodation to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable laws

jobTitle: Senior Manager of Security Consulting (Remote, US) - 41593BR
jobDescription: Job Location: Can work remotely in US Employment Type: Full Time Salaried Employee Normal Working Hours: Mon-Fri, 8 hours/day, 40 hours per week, exempt Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2022 (6 years in a row) in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . Responsibilities The Senior Manager of Security Consulting requires a unique mix of planning, leadership, management, and consulting skills. You are accountable for scoping/pricing engagements, successful project delivery, quality management, profitability, customer satisfaction, and employee management, with overall responsibility for specific growth annually within the account base. In this role you will: Provide direct contribution to the transformation of processes, technology platforms, training methods, staff growth, and organizational culture to enable continued market leadership in application security testing Develop strong and lasting relationships with clients, actively look for opportunity during delivery to grow follow-on work to clients, assist in scoping/pricing new business, ensure engagements are properly executed, and serve as an effective escalation point for client issues and problems on engagements Provide client support to multiple clients from service delivery, periodic client reviews, and follow through/closeout of engagements Work in collaboration with the technology leadership to grow staff capability, provide feedback on delivery execution runbooks, tooling, and value derivation by clients Balance client services with effective resource utilization in partnership with the resource management organization and technology practice leaders Possess sufficient knowledge in applications security so as to guide service execution so as to be seen by the client as an industry expert, conduct scoping/pricing where necessary, and be able to present our position with confidence and credibility Instill a purpose of driving client satisfaction in the oversight of engagements Provide motivation, career development, and guidance to a diverse team of consultants in the organization as well as providing mentorship to other staff where necessary Oversee the accuracy, completeness, and compliance to internal and external expectations of the project deliverables Ensure the completion of internal processes required to effectively manage the business Participate in the transformation of processes, measurements, metrics as needed to optimize the business for scale and growth Participate in the adaptation of service definitions and processes to invent new market solutions and delivery methods to emerging market trends Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, or related technical discipline 5+ years of work experience managing cyber security consultants, professional services, or similar. 5+ years involvement in scoping/selling consulting services, with some experience selling cyber security consulting services (preferably application security but not required) Confident and effective relationship builder Sufficient application security knowledge to effectively design our services solutions for specific client needs and ability to estimate scope/cost/pricing Understanding of software development processes, technologies, architectures, and practices, and software risk management Willingness to travel as needed Benefits Work From Home Competitive Total Compensation Annual Performance Bonus Paid Vacation and Wellness Days Group Retirement Savings Plans and Employer Contributions ESPP Comprehensive Health Benefits Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Senior R&D Memory Engineer The Synopsys Non-Volatile-Memory team is looking for a Senior Level Memory Designer to development our next generation NVM IP. In this role, the candidate will have the opportunity to work on an extremely wide range of process technologies, ranging from complex BCD process nodes to 3nm and beyond. The ideal candidate must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills, independent and self-motivated, detail oriented, and able to work with a multi-national cross-functional teams. Responsibilities Contribute in all parts of advance memory development flow, starting at design spec Standard CMOS-based non-volatile memory circuit design Design and modified charge pump, voltage regulator and sense amplifier Working closely with on/off-site design, layout, and CAD teams Post layout extraction & simulation Full chip level Simulation/Verification (Digital and Analog Simulations) Work with Product Engineer to perform silicon verification Skills And Experience Required 5+ years of industry experience as an analog circuit designer or memory circuit designer Strong fundamentals of transistor level CMOS circuit design Familiar with circuit simulation tools (XA, HSIM, HSPICE, etc.) is required Must have prior experience with Industry standard design and layout tool (Custom Complier and ICV is a plus) Hands-on experience on sense-amplifier, voltage regulator, charge pump and bandgap reference design Experience with statistical design methodology (generating and analyzing Monte-Carlo results) Experience with chip level Simulation Hands-on experience of Si debugging Basic understanding of Verilog simulation flow is a plus Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in Canada are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

The Synopsys Embedded Memory and Logic Team is responsible for standard and custom embedded SRAMs /ROMs development and provides both functional and physical views of memory in form of Memory compilers, A semiconductor intellectual property (IP) for the design of complex integrated circuits . The team is completely responsible for all aspects of memory development starting from Bit Cell Analysis, Architecture Design, Characterization and Verification and we hope you will share your resume of interest with us. Responsibilities Develop Multiport SRAM/Register file architectures and circuit implementation techniques. Schematic entry, simulation of major blocks, layout planning, layout supervision and interface with CAD team for full verification and model generation. Designing and implementing optimum low-power and area-efficient embedded memory (SRAM, register files, etc.) circuits and architectures. Learn and apply skills in memory compilers having Transistor level circuit Design. Resolves a wide range of issues in creative ways Inter-team interaction customer focus Frequently networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise Experience of FinFet Technology for Memory Design With minimal supervision, prioritizes workload to successfully manage multiple tasks and responsibilities In this role, the Senior Engineer will be part of team contributing to Different type of Architectures of embedded SRAM, Register files and ROM. As a Senior Engineer, the individual will be involved in challenging projects and drive it to completion in record time. You will quickly ramp on the existing flow, understand the challenges, and produce the work plan. Your expertise in deep submicron technology and Finfet, SRAM design, processor design, Digital design flow and teamwork skills will be highly leveraged to guide activity across the entire cross-discipline, multi-site team. You will work with others to identify the issues, get buy-in on proposed solutions, and implement the solutions in time for the team to execute to schedule. Skills/Experience BE/B.Tech/ME/M.Tech/MS in Electrical & Electronics Engineering from premium institute/university with minimum of 5 years of experience in VLSI Design Deep understanding of SRAM/Register File architectures and advanced custom circuit implementations. Exposure to full embedded memory design flow: Architecture, circuit design, physical implementation, compiler automation, characterization, timing and model generation. Direct experience with the most advanced technology nodes. Familiarity with variation-aware design in nanometer technology nodes Hands on experience on scripting using Perl, python for automation Deep understanding of SRAM single port and multi-port design Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities, meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. Job Description The Digital Implementation team is seeking a highly motivated and innovative engineer who will be responsible for physical design implementation of the Mixed-Signal DDR PHY IPs in various cutting edge process technologies. As a Physical Design Engineer, the successful candidate will work on a variety of advanced DDR PHY developments including the latest standards in LP5x and DDR5. The position offers an excellent opportunity to work with an expert team of digital and mixed-signal engineers. Tasks will include but not be limited to, RTL synthesis, design floorplans, Place & Route, clock-tree synthesis, design equivalency check, STA timing closure, constraints analysis, electromigration & static and dynamic IR drop analysis, power estimation, DFT and physical verification such as DRC/LVS/ERC/PERC. Additional tasks will include generating design block views for SOC integration and signing off quality analysis before release. Requirements Requirements The successful candidate will have the following A degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering (or equivalent) and must have 3 years or more of industry experience working in digital or physical design role with recent contribution to project tape-outs. Previous experience with Physical Design of IPs or SoCs with ability to handle broad responsibility for block-level physical design implementation and understanding of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer or below, including low-power design techniques Experience with Synopsys tools or other equivalent tools for Synthesis, P&R, Physical verification, STA, Formal, EM/IR, DFT A solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of digital design and architecture, implementation flows and physical and timing signoff Development of timing constraints and design architectures to ensure on-time delivery, and to meet or exceed power and area targets Excellent communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction. Excellent software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python), understanding of CAD automation methods. Solid understanding of the challenges inherent in analog/digital interfaces and the ability to find solutions to complex design issues Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status

Tasks will include but not be limited to, RTL synthesis, design floorplans, Place & Route, clock-tree synthesis, design equivalency check, STA timing closure, constraints analysis, electromigration & static and dynamic IR drop analysis, power estimation, DFT and physical verification such as DRC/LVS/ERC/PERC. Additional tasks will include generating design block views for SOC integration and signing off quality analysis before release. Requirements Requirements The successful candidate will have the following A degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering (or equivalent) and must have 3 years or more of industry experience working in digital or physical design role with recent contribution to project tape-outs. Previous experience with Physical Design of IPs or SoCs with ability to handle broad responsibility for block-level physical design implementation and understanding of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer or below, including low-power design techniques Experience with Synopsys tools or other equivalent tools for Synthesis, P&R, Physical verification, STA, Formal, EM/IR, DFT A solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of digital design and architecture, implementation flows and physical and timing signoff Development of timing constraints and design architectures to ensure on-time delivery, and to meet or exceed power and area targets Excellent communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction. Excellent software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python), understanding of CAD automation methods. Solid understanding of the challenges inherent in analog/digital interfaces and the ability to find solutions to complex design issues Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status

Requirements Requirements The successful candidate will have the following A degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering (or equivalent) and must have 3 years or more of industry experience working in digital or physical design role with recent contribution to project tape-outs. Previous experience with Physical Design of IPs or SoCs with ability to handle broad responsibility for block-level physical design implementation and understanding of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer or below, including low-power design techniques Experience with Synopsys tools or other equivalent tools for Synthesis, P&R, Physical verification, STA, Formal, EM/IR, DFT A solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of digital design and architecture, implementation flows and physical and timing signoff Development of timing constraints and design architectures to ensure on-time delivery, and to meet or exceed power and area targets Excellent communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction. Excellent software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python), understanding of CAD automation methods. Solid understanding of the challenges inherent in analog/digital interfaces and the ability to find solutions to complex design issues Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Experience with advanced FinFET nodes, TSMC 16 nanometer or below, including low-power design techniques Experience with Synopsys tools or other equivalent tools for Synthesis, P&R, Physical verification, STA, Formal, EM/IR, DFT A solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of digital design and architecture, implementation flows and physical and timing signoff Development of timing constraints and design architectures to ensure on-time delivery, and to meet or exceed power and area targets Excellent communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction. Excellent software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python), understanding of CAD automation methods. Solid understanding of the challenges inherent in analog/digital interfaces and the ability to find solutions to complex design issues Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. Physical Design Engineer We’re looking for Physical Design Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will be the technical lead, responsible for the physical implementation of high speed interface IPs, sub-system, and test-chips, driving all aspects from RTL to GDS including timing and physical sign-off, in close interaction and collaborative team work with multiple functional groups (front end, analog, CAD) and the product team. Key Qualifications MSEE with 10 years Physical Design experience with recent contribution to project tape-outs, as a technical driver and as project lead. Has intimate knowledge of the full design cycle from RTL to GDSII, including chip level. Has solid engineering understanding of the underlying concepts of IC design, implementation flows and methodologies for deep submicron design. Has proven track record for technical steering of physical design Team for on-time delivery. Has good communication skills, ability to think and communicate at different levels of abstraction, with peer groups as well as customers. Has good software and scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python); knowledge of CAD automation methods. Has a good understanding of industry standards in deep sub-micron designs Autonomous, timely decision maker and able to cope with interrupts. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager -Application Security Tools - 41721BR
jobDescription: Senior Product Marketing Manager – Application Security Tools Synopsys Software Integrity Group is the recognized market leader in application security products and services, and we’re laser focused on helping organizations build trust in their software. We’re looking for a dynamic and highly motivated product marketing leader to join our team to help define and implement go to market plans for our code analysis application security tools. Are you good at translating complex technology into compelling and easy-to-understand product messaging? Are you fascinated by the convergence of cybersecurity and DevOps? Are you motivated by the challenge of building go to market strategies that both engage buyers and differentiate from other vendors? If so, then Synopsys’ Software Integrity Group is the place for you. What You’ll Do Develop a thorough understanding of the market trends and technologies and create compelling write-ups that successfully communicate the technology value. Participate frequently in customer, prospect, and partner scenarios as a product expert - to develop a deep understanding of their business and technical needs. Be the expert on your buyers, how they buy and their buying criteria; be the expert on your competition and how to win against them. Define and manage plans for product launches, coordinating efforts across service delivery, marketing, sales, and customer success teams. Develop positioning and messaging that differentiates Synopsys application security tools in the market. Communicate the value proposition of our AppSec tools to the sales team and develop the sales tools that support the selling process. Drive the creation of sales enablement resources including selling guides, presentations, and competitive insight. Work with the content marketing teams to create market awareness and promotional content including blogs, web pages, datasheets, and whitepapers for sales and marketing efforts to generate demand and demonstrate Synopsys market leadership. Contribute to the overall marketing plan with go-to-market and demand generation ideas and approaches What We’re Looking For 6+ years in product or technical marketing, product management, or related role within an enterprise software company Passion for application security technology and familiarity with market trends: Application Security, Cloud Security, DevOps, Containers, IoT, etc. Working knowledge of B2B marketing programs, demand/lead generation, and sales Strong written and verbal communication skills with a demonstrated ability to translate technical topics into clear communications for internal and external audiences, including customers, sales & marketing teams, press, and analyst. Proven ability to quickly learn new technical concepts and product capabilities. Team player with ability to think creatively and work collaboratively with others to create innovative messaging and content. High attention to detail and quality with the ability to work at a fast pace, managing changing deadlines and balancing shifting priorities across multiple projects. Results-oriented individual with an enthusiastic, can-do attitude and demonstrated pattern of accountable decision making Demonstrated leadership with experience managing, motivating and mentoring team members BS/BA in technical program preferred; MBA a plus. Some travel required. About the Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys builds trust in software by enabling organizations to manage application security, quality, and compliance risks at the speed their business demands. Our market-leading solutions help developers to secure code as fast as they write it; development and DevSecOps teams to automate testing within development pipelines without compromising velocity; and security teams to proactively manage risk and focus remediation efforts on what matters most. With Synopsys, organizations can transform the way they build and deliver software, aligning people, processes, and technology to intelligently address software risks across their portfolio and at all stages of the application lifecycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software .

Contribute to the overall marketing plan with go-to-market and demand generation ideas and approaches What We’re Looking For 6+ years in product or technical marketing, product management, or related role within an enterprise software company Passion for application security technology and familiarity with market trends: Application Security, Cloud Security, DevOps, Containers, IoT, etc. Working knowledge of B2B marketing programs, demand/lead generation, and sales Strong written and verbal communication skills with a demonstrated ability to translate technical topics into clear communications for internal and external audiences, including customers, sales & marketing teams, press, and analyst. Proven ability to quickly learn new technical concepts and product capabilities. Team player with ability to think creatively and work collaboratively with others to create innovative messaging and content. High attention to detail and quality with the ability to work at a fast pace, managing changing deadlines and balancing shifting priorities across multiple projects. Results-oriented individual with an enthusiastic, can-do attitude and demonstrated pattern of accountable decision making Demonstrated leadership with experience managing, motivating and mentoring team members BS/BA in technical program preferred; MBA a plus. Some travel required. About the Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys builds trust in software by enabling organizations to manage application security, quality, and compliance risks at the speed their business demands. Our market-leading solutions help developers to secure code as fast as they write it; development and DevSecOps teams to automate testing within development pipelines without compromising velocity; and security teams to proactively manage risk and focus remediation efforts on what matters most. With Synopsys, organizations can transform the way they build and deliver software, aligning people, processes, and technology to intelligently address software risks across their portfolio and at all stages of the application lifecycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software .

Job Description And Requirements : This developer is responsible for P&R optimization and Clock tree synthesis. This is an individual contributor role and will be in charge of architecture, design and implementation of Synopsys’ cutting-edge CTS. The successful person will work as a part of a high-performing team tasked with developing efficient algorithms for concurrent clock and data path optimization and useful skew optimization. Key Qualifications Minimum requirement of PhD with EDA/CAD tool development experience in P&R, timing, optimization or CTS. Designs algorithms and data structures. Has desires to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good investigation and problem-solving skills. Prior understanding and experience of EDA/CAD tool development is required. Possesses a full understanding of P&R, optimization, and/or CTS area plus a working understanding of adjacent areas of the implementation flow. Autonomously resolves a wide range of issues in imaginative ways on a regular basis. Customarily exercises self-directed judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. Performs in a project leadership role. Contributes to complex aspects of a project. Resolves and develops approaches to solutions. Work is self-directed and collaborative in nature. Represents the organization on business unit and/or company-wide projects. Guides more junior peers with aspects of their job. Frequently networks with senior internal and external personnel in their own area of expertise.Preferred Experience PhD in EDA related area with EDA software development experience. Expertise in the development of complex software projects with C/C++ coding in Linux environment. Proven background in data structures and algorithm development.At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Senior Salesforce Developer Job Summary The Senior Salesforce Developer will join a growing team of Salesforce professionals, who are responsible for the overall design, implementation, and support of solutions in the Salesforce.com environment. This role requires the ability to configure, develop and support both declarative and coded solutions in Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Community, Lightning development and the Force.com platform. Position Responsibilities Duties include designing and implementing key technical components of Salesforce solutions and working collaboratively with other technical and non-technical resources to develop and deliver solutions for evolving business initiatives and challenges. Daily functions also include ensuring compatibility with evolving business requirements. Along with the analysis, building, testing and deployment of projects and solutions, this role also collaborates with internal team members, as well as stakeholders and end-users to ensure a complete development lifecycle & compatibility with evolving business requirements. We operate in a flexible and proactive work environment to facilitate a quick response to changing business objectives and growth. Provide system administration support of Salesforce and related systems. Collaborate with internal stakeholder groups to develop and communicate comprehensive business requirements and technical design, as needed. As the Subject Matter Expert, develop system design specification documents. Monitor system user adoption and provide training, and/or input to trainers. Perform configuration, testing and deployment of highly visible, corporate initiative system projects. Follow through full system projects, utilizing your expertise to determine business problem, business impact, risks, value, solution options, plan for development, testing, deployment, etc. The Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate must be a proactive, critical thinker, possess a strong sense of ownership, and be able to work both independently and collaboratively. He / She is comfortable and successful in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and thrives on identifying and providing solutions to daily challenges as well as large corporate initiatives. Characteristics must include attention to detail, proficient problem solving and the ability to prioritize and multitask. Self-motivation and an inherent sense of urgency is critical. Required Qualifications And Experience 8+ years’ experience as a primary Salesforce Developer of Apex Classes and Triggers, Visualforce, Lightning components, test class coverage and the Salesforce API. 8+ years’ experience as primary administrator of declarative Salesforce setup components and configuration, including flows, validations, approval rules, permissions, etc. Strong soft skillset: analytical, troubleshooting, communication, effective listening and collaboration. Ability to understand and follow Salesforce implementation and release best practices. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable experience. Both Salesforce developer and administrator certification strongly preferred. Experience with Salesforce Lightning experience. Knowledge of Salesforce Appexchange solutions. Deep understanding of Salesforce Data modelling, management, security and SOQL. Experience with Workbench, Developer Console, Salesforce Dataloader, Github, AutoRabit, etc. Understanding of the full SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) Experience developing and documenting system design specifications. Experience with Salesforce Sandboxes and release management processes. Comfortable practicing Agile Methodology. Experience with data and system migrations a plus. Full Stack development /other system API experience a plus. Additional Salesforce certifications a plus, i.e. Administration, Service Cloud, Community, Data Architecture, etc. Experience with iPaaS systems a plus (Workato, Boomi, Mulesoft, Zapier, etc.) Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Our ideal applicants would be at home in a collaborative and vibrant culture. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Senior Salesforce Developer Job Summary The Senior Salesforce Developer will join a growing team of Salesforce professionals, who are responsible for the overall design, implementation, and support of solutions in the Salesforce.com environment. This role requires the ability to configure, develop and support both declarative and coded solutions in Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Community, Lightning development and the Force.com platform. Position Responsibilities Duties include designing and implementing key technical components of Salesforce solutions and working collaboratively with other technical and non-technical resources to develop and deliver solutions for evolving business initiatives and challenges. Daily functions also include ensuring compatibility with evolving business requirements. Along with the analysis, building, testing and deployment of projects and solutions, this role also collaborates with internal team members, as well as stakeholders and end-users to ensure a complete development lifecycle & compatibility with evolving business requirements. We operate in a flexible and proactive work environment to facilitate a quick response to changing business objectives and growth. Provide system administration support of Salesforce and related systems. Collaborate with internal stakeholder groups to develop and communicate comprehensive business requirements and technical design, as needed. As the Subject Matter Expert, develop system design specification documents. Monitor system user adoption and provide training, and/or input to trainers. Perform configuration, testing and deployment of highly visible, corporate initiative system projects. Follow through full system projects, utilizing your expertise to determine business problem, business impact, risks, value, solution options, plan for development, testing, deployment, etc. The Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate must be a proactive, critical thinker, possess a strong sense of ownership, and be able to work both independently and collaboratively. He / She is comfortable and successful in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and thrives on identifying and providing solutions to daily challenges as well as large corporate initiatives. Characteristics must include attention to detail, proficient problem solving and the ability to prioritize and multitask. Self-motivation and an inherent sense of urgency is critical. Required Qualifications And Experience 8+ years’ experience as a primary Salesforce Developer of Apex Classes and Triggers, Visualforce, Lightning components, test class coverage and the Salesforce API. 8+ years’ experience as primary administrator of declarative Salesforce setup components and configuration, including flows, validations, approval rules, permissions, etc. Strong soft skillset: analytical, troubleshooting, communication, effective listening and collaboration. Ability to understand and follow Salesforce implementation and release best practices. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable experience. Both Salesforce developer and administrator certification strongly preferred. Experience with Salesforce Lightning experience. Knowledge of Salesforce Appexchange solutions. Deep understanding of Salesforce Data modelling, management, security and SOQL. Experience with Workbench, Developer Console, Salesforce Dataloader, Github, AutoRabit, etc. Understanding of the full SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) Experience developing and documenting system design specifications. Experience with Salesforce Sandboxes and release management processes. Comfortable practicing Agile Methodology. Experience with data and system migrations a plus. Full Stack development /other system API experience a plus. Additional Salesforce certifications a plus, i.e. Administration, Service Cloud, Community, Data Architecture, etc. Experience with iPaaS systems a plus (Workato, Boomi, Mulesoft, Zapier, etc.) Our business is our experts. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Follow through full system projects, utilizing your expertise to determine business problem, business impact, risks, value, solution options, plan for development, testing, deployment, etc. The Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate must be a proactive, critical thinker, possess a strong sense of ownership, and be able to work both independently and collaboratively. He / She is comfortable and successful in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and thrives on identifying and providing solutions to daily challenges as well as large corporate initiatives. Characteristics must include attention to detail, proficient problem solving and the ability to prioritize and multitask. Self-motivation and an inherent sense of urgency is critical. Required Qualifications And Experience 8+ years’ experience as a primary Salesforce Developer of Apex Classes and Triggers, Visualforce, Lightning components, test class coverage and the Salesforce API. 8+ years’ experience as primary administrator of declarative Salesforce setup components and configuration, including flows, validations, approval rules, permissions, etc. Strong soft skillset: analytical, troubleshooting, communication, effective listening and collaboration. Ability to understand and follow Salesforce implementation and release best practices. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable experience. Both Salesforce developer and administrator certification strongly preferred. Experience with Salesforce Lightning experience. Knowledge of Salesforce Appexchange solutions. Deep understanding of Salesforce Data modelling, management, security and SOQL. Experience with Workbench, Developer Console, Salesforce Dataloader, Github, AutoRabit, etc. Understanding of the full SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) Experience developing and documenting system design specifications. Experience with Salesforce Sandboxes and release management processes. Comfortable practicing Agile Methodology. Experience with data and system migrations a plus. Full Stack development /other system API experience a plus. Senior Salesforce Developer Job Summary The Senior Salesforce Developer will join a growing team of Salesforce professionals, who are responsible for the overall design, implementation, and support of solutions in the Salesforce.com environment. This role requires the ability to configure, develop and support both declarative and coded solutions in Service Cloud, Sales Cloud, Community, Lightning development and the Force.com platform. Position Responsibilities Duties include designing and implementing key technical components of Salesforce solutions and working collaboratively with other technical and non-technical resources to develop and deliver solutions for evolving business initiatives and challenges. Daily functions also include ensuring compatibility with evolving business requirements. Along with the analysis, building, testing and deployment of projects and solutions, this role also collaborates with internal team members, as well as stakeholders and end-users to ensure a complete development lifecycle & compatibility with evolving business requirements. We operate in a flexible and proactive work environment to facilitate a quick response to changing business objectives and growth. Provide system administration support of Salesforce and related systems. Collaborate with internal stakeholder groups to develop and communicate comprehensive business requirements and technical design, as needed. As the Subject Matter Expert, develop system design specification documents. Monitor system user adoption and provide training, and/or input to trainers. Perform configuration, testing and deployment of highly visible, corporate initiative system projects. Follow through full system projects, utilizing your expertise to determine business problem, business impact, risks, value, solution options, plan for development, testing, deployment, etc. The Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate must be a proactive, critical thinker, possess a strong sense of ownership, and be able to work both independently and collaboratively. He / She is comfortable and successful in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and thrives on identifying and providing solutions to daily challenges as well as large corporate initiatives. Characteristics must include attention to detail, proficient problem solving and the ability to prioritize and multitask. Self-motivation and an inherent sense of urgency is critical. Required Qualifications And Experience 8+ years’ experience as a primary Salesforce Developer of Apex Classes and Triggers, Visualforce, Lightning components, test class coverage and the Salesforce API. 8+ years’ experience as primary administrator of declarative Salesforce setup components and configuration, including flows, validations, approval rules, permissions, etc. Strong soft skillset: analytical, troubleshooting, communication, effective listening and collaboration. Ability to understand and follow Salesforce implementation and release best practices. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or comparable experience. Both Salesforce developer and administrator certification strongly preferred. Experience with Salesforce Lightning experience. Knowledge of Salesforce Appexchange solutions. Deep understanding of Salesforce Data modelling, management, security and SOQL. Experience with Workbench, Developer Console, Salesforce Dataloader, Github, AutoRabit, etc. Understanding of the full SDLC (Software Development Life Cycle) Experience developing and documenting system design specifications. Experience with Salesforce Sandboxes and release management processes. Comfortable practicing Agile Methodology. Experience with data and system migrations a plus. Full Stack development /other system API experience a plus. Additional Salesforce certifications a plus, i.e. Administration, Service Cloud, Community, Data Architecture, etc. Experience with iPaaS systems a plus (Workato, Boomi, Mulesoft, Zapier, etc.) Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Our ideal applicants would be at home in a collaborative and vibrant culture. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Senior Security Consultant Job Description We’re looking for ethical hackers. Our Senior Security Consultants lead security engagements with a small team to analyze target systems, penetrate defenses, and exploit vulnerabilities. They think creatively about complex problems and communicate solutions to our clients in an easy to understand and meaningful way. Synopsys thrives on learning. Our consultants are exposed to a wide variety of technologies, attack techniques, and security countermeasures. They are assigned an industry-leading expert as a mentor, learn from their peers in a knowledge-rich environment, and share their own expertise with junior members of the team. We’re looking for people who want to accelerate their careers and make a strong impact on our team and our clients. Activities Skills You’re not expected to have all these skills on day 1, but here are some of the things you might get to work on while you’re here Application Penetration Testing Source Code Analysis Mobile App Security Threat Modeling Secure Software Design and Architecture Network Penetration Testing Embedded and IoT Security Analysis Cloud Security SSDLC and DevSecOps Technical Skills Qualifications and Experience Mobile penetration testing and threat modeling Modern application architecture including cloud based architecture or microservices Experience working with application developers to create security requirements and security design Familiarity with software attack and exploitation techniques Understanding of common web application security issues i.e., OWASP Top 10 and SANS Top 25 Command of defensive programming concepts and security countermeasures Experience with one or more software programming languages and frameworks Consulting Skills Proficiency in organizing and prioritizing multiple tasks, completing them independently, and meeting delivery timelines Ability to lead a team , give direction, and ensure tasks are executed consistently Preferred: experience in a customer-facing role Ability to travel up to 10-25% Communication Written communication skills applicable to preparing formal documentation, white papers, and case studies Ability to clearly articulate thoughts and present to both technical and non-technical audiences Coaching a team of 5-6 consultants Education Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent experience Company Description Our business is our experts. Our reputation as one of the leading software security consulting firms is the direct result of the expertise, diligence, and excellence of our consulting team. In fact, Synopsys Software Integrity Group was named a leader in 2020 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Our ideal applicants would be at home in a collaborative and vibrant culture. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.
