As a Silicon Validation Engineer, you will be part of an R&D team developing high speed SerDes PHYs. You will work with a cross functional design team of analog designers and hardware engineers from a wide variety of backgrounds. Our R&D test lab contains high speed test equipment. Examples include: 50 GHz oscilloscopes, 50GHz network analyzer, and BERTs up to 112Gb/s for SerDes test and debug. Responsibilities and Duties Performing testing on silicon implementations of high-speed analog integrated circuits Results review and debugging of silicon under test, as well as hardware supporting Running characterization tests and creating test reports Creating test boards/hardware solutions to support test, debug, and characterization Apply theoretical knowledge to investigate and explain circuit behavior and circuit limitations in a testing and characterization environment Qualifications A relevant degree in Electronic Engineering Solid Analog IC circuit knowledge Solid debugging skills Lab equipment skills Software programming experience (MATLAB, Python are preferences) FPGA programming knowledge (Verilog) Knowledge of interface protocols such as USB, PCI Express, SATA and Ethernet Knowledge of NRZ and PAM4 encoding Knowledge of communication interfaces such as JTAG, I2C and SPI Good English communication skills Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. Synopsys IT cloud team is responsible for providing best in class EDA Infrastructure & Design environment in the public cloud, optimized to meet the scale and complexity of the EDA workload. As we expand our cloud deployments, we are looking for a talented Site Reliability Engineer with experience in the EDA/HPC environment to deliver insights from massive scale data in real-time. Specifically, we are searching for someone who brings fresh ideas, demonstrates a unique and informed viewpoint, and enjoys collaborating with a cross-functional team to develop real-world solutions and positive user experiences at every interaction. Responsibilities Measure and optimize system performance, with an eye toward pushing our capabilities forward, getting ahead of customer needs, and innovating to continually improve. Implement, maintain, and consult on the observability stack that supports the needs of multiple internal stakeholders. Utilize your deep experience and problem-solving skills to help prevent and investigate production issues. Participate in the design and implementation of new system layers of high complexity compute environments. Researching and recommending specific systems, architectures, and applications, for cloud infrastructure solutions. Desired Skills Experience implementing and delivering monitoring solutions in development, QA, and Production environments. Domain Knowledge of the underlying infrastructure requirements such as Networking, Storage, and Hardware Optimization. Proven experience in High-Performance Computing environments for HPC/EDA workload. Extremely strong problem-solving / troubleshooting skills. HA and Scalability knowledge and experience Experience & Certifications in a range of cloud services such as GCP, AWS, Azure Relevant experience of 5+ yrs. BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. We’re looking for Software Architect to join the team. We are looking for motivated, self-directed and exceptional developers who will be responsible for designing, developing, troubleshooting, or debugging software programs. This opportunity involves creating software tools including EDA tools, utilities, databases, and Web-based tools, etc. compatible with open-source or commercially available compilers for a wide spectrum of static and dynamic programming languages. If you have coding skills, interest/experience in programming languages and drive to learn and grow we’d love to hear from you. Experience on development of complex software projects and familiar with C/C++, TCL/TK coding & mySQL. Requires a strong background in data structures and algorithms. Demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills. Knowledge and experience of CAD tool development is desired. Typically requires a minimum of 8+ years of related experience. Possesses a solid understanding of specialization area plus working knowledge of one other related area. Resolves issues in creative ways. Exercises independent judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions. Executes projects from start to completion. Contributes to moderately complex aspects of a project. Determines and develops recommendations to solutions. Works on team-driven or task-oriented projects. May guide more junior peers with aspects of their job. Networks with senior internal and external personnel in own area of expertise. Responsibilities For Software Architect Analyze structural requirements for new software and applications Design conceptual and logical data models and flowcharts Optimize new and current software applications and database systems Collaborate with team members to determine best practices and requirements for software Oversight and approval of programs and products before formal launch Oversee and support the coaching and training of team members Coordinate with corporate software engineering team to identify future needs and requirements Actively seek ways to improve business software processes and interactions Prepare an easy to understand report for supervisors detailing achieved milestones and short-term project goals Use a proactive approach to common challenges and by continually researching best practices in coding Troubleshoot coding problems quickly and efficiently to ensure a productive workplace Key Qualifications: Excellent C/C++ programming and software engineering skills Excellence in algorithm and data structure design with object oriented programming In-depth understanding of database structure principles & expertise in SQL Understanding open source technologies and experience development on Linux platforms Outstanding collaboration and communication skill are essential Experience overseeing customized development of processes for multiple projects simultaneously Professional experience analyzing code for weaknesses and errors, and overseeing plans to improve them Experience designing secure software systems based upon industry-specific specifications Sound problem-solving skills Excellent written and verbal skills Preferred Experience Experience with one or more of C/C++, TCL/TK, mySQL, JavaScript, Python and Groovy Experience with cloud platforms, such as AWS, Google Cloud or Azure is a plus Experience with spice simulation & cell/logic characterization is a plus Education and Certifications BS/MS in Computer Science or Responsibilities Synopsys is seeking applicants for a Senior Software Engineer. You will help us to create high-quality software for our USB products to be used by internal teams and customers.Our team’s focus is on low-level drivers and embedded software. Take part in the full software development lifecycle Read and write documentation Communicate with other teams and customers Develop requirements, functional specifications, and test plan Investigate, design, and develop solutions Test, debug, and verify code Test solutions on prototype hardware Perform code reviews Develop and maintain Linux Kernel drivers Contribute to the Linux Kernel and other open source projects Work with a global team Train and mentor junior team members Minimum requirements: MS in Computer Science or a related field Fluent in C, a high-level language such as Python Strong written and verbal communication Experience with object oriented programming and design Experience contributing to a large project Debugging and problem solving skills Ability and desire to learn new things and improve your skills Strong interest in software development Strives for excellence Preferred requirements: Comfortable working with hardware and test equipment Linux kernel experience Systems programming RTOS Firmware Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. We are looking for a passionate software developer to join the Digital Design Group and join our world-class software development team at Synopsys. The successful engineer will be responsible for designing and developing cutting-edge high-performance software for "Static Timing Analysis" (STA) for our RTL to GDS implementation solution. This software engineer will develop software tools using C++ for solving problems in the implementation and optimization of IC design flow. Responsibilities Designs algorithms and data structures that scale with any design size and are deployed in high-quality software products Customarily exercises a high level of judgment and interpretation in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to obtain results Understands customer requirements Collaborates with other personnel in a team Executes projects from start to completion with some guidance Desired Skills And Requirements Experience in development of software projects, proficient in C/C++ coding Solid knowledge of data structures and algorithms Has the desire to learn and explore new technologies Demonstrates good investigation and problem-solving skills BS/MS/Ph.D. or minimum 3 years of related experience At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. jobTitle: Senior Staff Optical Designer Illumination Optics - 38206BR
jobDescription: Senior Staff Optical Designer Illumination Optics Synopsys’ Optical Solutions Group has an opening in the Illumination Engineering Group for a Sr. Staff Optical Engineer Illumination Designer. The Illumination Engineering Group provides optical design services on a consulting basis to a wide variety of external customers in a wide range of applications that include space, medical, defense, industrial and consumer markets. This is an opportunity to join the leading provider of illumination design software that has been delivering cutting edge optical and illumination designs to its customers for over 50 years. Interact with some of the most talented engineers, marketers, and software developers in the field of optical design both inside the company and in our expansive customer community. Remote locations will be considered for qualified candidates. This is an individual contributor role as a member of the illumination optical design and engineering team within the Optical Solutions Group at Synopsys. The successful candidate will be experienced in the design of illumination systems, a proficient user of LightTools, and have an B.S., M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Optical Sciences, Physics, Applied Physics, Mechanical Engineering or related technical field. U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status is required, to enable the candidate access to ITAR-controlled projects. Industrial creativity, demonstrated skill in highly inter-disciplinary problem solving, ability to work unaided as a self-starter, and excellent engineering judgement and process understanding are required. A theoretical and working knowledge of radiative transfer theory, etendue, BSDF, volumetric scattering models and stray light analysis is required. A minimum of 10 years experience in illumination design is required with substantial experience using LED sources. Skills in the assessment of systems level and fabrication issues as they relate to the selection of an illumination optical design form/approach are required. Experience with the implementation of illumination optical system hardware including material selection, fabrication methods, tolerance allocation, and skills and experience in optical testing for both optical surfaces and systems are also needed. Experience in working with mechanical CAD software is required, experience with Solidworks or CATIA is preferred. Experience in the development of LightTools macros and user defined optical properties (UDOPs) to extend the capability of CODE V, both in the short term to satisfy the needs of specific customers, as well as long term, for the extension of the capabilities of LightTools, are also being sought. Equally important, a successful candidate will also be able to represent the skills and capabilities of the Illumination Engineering team to potential customers and emerging markets. Exceptional customer interaction skills are being sought. The successful candidate will have demonstrated sound design skills in highly multidimensional problem-solving environments. Join the leading provider of lens and illumination design and optimization software that has been delivering cutting edge optical and illumination designs to its customers for over 50 years. Interact with some of the most talented engineers, marketers, and software developers in the illumination optics field both inside the company and in our expansive customer community. Impact and extend the development our illumination software (LightTools). Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Synopsys, Software Integrity Group (SIG) helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open-source components, and application behavior. With combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software . We are looking for a full-stack Java developer to contribute to the Black Duck Integrations Team. Located in the Burlington, MA office (hybrid job), you will work closely with Architects and our Head Designers to plan and develop the next iterations of Black Duck Integrations. We are looking for experience with Java, Spring, Postgres, React, Redux, and other related technologies to be a core contributor to the Black Duck Security products. Senior Staff Java Developer (Full Stack) The ideal candidate is a self-motivated idea generator with previous full-stack experience and a proven verbal and interpersonal communicator with a positive attitude. The employee must be able to juggle multiple projects simultaneously with tight deadlines for each project. Main Responsibilities Design, develop and test a high-quality Java EE Software Product Conduct new technology research; bring fresh ideas and concepts to bear on product development Serve as a contributor in an agile team Attend and participate in weekly team meetings and peer code reviews Responsible for research, diagnosing, troubleshooting, and identifying solutions to resolve issues Demonstrations of work in progress Requirements: 12+ years of programming experience with any modern, object-oriented, and/or dynamic language like Java Solid OO Design principles and experience (CAP, Consistency, Availability, partitioning, scalability, concurrency, end to end application design for a large amount of use cases...). Database design SQL programming understanding and experience with relational databases like PostgreSQL Demonstrated ability with Spring or another inversion of control container Experience with container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Testing utilities such as Junit, Jest, Enzyme, Ava, etc. Ability to take ownership and lead (if necessary) Great work environment High-powered laptop, dual external displays, etc. Modern, open-concept office Snacks in the kitchen, games for break time Fantastic team Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. We’re looking for Design Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be developing world class standard cell circuits meeting the PPA targets. Key Qualifications BSEE or MSEE Must have 7+ years of Standard Cell library design experience Bring your previous experience working on advanced technology nodes like 7nm, 6nm, 5nm, 4nm and 3nm Former hands on experience in Circuit design and spice simulations will be needed. Must have scripting capability in TCL/PERL/Python Strong Analytical and Logical skills will be key for your success. Ability to work effectively with geographically distributed R&D teams, and to engage in cross-functional collaborations for optimization across the entire design chain. Preferred Experience Responsible for designing flips flops, clock gating cells, level shifters, power gating cells and other complex circuits. Experienced in standard cell circuits optimization to achieve better PPA. Have a clear understanding of layout design and experience in working with layout designers to optimize layout parasitic to achieve target PPA. The person best suited for this role will enjoy doing hands-on development as well as mentoring and coaching junior R&D engineers to expand their skills. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. As a Silicon Validation Engineer, you will be part of an R&D team developing high speed SerDes PHYs. As a Silicon Validation Engineer, you will be part of an R&D t eam developing high speed SerDes PHYs. You will work with a cross functional design team of analog designers and hardware engineers from a wide variety of backgrounds. Our R&D test lab contains high speed test equipment. Examples include: 50 GHz oscilloscopes, 50GHz network analyzer, and BERTs up to 112Gb/s for SerDes test and debug. Responsibilities And Duties Performing testing on silicon implementations of high-speed analog integrated circuits Results review and debugging of silicon under test, as well as hardware supporting Running characterization tests and creating test reports Creating test boards/hardware solutions to support test, debug, and characterization Apply theoretical knowledge to investigate and explain circuit behavior and circuit limitations in a testing and characterization environment Qualifications A relevant degree in Electronic Engineering Solid Analog IC circuit knowledge Solid debugging skills Lab equipment skills Software programming experience (MATLAB, Python are preferences) FPGA programming knowledge (Verilog) Knowledge of interface protocols such as USB, PCI Express, SATA and Ethernet Knowledge of NRZ and PAM4 encoding Knowledge of communication interfaces such as JTAG, I2C and SPI Good English communication skills Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. Responsible for the development and implementation of System Design Solutions using Synopsys EDA tools and IP to solve customer problems as part of a service project team. Demonstrates expertise in at least one service line area (which include RTL Design & Verification, Physical Design, Design for Test and SoC Design from spec to post-silicon bring-up). Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software . We are looking for a mid-level full-stack Java developer to contribute to the Black Duck Integrations Team. Located in the Burlington, MA office, you will work closely with Architects and our Head Designers to plan and develop the next iterations of Black Duck Integrations. We are looking for experience with Java, Spring, Postgres, React, Redux, and other related technologies. This is a chance to help guide the direction and be a core contributor to the Black Duck Security products. Full Stack Java Developer This job requires full-time, regular work with the Black Duck Engineering Team based in the Burlington office with the option of hybrid working from home and office a few days a week. Typical workdays are eight hours. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated idea generator with previous full stack experience and a proven verbal and interpersonal communicator with a positive attitude. The employee must be able to juggle multiple projects at a time with tight deadlines for each project. Main Responsibilities Design, develop and test a high-quality Java EE Software Product Conduct new technology research; bring fresh ideas and concepts to bear on product development Serve as a contributor in an agile team Attend and participate in weekly team meetings and peer code reviews Responsible for research, diagnosing, troubleshooting and identify solutions to resolve issues Demonstrations of work in progress Requirements Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science 2+ years of programming experience with any modern, object-oriented, and/or dynamic language like Java , Python Sound Object Oriented Design principles Database design SQL programming understanding and experience with relational databases like PostgreSQL Demonstrated ability with Spring or another inversion of control container Experience with container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Testing utilities such as Junit, Jest, Enzyme, Ava, etc. Great work environment High-powered laptop, dual external displays, etc. Modern, open concept office Snacks in the kitchen, games for break time Fantastic team Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

A successful candidate joining the Machine Learning Center of Excellence (ML CoE) team, part of Synopsys Silicon Realization Group will be designing and supporting machine learning applications for cutting-edge ICs and SoCs. Challenges include the ability to quickly learn and apply state of the art machine learning techniques for physical implementation and signoff flows, design of highly efficient data structures and algorithms, and a commitment to deliver top quality production software which exceeds customer expectations. The role calls for a developer who understands how to analyze problems, and propose solutions using machine learning. Knowledge/Experience required: machine learning, design of algorithms with efficient data structures, neural networks, pattern matching Has strong motivation to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good analysis and problem-solving skills. Working knowledge in developing and maintaining complex C++/C applications in a Unix/Linux environment. Attentive to stringent performance and quality requirements. Knowledge of EDA design tool implementation and signoff flows Strong communication skills, verbal and written. Ability to produce design documents detailing product requirements. BS/MS/Phd in EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 1-5 years of experience. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

About The Job We are looking for a System Software Engineer eager to work at bare metal to enable best use of cutting edge FPGA products (Synopsys HAPS HAPS-100 | Prototyping | Synopsys ). Has deep desire to learn and explore new technologies and demonstrates good debug and optimizations skills. Excited to work across HW-SW to enable best use of Hardware (HW). Responsibilities & Duties Develop and extend low-latency, high-availability, scalable applications for FPGA-based prototyping hardware Explore and develop runtime software stack used in FPGA-based prototyping and farms for complex and large design, SoC system and architecture like AI, AR/VR, self-driving car, cloud and 5G The runtime software provides unified flow and interface for user to interact with Synopsys HAPS (batch and API) for control, read/write data/messages etc. Develop and extend C++/Python/TCL APIs for runtime software, and integrate backend & frontend functions Integrate and collaborate with adjacent components like HAPS HW and HAPS Gateway (synopsys.com) Develop and extend test & test infrastructure Work closely with application engineers to support our customers Key Qualifications: BS/MS Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering Software development experience in developing and testing optimized commercial C/C++ applications in Linux and Windows environment Experience with efficient algorithm, data structure, design patterns like object-oriented design (OOD) and object-oriented programming (OOP) Experience with system level programming and script languages such as Python, TCL, Unix shell script and Windows batch script Experience with multithreading, RPC, socket programming Experience with HW/SW co-design or embedded processor-based systems. Desire to learn and explore unfamiliar concepts, flows and techniques Excellent troubleshooting and debugging skill, and communication skills, verbal and written. Ability to coordinate discussion with other teams across different time zones. Preferred Experience: Proven ability to work with multiple languages in different scenarios Good understanding of digital hardware design, FPGA and embedded processors. FPGA/Embedded software/driver development Exposure to Full Stack Software developer like NodeJS, Angular and associated technologies such as Express, MongoDB, SocketIO/Websockets, REST APIs Developing and maintaining API libraries for other teams/customers. Job Description And Requirements We are looking for a technology expert and thought leader to be the solution architect for Synopsys’ end-to-end solution for multi-die systems (system-of-chips). The scope includes design and validation of such systems from software to silicon and beyond. The person will become the focal point of contact for key stakeholders, drive solution requirements and collaboration between cross-functional teams across various disciplines. Key Responsibilities Be the focal point to shape and drive the Synopsys-wide strategy and solution for multi-die systems (system-of-chips) from software to silicon and beyond. Actively engage with customers to understand needs and opportunities; provide an outside-in (customer and competitive) view of requirements to Synopsys domain experts and R&D to shape product direction and roadmap Drive collaboration with stakeholders across multiple business groups to ensure a cohesive solution for customers Provide clear messaging, value proposition and benefits of the Synopsys solution to customers and partner with sales and marketing to execute on the go-to-market strategy Job Requirements Undergraduate degree in electrical engineering or related field; graduate degree preferred 15+ years of industry experience in semiconductor systems design or related field. The ideal candidate will have recent experience in the architecture, design and validation of system-of-chips with broad exposure to the complete lifecycle from software to silicon and beyond. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to communicate clearly and effectively at different levels including management, engineering leadership, sales, etc. Highly motivated individual who can drive own priorities, collaborate effectively in a matrix organization, and can deliver results with strong influencing skills and a systematic approach to problem solving. The Solutions Engineer (SE) will use a customer-centric approach to work dynamically across product lines and/or business units to develop comprehensive solutions with full customer flows. The Solutions Engineer will interact with customers and industry partners, in partnership with the AE, to assess customer flows, gather requirements and propose solutions. The SE may also be involved in strategic design services to enable and accelerate customer adoption and improving the Quality of Results (QOR). This role will drive, protype and design new methodologies and solutions across SNPS products. This role will also analyze gathered data, identify the viability of technology and present findings to customers, as well as back to R&D teams to for future product enhancements and features. Leverages technical knowledge of multiple Synopsys products and tools, to define and create differentiated solutions that meet customer requirements and specifications, and to determine feasibility to expand into new and existing markets.

At Synopsys, we are enthusiastic learners and seasoned inventors. We are makers and visionaries who make technology safer. We are innovators who develop the software and hardware that drive the world’s high-performing chips for amazing things like autonomous vehicles, smart homes, and machines that learn. We embrace diversity as a company, so we can create solutions that serve not just technology but the humans behind it. Seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Full chip Integration Engineer with a passion for innovation and top-notch execution. The candidate will be working with a highly experienced digital and mixed-signal SoC team. Excellent theoretical and practical background in physical design, integration, and verification is highly desirable. You will own chip level place and route (PnR), final gds/oasis/def database construction and verification. You will develop and validate Power Grid, including routability analysis. Drive hard IP integration, full-chip level EM/IR and interface timing closure. You will work with the implementation/CAD teams during the entire chip design cycle to drive signoff closure for tapeout. Work with SOC team to meet IP technical and delivery requirements, Key Qualifications MSEE or BSEE with 10+ years of physical (digital) design and full chip signoff verification experience in the industry. Deep knowledge of the ASIC development flow, including architecture specification, digital design, physical implementation, and verification, as well as signoff. Must have experience in top-level floorplanning, block integration, partitioning, budgeting, and place and route Must have experience in EMIR , SIGEM analysis, physical PDV, DRC/LVS verification, and DFM Working knowledge of extraction, STA methodology and formal verification tools Must have experience in scripting. Experience in test chip and production silicon debugs is a plus. Proven leadership and team-building skills, able to motivate others and nurture a culture of quality, ownership, and continuous improvement. Collaborative approach and ability to develop excellent alliances cross-functionally. Excellent communication, organization, and time management skills Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. Responsibilities ResponsibilitiesAs Applications Engineer you will have responsibilities both in a pre-sales and a post-sales context Synopsys is seeking an enthusiastic and creative engineer to enhance its team. We are looking for an Applications Engineer who will provide customer support for the design tools for application-specific processors (ASIPs). Our “ASIP Designer” tool-suite is used by customers across the globe in the development of systems-on-chip (SoC) for artificial intelligence, smart vision systems, wireless communication, network equipment, audio and video, hearing instruments, automotive and other application areas. You will support potential customers that are evaluating ASIP Designer. You will study the application of the customer and you will develop innovative processor features for that application. You will assist customers in their use of ASIP Designer. You will investigate and answer in-depth technical questions and suggest innovative solutions on the customer’s use of ASIP Designer. You will primarily interact with the customer via e-mail and phone, but short-term travel to customers may be required occasionally.Requirements MSc degree in engineering. In-depth knowledge of processor architectures in general and of DSP architectures specifically. Experience in the following areas: embedded software design (C and/or assembly), DSP algorithms and RTL design. Solid problem-solving skills and broad technical credibility in the above areas. Proven communication skills.Synopsys offers a stimulating work environment with international contacts, flexibility and an attractive compensation package. You will work with highly professional and motivated colleagues who value your contribution. If this job description sounds interesting, we look forward to hearing from you.

Synopsys Applications Engineer At Synopsys, we are enthusiastic learners and seasoned inventors. We are makers and visionaries who make technology safer. We are innovators who develop the software and hardware that drive the world’s high-performing chips for amazing things like autonomous vehicles, smart homes, and machines that learn. We embrace diversity as a company, so we can create solutions that serve not just technology but the humans behind it. Our Customer Success Group is all about delivering high-value solutions to our customers while driving growth. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the applications engineering team that supports the industry-leading solutions for Verification, Implementation, and Signoff. The primary focus of the Application Engineer (AE) is to drive increased usage of the product by collaborating with R&D and the Sales team in a dynamic, innovative environment. Some of the tasks include conducting competitive benchmarks and evaluations where they articulate the superiority of our customer’s design team and management. In addition, AE’s deliver customer training, tape-out support, and collaborate on initiatives for product enhancements. The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. We’re looking for an Application Engineer to join a world-class AE team responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading Parasitics Extraction solutions for digital and custom designs. In this role, you will be an Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our Customer Success Organization enabling the success of our customers in designing advanced chips on leading-edge process technologies. You will provide technical and engineering insight and direction to improving usability, applicability, and adoption of implementation products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you? Main Responsibilities Use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise and support for our top customers. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer designs. Work directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement our technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partner with customers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions, and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. The job will facilitate skillset development in Physical Verification, static timing analysis for digital designs, timing and reliability analysis for custom designs, customer relationship management, and provides business exposure. Key Qualifications BS/MS EE/CE/CS or related discipline with 5+ years of experience Hands-on experience with Interconnect Parasitics Extraction tools such as StarRC, Quickcap etc on advanced FinFET nodes is required. Working knowledge of digital/custom design flows and process technology is required. Experience with one or more scripting languages such as Python, TCL, Perl is required. Experience with commercial STA tools such as PrimeTime and simulation tools such as Hspice, Finesim is a plus. Excellent communication and presentation skills with a passion for world-class customer service. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. We’re looking for an Application Engineer to join a world-class AE team responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading Parasitics Extraction solutions for digital and custom designs. In this role, you will be an Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our Customer Success Organization enabling the success of our customers in designing advanced chips on leading-edge process technologies. You will provide technical and engineering insight and direction to improving usability, applicability, and adoption of implementation products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you? Main Responsibilities Use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise and support for our top customers. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer designs. Work directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement our technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partner with customers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions, and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. The job will facilitate skillset development in Physical Verification, static timing analysis for digital designs, timing and reliability analysis for custom designs, customer relationship management, and provides business exposure. Key Qualifications BS/MS EE/CE/CS or related discipline with 5+ years of experience Hands-on experience with Interconnect Parasitics Extraction tools such as StarRC, Quickcap etc on advanced FinFET nodes is required. Working knowledge of digital/custom design flows and process technology is required. Experience with one or more scripting languages such as Python, TCL, Perl is required. Experience with commercial STA tools such as PrimeTime and simulation tools such as Hspice, Finesim is a plus. Excellent communication and presentation skills with a passion for world-class customer service. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We’re looking for Physical Design Specialist (PDS) to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In This Role You Would Be The primary focus of the Physical Design Specialist (PDS) is to support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products to help customers achieve tangible and lasting performance improvements in the cost, quality, and development time for projects. PDS are expected to possess Place & Route (physical) , Synthesis (logical and physical), STA experience and knowledge. PDS AEs are expected to be knowledgeable in multiple domains of design implementation and understand codependency of flow and methodology such as Macro & Standard Cell Placement, Clock Tree Synthesis, Routing, Advanced Timing Optimization techniques. Additional knowledge of RTL Coding, Synthesis, Equivalency check, Constraints (timing & Power) is preferable. In addition, PDS AEs will articulate design methodologies involving Synopsys tools at a very advanced Node (Sub 5nm) using Synopsys Full RTL-to-GDSII solution (Fusion Compiler). Development time will be spent gaining expertise in additional, or specialization tools, broadening focus from product emphasis to methodology, sharpening Account Management skills, and learning to leverage success. PDS AEs are expected to manage multiple customer activities concurrently, and work with Account Managers and AC management to set their priorities. Sales support roles include product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive benchmarking. Customer support roles include training, problem resolution, and technical account management. PDS AEs must be able to interact effectively with end-users at customer sites, as well as first level managers. PDS AEs also participate in account planning, where they work as part of the account team to develop the Synopsys solution to customer problems by bringing their understanding of customers' needs and issues. Key Qualifications Design experience should include ASIC design using industry-standard tools (Placement, Optimization, Routing) RTL to GDSII full flow experience or knowledge is preferable Strong interest and understanding of Advanced Node & Design methodologies are required. Deep Synopsys Back end tool (Logical and Physical Synthesis, Macro Placement, Routing at advanced Node , Static Timing Analysis, including noise analysis) experience and knowledge are required. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex many issues & set priorities, and the desire to help customers exploit new technologies are essential for success in the position. Preferred Experience: BSEE or equivalent, required with 5+ years of experience, or MSEE, or equivalent with 3+ years of experience. Tool knowledge expected: Back end P&R tools (Fusion Compiler, ICC2, Innovus) Tool knowledge (preferred) : front end Synthesis tools (Fusion Compiler, Design Compiler, Genus), Tool knowledge (preferred): STA (Primetime, Tempus), Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we are at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we are powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation and SoC Design, we want to meet you. Our Systems Solutions Group (SSG) delivers tool, methodology, architecture, design creation, design verification and physical implementation expertise to enable leading edge customers to complete their most challenging SoC design projects. Our work spans from sub-blocks to full turnkey end-to-end SoCs. Our customers range from start-ups to industry leaders, commercial companies and government agencies. Our customers develop SOCs for high-performance computing, automotive, aerospace & defense, and more. We’re looking for an CAD Engineer to contribute to the physical design and implementation segment of our SSG CAD team and implement CAD solutions critical to our SoC Design projects. Our CAD Engineers provide technical PD and flow contributions for our SSG CAD Team to build/maintain an SSG “standard” implementation flow used for our RTL-to-GDSII services projects. The flow leverages our Synopsys EDA tool reference flows, flow automation, DSO.ai and Metrics/Analytics. Additionally, our CAD Engineers may be involved with and help enable broader end-to-end flow capabilities for solutions comprising Architecture, prototyping platforms, HW/SW co-verification, RTL development and design verification. Our CAD Engineers own and drive specific flow development tasks to plug-in and optimize the standard flow for design/foundry-specific requirements. They also own optimization of the SSG standard flow to meet Automotive implementation requirements for our Automotive projects. Additionally, they drive or assist with services coordination at key foundries and internal IT/compute enablement. Key Qualifications And Experiences Proven experience using Synopsys physical design and analysis tools and developing RTL-to-GDSII tool flows. Proven abilities to optimize flows for productivity and design optimization. Abilities to work across teams and with R&D to optimize leverage of reference flows and provide feedback on future tool improvements and needs. Passion to work closely with PD teams and builds and maintains flows. Experience working in a customer focused environment with great communication skills This position may include assignment to government contracts. Consequently, the ability to obtain government security clearances and/or other work clearances is preferred and will be required in the event of assignment to government contract work. Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering 8+ years of experience driving RTL-to-GDSII Synopsys tools. 5+ years of experience developing flows for Synopsys tools. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our System Design Solutions (SDS) services team delivers tool, methodology, design creation, verification and implementation expertise to enable leading edge customers to complete their most challenging SoC design projects. Our customers range from industry leaders to start-ups, developing products for applications such as telecommunications, wireless, broadband, automotive, AI, and high-performance computing. Our services work ranges from collaborating with customers to provide specific design skills and assistance for an SoC development, providing design flow and methodology deployment, performing RTL2GDSII implementation for blocks, sub-systems and full SoCs, and executing full SoC turnkey design from specification to parts. We’re looking for an SoC Engineer, Staff – Design for Test (DFT) specialist . Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will perform SoC DFT architecture, implementation and verification at block and chip levels as well as provide DFT design flow methodology expertise. As a Staff DFT SoC engineer you will play a critical role in many aspects of our customers chip design process, including DFT methodology development, DFT planning & architecture, test insertion, ATPG pattern generation and post silicon test support. You will be responsible for assisting our customers in addressing their most challenging DFT issues using Synopsys’ DFT technology. As a Staff DFT SoC Engineer, you will work either as an individual contributor or as a project lead for the DFT function, depending on the size and scope of the project. Staff DFT SoC Engineers may be assigned to projects that range from turnkey design implementation projects done by SDS members off-site to joint design assistance projects where members of the SDS team work closely with our customers design team members at the customer or SDS site. Key Qualifications Implement and verify DFT solutions for customers advanced SoC designs to successfully meet customer requirements and achieve first pass silicon success Architect DFT SoC solutions for customers advanced SoC designs to successfully meet customer requirements and achieve first pass silicon success Develop and improve DFT scripts, flows, and best practices to meet growing Customer SoC demands Excel in skill areas including DFT technical expertise, team work, customer focus, and communication. Drive the pre-sales process through planning and scoping of projects. Develop, improve, and maintain the organization and processes to successfully meet and exceed the BUs sales goals. Ability to travel on occasion for short periods of time, and occasionally work on-site at customer premises as required. This position may include assignment to government contracts. Consequently, the ability to obtain government security clearances and/or other work clearances is preferred, and will be required in the event of assignment to government contract work. Preferred Experience Experience with all DFT aspects of an SoC including: ATPG, BSD, JTAG, LBIST, MBIST, Scan insertion, compression, core wrapping and DFT debug and diagnostics Experience with Synopsys DFT toolset including TestMax, Design Compiler, DFTMAX, Fusion Compiler, PrimeTime, TetraMax, VCS and SpyGlass Demonstrate experience as a senior technical contributor and leader on DFT projects. BS with 8 - 10 yrs relevant experience. MS with 7+ yrs relevant experience. Related Ph.D. with 5+yrs. Automotive experience developing and meeting strict functional safety and ISO26262 requirements Experience working in a customer focused environment with great communication skills Extensive experience partnering across functional and global lines. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. Applications Engineer, Sr Staff We’re looking for an Applications Engineer to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? Synopsys offers a broad portfolio of high-quality, silicon-proven IP solutions for the most widely used interfaces such as PCI Express, USB, DDR, SATA, HDMI, MIPI, and Ethernet. As a Post-sales Applications Engineer in the Solutions Group at Synopsys, you will be responsible for technical support of customers using Synopsys DesignWare Cores IP. You will investigate and resolve complex IP usage issues and provide timely, accurate technical guidance to customers. You will have regular contact with external customers and internal contacts across cross-functional teams. Occasional travel will be required. Key Qualifications Provide excellent Technical Support to enable configuring and integrating the Synopsys Interface IPs into customer’s SoC. Work closely with customers to understand current design/verification flow and future needs. Anticipate, diagnose and resolve customer problems coordinating, as necessary, with cross-functional teams. Drive best practices and lessons learnt from evaluations and customer interactions back into product development. Debug designs in simulation, emulation and silicon. Engage proactively with customers during integration and silicon debug. Preferred Experience Bachelors and/or master’s degree in Electrical and/or Electronic Engineering, Computer Engineering or Computer Science. Minimum of 8+ years relevant experience in ASIC/SoC front-end design including RTL coding in Verilog, design and Clock Tree Synthesis, Static Timing Analysis, equivalence checking. Full understanding of digital design methodologies and tools including formal verification. Domain knowledge of at least one of the following protocols: USB Ideally have experienced at least one ASIC/SoC tape-out from concept to full production. Silicon debug and troubleshooting skills are highly desirable. Technically creative, results oriented with the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently including customer support issues and priorities. Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with customers as well as peers. High degree of self-motivation and personal responsibility. Excellent analytic, reasoning and problem-solving skills and attention to details. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we are powering all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. We have a passion for innovation, and we want to meet you. Our Silicon Design, Verification, and Manufacturing business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We are the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we enable our customer to design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. Our Synopsys Cloud business combines the availability of advanced compute and storage infrastructure with unlimited access to EDA software licenses on-demand so our customers can focus on what they do best – design chips, faster. With cloud native EDA tools and pre-optimized hardware platforms, flexible business models, and a modern customer experience, Synopsys has reimagined the future of chip design on the cloud that does not disrupt proven workflows. We are looking for an Emerging Product Solutions Sales Lead to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be accountable for driving sales of emerging solutions, such as Synopsys Cloud. You and your team will work with customers to learn about their emerging requirements and work with technical experts to develop and position solutions. You will create business proposals and close business agreements. You will partner with technical teams to ensure customer success and business growth. Key Qualifications Ability to manage complex business and technical engagements resulting in customer success and business growth. Effective communication with a broad range of technical and non-technical people. A proven knowledge of semiconductor design and EDA tool flows and the desire to uncover emerging trends at our customers and develop into new business opportunities. Preferred Experience A BS with at least 10 years of experience in customer facing sales roles in the areas of Integrated Circuit Design, EDA flows, semiconductor manufacturing or Cloud sales. A history of building global teams to drive success selling for complex technical products and services in the EDA or semiconductor industry. Experience selling business value to executives. Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Sr Manager, Global Network Operations (Standards and Compliance) - 41488BR
jobDescription: Synopsys is looking for a Sr Manager to lead our global network operations team responsible for maintaining network design standards, connectivity services, access controls, network security governance, and compliance. You will be managing a team of dynamic, talented, and collaborative engineers in charge of designing, deploying, and supporting a large-scale global network consisting of 600K+ cores, 60PB+ of storage, 130+ office locations, and 18K+ employees worldwide. At Synopsys, we are driving IT and business transformation changes through internal innovation and leading-edge technologies. In this role, you will have the opportunity to manage a best-in-class enterprise network while contributing to and driving trending technology and solutions changes (Hybrid cloud, SASE, SDWAN, SDDC, segmentation, and building next-gen data centers to support rapid growth) What you will do: Manage and lead a team of network engineers responsible for implementing and enforcing network design/configuration standards, network security compliance, access controls, support processes, and data governance Manage and continuously explore options to performance, scalability, and reliability for all network connectivity and access services: LAN, WAN, wireless, remote access, QoS, WAN optimization, AAA, NAC, firewalls, and performance monitoring Provide Tier3 operations support, escalation, and guidance for Global NOC team to ensure 24/7 L1/L2 coverage and SLA requirements Collaborate and align closely with the Global NOC manager on maintaining network design and configuration standards, policies, and procedures for supporting new technologies and solutions Provide leadership and training to your team and Global NOC engineers for maintaining high-quality ITSM network ticketing support Manage and improve network security design standards and defense controls for global networks, data centers, and cloud Establish, and manage regular compliance audits for security vulnerabilities, network performance, capacity, and policy/configuration standards Drive network security vulnerability and patch management schedule in alignment with infosec policy and compliance SLA Capacity planning, acquisition, and managing installations, upgrades, and logistics of various networking and security platforms Closely engage with key stakeholders from user communities for technical issues, and future enhancements as well as introduce new technologies/workflows to improve business productivity Key Roles And Responsibilities Design, evolve, and document deployment and support processes for new technology, platforms, and solution changes Asset inventory and life cycle mgmt. for all networking component Champion and drive automation mindset, framework, and create self-service catalogs for repeatable task Partner closely with the network engineering and projects team to Identify and evaluate new technologies, solutions, and processes for improved scaling, efficiency, security, and performance Partner with infrastructure service owners to establish and evolve services and technology road-maps Partner with key vendors to influence future product requirements and enhancements to address business needs Work across teams to facilitate high performance and reliability of Engineering compute infrastructure Identify patterns, foresee potential recurrence, and preempt with continuous improvement solutions Provide leadership, organization, motivation, and career development for the network operations team Contribute to architecture, planning, implementing, and driving major initiatives related to networks, security, cloud, and data centers Establish and drive shared team vision, strategies, and road-maps that align with business priorities Establish and publish regular KPI’s/metrics useful for measuring performance, SLA, stability, and customer satisfaction Manage global network monitoring tools/systems for performance optimization, HA, logging, alerting, and reporting Provide regular trending over-time data/metrics for measurable success, performance, efficiency, and scaling for cost mgmt. Facilitate, communicate and drive required network upgrades, configuration changes, maintenance, and service improvement plans Recruit, develop, mentor, and retain talents by encouraging continuous training, career development, and knowledge sharing Define, publish, and maintain technology, design, deployment, monitoring, operations, and support standards Managing vendor relations, maintenance, contract negotiation, communications budget, and capacity growth planning Inspire and cultivate innovation, effective communication, and the value of building trust Establish a strong culture for creating good documentation, knowledge sharing, and publishing KB articles Critical Qualification Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a technology-related field 10 + years of relevant experience in network engineering, network architecting, designing, installing, and maintaining network systems in a large enterprise environment 10+ years of hands-on experience on various network technologies and designs: LAN, WAN, Campus, Data Center, WiFi, Remote Access, Firewalls, Switches, Network Access controls 5+ years of leadership and people management experience in a large-scale network environment Knowledgeable in supporting core critical network infrastructure: LAN, WAN, DC, Wireless, and VPN for remote access Comfortable with operating and communicating as a subject matter expert Excellent verbal, written communication, and presentation skills (including the development of procedural documentation) Capable and comfortable with presenting to internal and external audiences, and interacting with senior management, colleagues, and customers Proven experience supporting and troubleshooting complex infra and systems Proven ability to work with customers to prioritize issues and communicate status Ability to guide the network operations team in troubleshooting complex issues Strong leadership and conflict management skills Ability to multi-task and work effectively across multiple deliverables Organized with excellent attention to detail Additional Preferred Qualifications Knowledgeable and experience in trending technologies and solutions: SDWAN, WiFi6, Zero Trust Architecture, SASE solutions, always-on VPN solutions Knowledgeable and experience with networking providers and platforms: Cisco ACI/Aruba HPE/Palo Alto Firewalls/Zscaler SASE solutions CCNP, CCIE certification or equivalent is a plus. Knowledgeable of cloud concepts, technologies, and designs Knowledge of directory and engineering services like LDAP/AD/DNS/NISAt Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys, the 15th largest software company in the world, is seeking a Midwest Senior Manager to manage a team of individual contributors to drive bookings for the Synopsys Software Integrity Group Business Unit (SIG) as a result of our growth. The Senior Sales Manager must be highly motivated and a proven sales management executive in the area of software tools and security services with demonstrated experience in managing individual contributors who sell to software development and security teams. The Senior Manager will work closely with their Sales Engineer and Consulting team to drive end-to-end solutions for our prospects and customers. A principal goal for this position is to manage a team of individual contributors that sell enterprise software and consulting agreements within several named accounts, and in so doing create a means for the achievement of the team’s booking target. This position requires the Senior Manager to recruit, hire, train, mentor, and manage a team of individual contributors. The Senior Manager must have proven skills and experience in the selling of complex solutions in complicated customer environments. Preferred Experience  Experience in managing a team of individual contributors Software engineering tools experience Security software sales experience Global, named or large enterprise account management experience Some experience with State, Local and Educational accounts Responsibilities  Manage a team of individual contributors to drive top-line sales bookings Recruit, hire, train, and mentor individual contributors as necessary Develop and refine sales processes that are specific to the region Collaborate with global team members to foster a solid sense of community and information sharing among named accounts Solid focus on relationship-building with executive decision-makers Mentor individual contributors to guide prospects through a methodical sales process to facilitate decisions Ensure customer success Represent SIG at local and/or industry events Ensure that individual contributors maintain accurate forecast and account planning information Travel as necessary to client locations Required Skills & Knowledge  Minimum 3 years managing enterprise software sales executives, particularly in the Midwest Proven track record of exceeding a team’s software sales booking targets Proven ability to sell multiyear, six- or seven-figure enterprise licensing agreements Proven ability to build and maintain relationships with executive decision-makers Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent communications and presentations skills About The Synopsys Software Integrity Group Synopsys Software Integrity Group helps organizations build secure, high-quality software, minimizing risks while maximizing speed and productivity. Synopsys, a recognized leader in application security, provides static analysis, software composition analysis, and dynamic analysis solutions that enable teams to quickly find and fix vulnerabilities and defects in proprietary code, open-source components, and application behavior. With a combination of industry-leading tools, services, and expertise, only Synopsys helps organizations maximize security and quality in DevSecOps and throughout the software development life cycle. For more information, go to www.synopsys.com/software. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender preference, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Covered Veteran in accordance with federal law. In addition, Synopsys complies with applicable state and local laws prohibiting discrimination in employment in every jurisdiction in which it maintains facilities. Synopsys Inc. also provides reasonable accommodation to individuals with a disability in accordance with applicable laws.

Director, Foundry Design Technology Co-Optimization Synopsys Inc Mountain View, CA Job Description & Requirements Our Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) business is all about building next-generation intelligent in-chip sensors, hardware/software capabilities and analytics to integrate into technology products to manage and improve each semiconductor lifecycle stage. We offer the world’s first full hardware IP, test, and end-to-end analytics to help customers integrate faster, optimize performance/power/area/schedule/yield, and enhance reliability. Meeting the unique challenges posed by various target applications, SLM enables differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. Additional Responsibilities Include The Foundry Design Technology Co-Optimization (FDTCO) team has end to end ownership of the HDG’s (Hardware Development Group) products process technology. From pre-silicon to volume production, the goal is to enable optimization of HDG’s hardware to the target foundry and to provide Synopsys’ SLM business with the most predictable, flexible, and reliable foundry technology. We are seeking an experienced, highly motivated, and high-caliber individual to lead the FDTCO team. This individual should have extensive experience liaising with foundries and working with the foundry & design engineering community to co-optimize analog and digital designs mapped to these foundries. The candidate will also find and recruit a talented team to execute against the FDTCO team’s vision, mission, and goals. Be the liaison between the foundry and HDG to deliver physical design to the foundry Collaborate with HDG design and CAD to ensure stable design environment Enable design kits to ensure design restrictions, performance/power/area, yield, and reliability Review physical verification results for technology compliance prior to IP or customer SOC level production releases Set expectations for foundry capability and drive the foundry to meet the product requirements Optimize process targeting and monitor process targeting for yield/performance/power and yield Provide accurate pre-silicon yield forecast Feedback reliability observations to the foundry and drive process improvements as needed Accountability for managing the foundry technology through different phases of the product and technology lifecycle Act as liaison between HDG’s products, customers, and foundry partners to ensure high quality product tape out Job Requirements BS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering Experience building and managing global teams 15+ years of experience in liaising with foundries and design-technology co-optimization Demonstrated technical expertise in the productization of advanced technologies Strong technical program management skills Fundamental understanding of semiconductor device physics, reliability including ESD/Latch-Up/EM, aging (HCI/NBTI), silicon process technology and circuit design Understanding of the design, manufacturing, and test process, and the overall supply chain from foundries to customers Demonstrated experience with multiple CAD flows: design, verification, backend, validation, etc. Experience with yield analysis to drive yield and quality/DPPM (Defective Part Per Million) improvements Excellent teamwork, communication, mentoring, and interpersonal skills with both internal teams and external customers Preferred Skills Creating and supporting Process Design Kits (PDK) Expertise in areas of optimizing PPA (Performance, Power, Area) achieved pre-silicon and realized post-silicon, and improving execution schedules Significant knowledge of semiconductor hardware, test, and analytics business and operations Deep understanding of modern digital, analog, mixed signal IC design flows and commonly used IPs Proficiency with software development using Python/Perl/TCL/SKILL/Shell Knowledge of web technologies and big data At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. North America Solution Architect Position for Hybrid Emulation/Prototyping The applicant should have broad experience in hardware emulation, FPGA prototyping, virtual prototyping, and hybrid solutions. The applicant should understand the challenges of embedded software development and hardware-software validation, and how to leverage emulation, prototyping and hybrid solutions to address these challenges. The applicant should have a good understanding of the HPC, automotive and A&D markets including their unique embedded software bring up and hardware-software validation challenges. The applicant should be experienced in interacting with top technical leaders and management at strategic accounts in these verticals as well as with sales and management at Synopsys. The applicant will be a senior technical leader, guided by market/customer needs and BU goals and strategy. The applicant should be self-motivated and demonstrate high energy and ready to educate and inspire R&D and AE team members and will be able to guide senior management on product development roadmaps and customer engagements. The applicant will be recognized as a field expert internally and externally, will serves as a role model for the organization and will act as a mentor. The applicant will network with key decision makers and serve as external spokesperson for the organization. 20+ years of experience is expected for this position or 15+ years of experience with a post graduate degree. Business Area Description Our Silicon Design & Verification business is all about building high-performance silicon chips—faster. We’re the world’s leading provider of solutions for designing and verifying advanced silicon chips. And we design the next-generation processes and models needed to manufacture those chips. We enable our customers to optimize chips for power, cost, and performance—eliminating months off their project schedules. About Synopsys At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.
