Sr. Staff/Manager, Silicon Validation Our Silicon Lifecycle Management (SLM) business is all about building next-generation intelligent in-chip sensors, hardware/software capabilities and analytics to integrate into technology products to manage and improve each semiconductor lifecycle stage. We offer the world’s first full hardware IP, test, and end-to-end analytics to help customers integrate faster, optimize performance/power/area/schedule/yield, and enhance reliability. Meeting the unique challenges posed by various target applications, SLM enables differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. Job Descriptions & Requirements Part of the rapidly expanding Hardware-Analytics and Test (HAT) business unit, a Silicon Validation engineer works on developing and implementing electrical validation strategy for our state-of-the-art PVT-sensor and SLM-monitor IPs. We are seeking an experienced, highly motivated, and high-caliber individual to work on post-silicon and system level debug and characterization of various Sensor & Monitor IPs as part of HDG (Hardware Development Group) product portfolio. Additional responsibilities include: Development of electrical and functional validation strategy for on-die monitoring solutions Working with Hardware/IP teams to create test-plan and root cause Silicon issues Develop and document electrical validation requirements and tests for verification of sensor IPs Guiding junior engineers and tracking their work Job Requirements Using standard lab equipment for measurement and characterization BS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering with 10+ years of relevant industry experience Strong technical experience with Automatic Lab/Test equipment Understanding of digital & analog circuits for device validation and testing Excellent teamwork, communication, mentoring, and interpersonal skills with both internal teams and external teams Preferred Skills Good understanding of device test methods and process test quality methodology – Gage R&R, Cp, Cpk etc. A sound understanding of programming and operating of National Instruments LabVIEW software Experience of using LabVIEW with NI FPGA, SMU, DMM and cross-point switch modules and control of non-NI equipment Experience of using LabVIEW with SQL Experience of using SAS JMP software for data analysis An understanding of statistical data analysis and silicon test data PCB schematic capture using industry standard CAD tools, e.g., OrCad, Altium Designer or similar Programming and scripting skills in Python, TCL and/or bash Experience of using version controls systems, e.g., Git, Perforce for the control of data At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Join a growing global team at Synopsys focused on developing common platform for design execution. The team is working on innovative methodologies to implement designs that can deliver more performance with lesser power. The innovative techniques involve tapping into advance technologies and tool features to improve quality of results and make implementation process simpler and predictable. Expert physical designer with 10+ years of VLSI/EDA product development/deployment, full-flow benchmarking, design tape-out experience. Deeply trusted by customer as the on-site R&D that can be counted on to deliver quick solutions (usually TCL/Perl/Python solutions). This engineer has a good understanding of how the underlying algorithms within the tools work and is able to bridge the algorithms in the tool to the customer’s specific design style. By being able to work on both sides of the problem, this engineer is able to determine how to update/improve the algorithms to greatly improve power/performance/area/runtimes for the customer’s specific designs. The engineer is able to connect the dots between what the customer’s design needs are for rapid PPA closure and the underlying capabilities of the engines within the tool. The engineer is expected to be proactive, have a strategic mindset in addition to tactical problem solving. Requirements BSEE/MSEE or equivalent with 10+ years in developing and supporting advanced design implementation methodologies Requires the ability to understand and explain relevant technical issues, and thorough knowledge of RTL2GDS flows and methodologies Hands-on familiarity with Synopsys and /or 3rd party tools including RTL/Physical Synthesis, Place & Route and Signoff products Excellent customer interface, negotiation, planning and verbal and written presentation/communication skills required Customer sensitivity and the desire to help customers exploit new platforms and technologies are essential for success in the position Strong scripting skills Travel as needed Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Sr. Physical Design SOC Design Engineer - 39090BR
jobDescription: At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. We are powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our Systems Solutions Group (SSG) provides services including tool flow and methodologies, design creation and verification, and design implementation. Our customers range from start-ups to industry pioneers, developing products for consumer, wireless, aerospace and defense, automotive, artificial intelligence computing, and high-performance computing markets. Our services projects range from collaborating with customers to provide specific design skills and assistance for an SoC project all the way through end-to-end SoC turnkey design from specification to parts. We’re looking for an SoC Engineer, Staff – Physical Design. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will perform SoC Physical Design (RTL2GDSII) at block and chip levels as well as RTL2GDSII design flow methodology expertise. Key Qualifications BSEE/MSEE/PHD in Electrical and/or Computer Engineering. At least 8 years’ experience in delivering physical design on SoCs. Synthesis, place and route, clock implementation and physical verification. SoC power implementation, SoC timing analysis and closure. Low Power designs (multi-supply, shutdown, DVFS, etc). Developing low power UPF constraints and implementing UPF designs. jobDescription: The Product Solution Sales Manager manages the sales of the Synopsys Bluetooth/Wireless connectivity, Processors, and security IP products in assigned territory in North America. Develops product sales strategies for Bluetooth, ARC processor, ASIP and security IP, and helps account/IP sales teams implement them to grow Bluetooth/Processor/security IP business in assigned territory. Gathers and assesses customer and competitive input from the field and key accounts. Works with product development team and service delivery teams to ensure competitive product offerings are available. The qualified candidate must be able to provide product and sales leadership to account/IP sales teams and have proven experience calling “high” and helping to drive complex, solution-based sales campaign. Job Responsibilities And Activities This candidate will serve as the primary technical sales contact for Synopsys Bluetooth, Processor and security IP portfolio products, supporting the field team and driving strategic product initiatives Is responsible for developing pipeline Is responsible for developing and implementing a multi-year regional sales strategy and growth plan Is responsible for driving forecast, booking results and revenue results Works in a team environment with Account Managers and/or Executive Account management, IP product sales, Field Applications Engineers, Corporate Application Engineers, Contracts Administration, and Finance staff to meet and exceed established sales objectives The Qualified Candidate Possesses Job Requirements: >5 years related experience in technical selling, field applications engineering and /or sales management. A working understanding of Bluetooth or other wireless connectivity, Processor/Security IP market, including business models, customer challenges and decision-making criteria. Strong business development skills. Strong communication skills, with the ability to interact with customers’ engineering and business staff at all levels. The ability to grasp complex technical data and to communicate to a broad range of technical and non-technical people. Experience working at, or selling to, companies developing wireless communication, storage, automotive, AI, enterprise or IoT products – a plus. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. The Senior Revenue Accountant supports the revenue cycle and is responsible for reviewing and analyzing software contracts to ensure revenue is recorded in compliance with Synopsys’s revenue recognition policy and GAAP accounting standards. The ideal candidate has 5-7 years of experience in a high growth Software Company or public accountant firm with excellent attention-to-detail, high proficiency in Excel, communication skills and communication skills. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following Review and evaluate software contracts and document significant terms and accounting conclusions to ensure that revenue is recorded in compliance with Company’s revenue recognition policy and accounting literature in accordance with ASC 606 revenue recognition. Communicate with various internal groups to gather relevant information for decision making (Order Management, Sales, Legal, Credit & Collections and Professional Services) Ensure revenue transactions are reviewed and in compliance with the Company’s business practices (e.g. future pricing/material rights, milestone payments, cancellation clauses, and contracts with non-standard terms) Assist in preparation of revenue audit packages necessary for auditors to complete their quarterly and year-end audit selections Provide guidance and suggest improvements to the Company’s Order-to-Cash and revenue recognition process Support Sales during high volume of month-end and year-end opportunities Assess customer contracts to provide revenue recognition approval in SaleForce.com opportunities as appropriate Maintain files and documentation thoroughly and accurately, in accordance with company policy and accepted accounting practices Maintains a customer service approach interfacing with the functional departments in relation to all aspects of responsibilities Supports Revenue Accounting Manager with special projects and process improvements Requirements 5+ years’ experience in either a public accounting firm or a high growth software company Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or similar education ASC 606 Revenue Recognition knowledge Salesforce and SAP Excellent communications skills Excellent attention-to-detail, time-management, and customer service skills Proficient in the use of Excel functions including but not limited to VLOOKUP, SUMIF, Pivot tables and IF statements Exceptional work ethic Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. About The Role As a member of the Revenue Accounting team at Synopsys, you will be part of a dynamic, highly-collaborative and diverse team. You’ll perform order validations for new and revised contracts and work closely with our Order Management, Revenue Recognition teams and Collections team. You’ll assist with the preparation of revenue-related journal entries, assist with billings and prepare reports and reconciliations on an ongoing basis, which will allow for cross-functional collaboration and continuous learning opportunities. You will be working with SAP (SD and RAR) on a daily basis. The ideal candidate for this role has 3+ years of experience with operational revenue accounting, incl. the preparation and recording of journal entries and the preparation of reports and reconciliations working with a Company’s ERP system and/or Revenue Accounting module. The candidate must be familiar with Invoicing procedures and experienced with submitting Invoices to various customer portals. The candidate must be familiar with communicating with customer as an when required and can look up documents to address and respond to queries raised by customers with regards to Invoicing. Position reports to the Revenue Accounting Manager and collaborates with fellow on- and offshore Revenue Accountants. What You Will Do Perform order validations and reconcile data between system reports and underlying contract information to validate appropriate data entry and processing Run standard revenue reports from SAP (SD and RAR) and work with review revenue recognition schedules from SAP RAR to prepare reconciliations Assist with the preparation of revenue journal entries on an ongoing basis and at period end Perform month-end close activities and account reconciliations Assist with the billing process, incl. creation of billing documents in SAP and preparation of invoices Assist in timely responding to customer queries with regards to Invoices and coordinate information between Sales Operations, Sales tax and Collection teams. Assist in performing revenue-related internal controls and related documentation for revenue accounting processes Participate in cross-functional training and onboarding activities related to revenue accounting matters such as order validation, billing and revenue accounting close process Participate in initiatives to improve and standardize revenue accounting and billing processes What We Are Looking For Bachelors in Accounting Minimum 3+ years of Invoicing and revenue experience preferred Excellent teaming, interpersonal and strong written communication organizational skills and attention to detail. High motivation and hands-on mindset, willing to dive into the details Strong problem-solving attitude Experience working with ERP and/or Revenue Accounting module is required Advanced Excel skills (v-lookup, pivot tables, etc.) Knowledge of US GAAP and experience in applying ASC 606 revenue accounting guidance are a plus Software Industry experience is preferred Prior SAP and RAR experience is required Prior UiPath experience is preferred US Citizen is required for job performance Prior experience with customer Portal invoice submission specific to Government Contracts and resolving issues with the customer is required Prior experience in preparation of month end / Quarter end schedules for audit purpose is required Prior experience with Blackline is preferred Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. At Synopsys, we are at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we are powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation and SoC Design, we want to meet you. Our Systems Solutions Group (SSG) delivers tool, methodology, architecture, design creation, design verification and physical implementation expertise to enable leading edge customers to complete their most challenging SoC design projects. Our work spans from sub-blocks to full turnkey end-to-end SoCs. Our customers range from start-ups to industry leaders, commercial companies and government agencies. Our customers develop SOCs for high-performance computing, automotive, aerospace & defense, and more. We’re looking for an CAD Engineer to contribute to the physical design and implementation segment of our SSG CAD team and implement CAD solutions critical to our SoC Design projects. Our CAD Engineers provide technical PD and flow contributions for our SSG CAD Team to build/maintain an SSG “standard” implementation flow used for our RTL-to-GDSII services projects. The flow leverages our Synopsys EDA tool reference flows, flow automation, DSO.ai and Metrics/Analytics. Additionally, our CAD Engineers may be involved with and help enable broader end-to-end flow capabilities for solutions comprising Architecture, prototyping platforms, HW/SW co-verification, RTL development and design verification. Our CAD Engineers own and drive specific flow development tasks to plug-in and optimize the standard flow for design/foundry-specific requirements. They also own optimization of the SSG standard flow to meet Automotive implementation requirements for our Automotive projects. Additionally, they drive or assist with services coordination at key foundries and internal IT/compute enablement. Key Qualifications And Experiences Proven experience using Synopsys physical design and analysis tools and developing RTL-to-GDSII tool flows. Proven abilities to optimize flows for productivity and design optimization. Abilities to work across teams and with R&D to optimize leverage of reference flows and provide feedback on future tool improvements and needs. Passion to work closely with PD teams and builds and maintains flows. Experience working in a customer focused environment with great communication skills This position may include assignment to government contracts. Consequently, the ability to obtain government security clearances and/or other work clearances is preferred and will be required in the event of assignment to government contract work. Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering 8+ years of experience driving RTL-to-GDSII Synopsys tools. 5+ years of experience developing flows for Synopsys tools. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Our System Design Solutions (SDS) group provides design services related to tool, methodology, design creation, verification and implementation to enable leading edge customers to complete their most challenging IC design projects. Our customers range from industry pioneers to start-ups, developing products for applications such as telecommunications, wireless, broadband, medical, aerospace, automotive, AI, and high-performance computing. We work with customers needing as little as specific design assistance along a particular skillset to as much as full turnkey designs from specification to parts. We’re looking for a Sr Manager, SOC specializing in physical design to join our team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role you will be primarily responsible for managing an RTL2GDS team to deliver hardening services for blocks, IPs, Subsystems, Top-level implementation/closure as well as flow/methodology development. Our engineers typically own end-end implementation which would require good understanding of Synthesis, Formal/Timing/EMIR closure, Floor planning, PG Grid while having deep technical understanding of PnR concepts, tools, and methodologies. As their Technical manager, you will be responsible for the tapeout/deliverable, technical decision making, people management, interfacing with the customers for status updates, periodic project reviews, conflict and risk management, etc. Additional responsibilities will include participating in or driving pre-sales engagements to scope projects, do effort/cost estimations, pitch services and business proposals to the customers. You will be driving large, cross-geographical RTL2GDS projects which requires good communication and problem solving and program management skills. Key Qualifications Must excel in Physical implementation, teamwork, customer focus, and communication Will have demonstrated experience as a senior technical contributor, planning and leading Physical Design teams Recent experience in advanced technology nodes (TSMC N7/5/3, Samsung 7/5/4/3, etc) SOC experience in high performance designs (Power, Performance) Experience working with multiple domain teams to ensure handoffs, deliverables, specs are met Led several successful taepouts in lower technology nodes across multiple foundries Experience with project scoping, customer interface is a plus Requirements: BS with 10-12 years relevant experience. MS with 8+ years relevant experience Desired Qualifications Experience in at least one or more of the areas such as HPC, AI/ML, Automotive, Aerospace and Defense is highly preferred Hands-on experience in leading design implementation teams (physically aware synthesis, PG planning, Floor planning, MSCTS, Place and Route) Good understanding of clock specifications, power intent/UPF, DFT requirements, constraints, and formal verification Deep understanding of Physical verification and EMIR issues and fixes Experience directing technical teams to execute RTL2GDS Experience creating work-around scripts and/or exposure to flow development Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

We are committed to delivering top-quality production software exceeding customer expectations. Experience: EDA software development, design of algorithms with efficient data structures. MS/PhD in EE, CS, CE or related experience, ideal. Attentive to stringent performance and quality requirements. Developing and maintaining complex C++/C applications in a Unix/Linux environment. Experience in EDA design tool implementation and signoff flows is plus. Good communication skills, verbal and written. In the Advanced Platform Solutions group, we are shaping EDA to support of dependable systems, such as safety, security and reliability. jobTitle: Sr Staff Applications Engineer - Physical Design - 41141BR
jobDescription: At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We’re looking for Physical Design Specialist (PDS) to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In This Role You Would Be The primary focus of the Physical Design Specialist (PDS) is to support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products to help customers achieve tangible and lasting performance improvements in the cost, quality, and development time for projects. PDS are expected to possess Place & Route (physical) , Synthesis (logical and physical), STA experience and knowledge. PDS AEs are expected to be knowledgeable in multiple domains of design implementation and understand codependency of flow and methodology such as Macro & Standard Cell Placement, Clock Tree Synthesis, Routing, Advanced Timing Optimization techniques. Additional knowledge of RTL Coding, Synthesis, Equivalency check, Constraints (timing & Power) is preferable. In addition, PDS AEs will articulate design methodologies involving Synopsys tools at a very advanced Node (Sub 5nm) using Synopsys Full RTL-to-GDSII solution (Fusion Compiler). Development time will be spent gaining expertise in additional, or specialization tools, broadening focus from product emphasis to methodology, sharpening Account Management skills, and learning to leverage success. PDS AEs are expected to manage multiple customer activities concurrently, and work with Account Managers and AC management to set their priorities. Sales support roles include product demonstrations, evaluations, and competitive benchmarking. Customer support roles include training, problem resolution, and technical account management. PDS AEs must be able to interact effectively with end-users at customer sites, as well as first level managers. PDS AEs also participate in account planning, where they work as part of the account team to develop the Synopsys solution to customer problems by bringing their understanding of customers' needs and issues. Key Qualifications Design experience should include ASIC design using industry-standard tools (Placement, Optimization, Routing) RTL to GDSII full flow experience or knowledge is preferable Strong interest and understanding of Advanced Node & Design methodologies are required. Deep Synopsys Back end tool (Logical and Physical Synthesis, Macro Placement, Routing at advanced Node , Static Timing Analysis, including noise analysis) experience and knowledge are required. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Customer sensitivity, the ability to multiplex many issues & set priorities, and the desire to help customers exploit new technologies are essential for success in the position. Preferred Experience: BSEE or equivalent, required with 5+ years of experience, or MSEE, or equivalent with 3+ years of experience. Tool knowledge expected: Back end P&R tools (Fusion Compiler, ICC2, Innovus) Tool knowledge : front end Synthesis tools (Fusion Compiler, Design Compiler, Genus), Tool knowledge (preferred): STA (Primetime, Tempus), Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Sr. Staff Applications Engineer - Physical Implementation - 37312BR
jobDescription: Synopsys Applications Engineer At Synopsys, we are enthusiastic learners and seasoned inventors. We are makers and visionaries who make technology safer. We are innovators who develop the software and hardware that drive the world’s high-performing chips for amazing things like autonomous vehicles, smart homes, and machines that learn. We are looking for a dynamic ASIC Verification Engineer to work as part of the DesignWare Verification team at Synopsys. You will be expected to use SoC ASIC or Custom IC design to specify, design and implement state-of-the-art verification environments for the DesignWare USB family of synthesizable cores. You will work with RTL designers and be part of a team of Verification Engineers. Key responsibilities: Your role includes definition of verification specifications, test bench infrastructure design and implementation test cases creation, checkers, assertions and coverage implementation based on test plan behavioral modeling, bus functional modeling and verification coverage metrics definition Performing simulation, random and focused stimulus generation and coverage review Contributes to technical reviews Generates documentation for test plans and verification environments. Key Qualifications: BS in EE/CS with 7+ years of related experiences, or MS with 5+ years of experience in developing and debugging complex SoC testbench environments Verification experience and debug skills of IP cores and/or SOC RTL designs Experience in developing System Verilog, UVM, VMM or similar HDL based test environments Experience in developing and implementing test plans, extracting verification metrics, developing BFMs and similar verification components Understanding of USB3.0, USB3.1, USB3.2, USB4 and AMBA protocol Technical experience with assertion-based verification, coverage driven methodology and formal verification Familiarity with C/C++, and a sound background in data structures and algorithms is preferable Impressive communication skills, able to demonstrate research and problem solving skills Perform in a technical leadership role Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Sr. Staff Optical Imaging Design Engineer - 40709BR
jobDescription: Synopsys’ Optical Solutions Group has an opening in the Imaging Engineering Group for a Sr. Staff Imaging Design Optical Engineer. The Imaging Engineering Group provides optical design services on a consulting basis to a wide variety of external customers in a wide range of applications that include space, medical, defense, and consumer markets. This is an opportunity to join the leading provider of lens design and optimization software that has been delivering cutting edge optical and illumination designs to its customers for over 50 years. The successful candidate will interact with some of the most talented engineers, marketers, and software developers in the field of optical design both inside the company and in our expansive customer community. This is an individual contributor role as a member of the imaging optical design and engineering team within the Optical Solutions Group at Synopsys. The successful candidate will be experienced in the design of imaging systems, a proficient user of CODE V, and have an M.S. or Ph.D. degree in Optical Sciences or related technical field. U.S. Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status is required, to enable the candidate access to ITAR-controlled projects. Industrial creativity, demonstrated skill in highly inter-disciplinary problem solving, ability to work unaided as a self-starter, and excellent engineering judgement and process understanding are required. Experience in imaging optical design is required with substantial experience in the areas of material selection, fabrication methods, tolerance allocation, with a working understanding of optical fabrication and testing methods, are also desired. Experience in the development of MacroPlus sequences to extend the capability of CODE V, both in the short term to satisfy the needs of specific customers, as well as long term, for the extension of the capabilities of CODEV, are also being sought. Equally important, a successful candidate will also be able to represent the skills and capabilities of the Imaging Engineering Group to potential customers and emerging markets. Exceptional customer interaction skills are being sought. The successful candidate will have demonstrated sound design skills in highly multidimensional problem-solving environments. Experience in designing zoom lenses, heads up displays (HUDs), head mounted displays (HMDs), mobile phone camera lenses, athermal optical systems, endoscopes, microscope objective, eyepieces, and augmented and virtual reality (AR and VR) optical systems is desired. Experience in working with mechanical CAD software will also be advantageous. The ability to interact with potential customers and form a set of firm specifications from customer’s desires and then design to those specifications is important. Equally important is the desire and ability to learn the above skills. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Join a growing core infrastructure service team at Synopsys with challenging projects and responsibilities. Looking for a senior systems engineer who can design, deploy, improve and support global IT infrastructure and application solutions in both on-prem data centers and cloud to meet the requirements from internal customers, and collaborate with IT partner teams to deliver cutting edge infrastructure services helping to boost engineering and business productivities. Responsibilities Manage identity and directory services including AD, LDAP and etc. Manage global Email services including Office365, SMTP relays and etc. Manage network core services such as DNS, DHCP, and etc. Manage both on-prem & cloud hypervisor/ hyperconverged platforms to support IT infrastructure services. Take active part in the production problem root cause investigation, identification, and resolution. Works on team-driven or task-oriented IT infrastructure projects from start to completion. Provides exceptional customer service with excellent troubleshooting and problem resolution skills. Use DevOps tools for process automation. Requirements Typically requires a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, software engineering or a related field, with at least 8 years of related experience. Proficient with both Linux and Windows system deployment, configuration management, system administration and security. Ability to use DevOps tools like Ansible for configuration and deployment automation. Proficient with network and infrastructure services like LDAP, Active Directory, DNS, SMTP and etc. Experience with cloud environment such as AWS, GCP or Azure. Hands on knowledge with virtualization and container technology and orchestration tools, such as VMware, docker and etc. Ability to use at least one scripting/programming language for process automation, such as Bash, PowerShell or Python. Familiar with web technology stack including web server, database, REST API and etc. Knowledge of IT Security including encryption, certificates, key management, patch management, security hardening and auditing. Demonstrates exceptional technical leadership to steer and drive projects and initiatives. Ability explore and evaluate new solutions. Good documentation and analytical skills is required. Experience with technical specification writing and familiarity with project planning and flowchart tools. Good verbal and written communication skills are required. Demonstrates aptitude for providing exceptional customer service. Excellent troubleshooting and problem resolution skills are required. Able to work well under aggressive deadlines. Works well as a member of a team as well as autonomously. Fluent in English both spoken and written.

Experience with technical specification writing and familiarity with project planning and flowchart tools. Good verbal and written communication skills are required. Demonstrates aptitude for providing exceptional customer service. Excellent troubleshooting and problem resolution skills are required. Able to work well under aggressive deadlines. Works well as a member of a team as well as autonomously. Fluent in English both spoken and written.

Join a growing core infrastructure service team at Synopsys with challenging projects and responsibilities. Looking for a senior systems engineer who can design, deploy, improve and support global IT infrastructure and application solutions in both on-prem data centers and cloud to meet the requirements from internal customers, and collaborate with IT partner teams to deliver cutting edge infrastructure services helping to boost engineering and business productivities. Responsibilities Manage identity and directory services including AD, LDAP and etc. Manage global Email services including Office365, SMTP relays and etc. Manage network core services such as DNS, DHCP, and etc. Manage both on-prem & cloud hypervisor/ hyperconverged platforms to support IT infrastructure services. Take active part in the production problem root cause investigation, identification, and resolution. Works on team-driven or task-oriented IT infrastructure projects from start to completion. Provides exceptional customer service with excellent troubleshooting and problem resolution skills. Use DevOps tools for process automation. Requirements Typically requires a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, software engineering or a related field, with at least 8 years of related experience. Proficient with both Linux and Windows system deployment, configuration management, system administration and security. Ability to use DevOps tools like Ansible for configuration and deployment automation. Proficient with network and infrastructure services like LDAP, Active Directory, DNS, SMTP and etc. Experience with cloud environment such as AWS, GCP or Azure. Hands on knowledge with virtualization and container technology and orchestration tools, such as VMware, docker and etc. Ability to use at least one scripting/programming language for process automation, such as Bash, PowerShell or Python. Familiar with web technology stack including web server, database, REST API and etc. Knowledge of IT Security including encryption, certificates, key management, patch management, security hardening and auditing. Demonstrates exceptional technical leadership to steer and drive projects and initiatives. Ability explore and evaluate new solutions. Good documentation and analytical skills is required. Experience with technical specification writing and familiarity with project planning and flowchart tools. Good verbal and written communication skills are required. Demonstrates aptitude for providing exceptional customer service. Excellent troubleshooting and problem resolution skills are required. Able to work well under aggressive deadlines. Works well as a member of a team as well as autonomously. Fluent in English both spoken and written.

A successful candidate will join Embedded memory team and be responsible for embedded SRAM design and will also work with the team to verify the designs for robustness. The candidate should have extensive experience in overall memory designs and methodologies covering both front-end and back-end implementation . We believe the growth and success of our group is directly linked to the growth and satisfaction of our employees. That is why EM team is committed to a work environment that is flexible and collaborative, and allows our employees to reach their full potential. Key Qualifications And Responsibility Key Qualification BS / MS in Electrical or Computer Engineering or equivalent experience 5-7 Years of relevant experience Prove experience on developing caches/SRAM design for low voltage and low power operation Good understanding of high-performance and low power circuit designs with FinFet technologies Hands-on experience running SPICE simulation, and capability to adapt to new simulation tools Exposure to complete design cycle of SRAM memory and compiler development Proficiency in scripting language, such as, Perl, Tcl is a plus Great team-work, communication and analytical skills Willingness to collaborate closely with cross functional teams across the globe Responsibility : High-performance low power embedded SRAM design with advanced technologies Memory compiler development, characterization and verification Collaborate and support the team at remote site on various design activities Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

Job Description & Responsibilities Synopsys technology is at the heart of innovations that are changing the way we live and work. The Internet of Things. Autonomous cars. Wearables. Smart medical devices. Secure financial services. Machine learning and computer vision. These breakthroughs are ushering in the era of Smart, Secure Everything―where devices are getting smarter, everything’s connected, and everything must be secure. Powering this new era of technology are advanced silicon chips, which are made even smarter by the remarkable software that drives them. Synopsys is at the forefront of Smart, Secure Everything with the world’s most advanced tools for silicon chip design, verification, IP integration, and application security testing. Our technology helps customers innovate from Silicon to Software, so they can deliver Smart, Secure Everything. The broad DesignWare IP portfolio includes logic libraries, embedded memories, embedded test, analog IP, interface IP, security IP, embedded processors, and subsystems. To accelerate prototyping, software development and integration of IP into SoCs, Synopsys' IP Accelerated initiative offers IP Prototyping Kits and IP subsystems. Our extensive investment in IP quality, comprehensive technical support and robust IP development methodology enables designers to reduce integration risk and accelerate time-to-market. At Synopsys, you will have the opportunity to find the perfect blend of our strong EDA presence and our broad IP portfolio. Our Solution IP group in Boxborough, Massachusetts is looking for an enthusiastic individual to join our team. You will be working with a cross functional team of analog and mixed signal circuit designers from a wide variety of backgrounds on design and methodology. This position requires hands on experience with transistor level simulations, reliability analysis, static timing analysis (STA) tools, a vast knowledge of mixed signal circuit design principles, a deep understanding of silicon IP release requirements, strong scripting skills to automate flows and the ability to lead and train junior engineers to become experts with new methodologies. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or similar technical field BSEE degree and 12-15 years of experience in IC design, or MSEE (or PhD) with 8-12 years of experience. Extensive programming skills in languages such as Python, Perl, TCL and C/C++ Ability to provide automation for rapid and dynamic design needs is highly sought-after Extensive knowledge of Analog & Mixed-Signal circuit design Design experience in high speed PHY such as DDR, HBM or SERDES Proficiency with spice simulators including HSPICE, Finesim and XA Deep knowledge on DC/AC/Transient, Cross corners PVT, Static & Dynamic CCK, Equivalency checks, Aging, EMIR/SHE Reliability analysis, MonteCarlo simulations Experience with STA and cell characterization such as Nanotime, Primetime, SiliconSmart Understanding of behavioral Verilog models & experience in SystemVerilog for AMS circuits Knowledge in Perforce and/or regressions is a plus Exposure and working knowledge preferably with Synopsys tools like DC, PT, PT-SI and ICC2 Prior working knowledge in the DDR/SERDES PHY level timing closure, implementation would be an added advantage Candidate with Machine Learning paradigms/techniques understandings with knowledge of applying it in modeling, circuit design flow & simulations is desirable Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability

Synopsys Applications Engineer At Synopsys, we are enthusiastic learners and seasoned inventors. We are makers and visionaries who make technology safer. We are innovators who develop the software and hardware that drive the world’s high-performing chips for amazing things like autonomous vehicles, smart homes, and machines that learn. We embrace diversity as a company, so we can create solutions that serve not just technology but the humans behind it. Our Customer Success Group is all about delivering high-value solutions to our customers while driving growth. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of the applications engineering team that supports the industry-leading solutions for Verification, Implementation, and Signoff. The primary focus of the Application Engineer (AE) is to drive increased usage of the product by collaborating with R&D and the Sales team in a dynamic, innovative environment. Some of the tasks include conducting competitive benchmarks and evaluations where they articulate the superiority of our customer’s design team and management. In addition, AE’s deliver customer training, tape-out support, and collaborate on initiatives for product enhancements. The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. We’re looking for a Application Engineer to join a world-class AE team responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading Parasitics Extraction solution for digital and custom designs. In this role, you will be an Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our Customer Success Organization enabling the success of our customers in designing advanced chips on leading-edge process technologies. Does this sound like a good role for you? Main Responsibilities Job function involves leading in all aspects of field applications engineering that includes Pre-sales activity : Driving technical benchmarks, methodology presentations and demos to articulate the superiority of Synopsys solutions. Post-sales support : Managing customer relationships from a technical perspective. This involves issue resolution tracking, managing customer escalations and driving customer forums like Technical Review Meetings and Management Review Meetings. AE is also expected to work closely with Marketing, sales and R&D to define account strategy and drive success at the customer. The job will facilitate skillset development in Physical verification, static timing analysis for digital designs, timing and reliability analysis for custom designs, customer relationship management, and provides business exposure. Key Qualifications BSEE or equivalent, required with 10+ years of experience, or MSEE or equivalent with 8+ years of experience Minimum 2+ years of directly working on Interconnect Parasitics Extraction tools such as StarRC, Quickcap etc on advanced FinFET nodes is required. Strong understanding of digital/custom design flows and process technology is required. Experience with one or more scripting languages such as TCL, Perl is required. Experience with commercial STA tools such as PrimeTime and simulation tools such as Hspice, Finesim is a strong plus. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for world-class customer service. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. We’re looking for an RTL2GDS Full flow Engineer who could lead Benchmark, evaluations to join the team. Does this sound like a good role for you? In this role, you will support the sale and adoption of Synopsys products. Provides technical leadership and engineering insight and direction to support and improve usability, applicability, and adoption of products, platforms, and solutions to meet customer business needs. Diagnoses, troubleshoots, and resolves complex technical issues on customer installations; deploy and trains customers on new implementations and capabilities. Reviews and understands feedback on product and solutions performance from customers and other application partners; works directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement the technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partners with customer technical managers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications RTL to GDSII full flow experience or knowledge is preferable. Strong interest and understanding of Advanced Node & Design methodologies. Must possess collaborative teamwork experience and the aptitude and motivation to work with other internal and customer groups. Excellent verbal and written presentation/communication skills are mandatory. Hands-on experience in all aspects of synthesis, physical design static timing analysis, equivalence checking, parasitic extraction, DRC/LVS and power analysis. Knowledge of ASIC implementation domains outside of RTL2GDS including RTL coding, Verification, formal checking is a plus. Good scripting skills (Perl, Tcl, Python); knowledge of CAD automation methods. Preferred Experience BSEE or equivalent, required with 15+ years of experience, or MSEE, or equivalent with +13 years of experience. Tool knowledge expected: Front end Synthesis tools & Back-end P&R tools (Design Compiler, ICC2, Fusion Compiler, Genus, Innovus) Tool knowledge (preferred): STA (Primetime, Tempus), IR drop analysis (Redhawk, Voltus), Extraction (Star-RCXT, Quantus), Formal verification (Formality, Conformal) Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you! The ECO Field team at Synopsys is looking for an individual with experience in timing signoff and design closure work on the latest technology nodes to join our expanding team. At Synopsys, you will be part of new product introductions from early release to adoption. You will oversee technical and engineering insight and deliver support that improves usability, and speeds adoption of our products, platforms, and solutions. Responsibilities Review and examine feedback on product and solution performance from customers and other application partners; Work directly with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement technical roadmap, specifications and validation for improvements and enhancements. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer installations or at the factory Deploy product best practices and train internal and external customers on new technologies Partner with customer technical managers and Sales to identify business challenges, develop effective technical solutions for new accounts and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts Understand and communicate product messages at engineering and management levels; deliver engaging product demos. Key Qualifications BS or MS in Electrical/Computer Engineering Typically requires minimum of 8-10 years of experience Experience with P&R, extraction, STA and ECO tools Experience with timing and physical constraint methodologies, parasitic annotation, timing analysis of IC designs Experience with silicon chip project execution, physical design, timing closure and optimizing PPA targets preferred Experience with advanced technology nodes preferred Good understanding of TCL, Perl and other scripting languages Excellent understanding of ASIC design flow, VLSI and/or CAD engineering

We’re looking for an Applications Engineer to join our team, responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading chip verification products and solutions. The primary focus of the Applications Engineer (AE) is to drive increased usage of our products by collaborating with R&D and the Sales team in a dynamic, innovative environment. Some of the tasks include conducting competitive benchmarks and evaluations where you articulate the superiority of our products and solutions. In addition, AE’s deliver customer training, verification support, and collaborate on initiatives for product enhancements and new features. The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. In this role, you will be an Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our organization, enabling the success of our customers in verifying complex IP and SoC. You will provide technical and engineering insight and direction to improving usability, applicability, and adoption of verification products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you? Main Responsibilities Use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise and support for our top customers. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer designs. Work with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement our technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partner with customers and Sales to identify business opportunities, develop effective technical solutions, and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications BS/MS EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 8+ years of experience. In-depth knowledge of RTL simulation and System Verilog/UVM testbench development; C-based testbench knowledge is preferred. Hands-on experience with UVM, Assertion and Randomized Constraints based verification methodologies. Expertise with Verilog, SystemVerilog RTL. Experience with VHDL is a plus. Strong debugging skills Experience with Formal verification techniques preferred Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for world-class customer service

We’re looking for an Applications Engineer to join our team, responsible for driving adoption of our industry-leading chip verification products and solutions. The primary focus of the Applications Engineer (AE) is to drive increased usage of our products by collaborating with R&D and the Sales team in a dynamic, innovative environment. Some of the tasks include conducting competitive benchmarks and evaluations where you articulate the superiority of our products and solutions. In addition, AE’s deliver customer training, verification support, and collaborate on initiatives for product enhancements and new features. The job involves working closely with users/customers and multiple organizations like R&D, marketing, and sales among others. In this role, you will be an Applications Engineer who will play a critical role in our organization, enabling the success of our customers in verifying complex IP and SoC. You will provide technical and engineering insight and direction to improving usability, applicability, and adoption of verification products, platforms, and solutions to meet the customer business needs. Does this sound like a good role for you? Main Responsibilities Use in-depth product knowledge to provide technical expertise and support for our top customers. Diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve complex technical issues on customer designs. Work with Research and Development (R&D) to develop and implement our technical roadmap, specifications, and validation for improvements and enhancements. Partner with customers and Sales to identify business opportunities, develop effective technical solutions, and increase utilization and retention of products on current accounts. Key Qualifications BS/MS EE, CS, CE or related discipline and 8+ years of experience. In-depth knowledge of RTL simulation and System Verilog/UVM testbench development; C-based testbench knowledge is preferred. Hands-on experience with UVM, Assertion and Randomized Constraints based verification methodologies. Expertise with Verilog, SystemVerilog RTL. Experience with VHDL is a plus. Strong debugging skills Experience with Formal verification techniques preferred Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for world-class customer service

Our infrastructure team is responsible for deploying and managing infrastructure for a large-scale enterprise that includes network, storage, compute, data center, authentication services, and application platforms for consumption through on-prem and public cloud. The current size of the infrastructure is over half a million compute cores and 30 petabytes of storage. We are looking for a Staff IT Infrastructure Engineer to work in a fast-paced environment on critical IT projects and evaluate new technologies. This position requires a very wide skillset with previous experience in multiple environments. Responsibilities Work in a small team to quickly complete critical IT projects Work with a wide range of technologies across the entire tech stack Collaborate with business units and IT teams within the company to identify needs, increase productivity, and secure data Improve, automate, and document IT processes Evaluate new technologies and solutions Promote a culture of innovation across the entire IT department Requirements You will have 10+ years experience deploying and managing the entire tech stack of an environment. Previous roles would include Site Reliability Engineer, IT Systems Engineer, Operations Engineer, DevOps Engineer, Software Infrastructure Engineer, or equivalent Experience in working with infrastructure as code including programming, orchestration and configuration management, and an automation mindset. Software engineering background preferred Experience working in start-ups to get projects and infrastructure deployed efficiently Experience working in large scale environments A wide understanding of infrastructure technologies including networking, storage, compute, applications, Linux, Windows, monitoring, security, public clouds, and software engineering Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Previous role as a lead for a small team A team player with a focuses on company and team success

Our Silicon IP business is all about integrating more capabilities into an SoC—faster. We offer the world’s broadest portfolio of silicon IP—predesigned blocks of logic, memory, interfaces, analog, security, and embedded processors. All to help customers integrate more capabilities. Meet unique performance, power, and size requirements of their target applications. And get differentiated products to market quickly with reduced risk. At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. The Synopsys Non-Volatile-Memory team is looking for an experienced designer ready to head the development of our next generation NVM IP. In this role, the candidate will have the opportunity to work on an extremely wide range of process technologies, ranging from complex BCD process nodes to 3nm and beyond. The ideal candidate must be a team player with good written and verbal communication skills, self-directed and self-motivated, detail oriented, and able to work with a multi-national cross-functional teams. Responsibilities Follow good practices with TestChip and IP design flow in multiple technologies and foundries Architect/Design/Verify CMOS-based non-volatile memory IP modules Contribute to design/verification/margining methodologies within the R&D Team Support Product Engineer to perform silicon verification, test and debug to analyze the IP on silicon Post layout extraction & simulation, testing in conjunction with silicon validation Work closely with on/off-site design, layout and CAD teams Work with layout designers with floor planning of memory array and analog block Skills and Experience Required: 12+ years of industry experience as a memory or non-volatile memory circuit designer Familiar with TestChip tapeout flow Proven transistor level analog design and examination with sense-amplifier, charge pump, high voltage regulator, and bandgap reference circuit design Good understanding of Non-Volatile Memory design, Memory architecture and device physics Experience circuit debugging capability with analog circuits and various memory block Familiar with circuit simulation tools (HSIM, HSPICE, etc.) is required Must have prior experience with Custom Complier or equivalent tools (Schematic, and Layout edit) Experience with statistical design methodology (generating and examining Monte-Carlo results) Hands-on experience of Si debugging (FIB, micro-probing, post layout RC extraction, etc.) Experience with Low power design and power management circuitry Experience with FinFET design is a plus Knowledge of ISO26262 Design Flow and FuSa a plus Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community Synopsys Canada ULC values the diversity of our workforce. We are committed to provide access & opportunity to individuals with disabilities and will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals throughout the recruitment and employment process. Should you require an accommodation, please contact hr-help-canada@synopsys.com.

Synopsys, Software Integrity Group, is named a leader for 2021 in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for Application Security Testing (AST), in recognition of our vision and ability to execute. Security and risk management leaders will need to meet tighter deadlines and test more-complex applications by integrating and automating AST in the software life cycle eliminating risk before it puts them at risk. Every business runs on software, and defects in software create risk. We’ve curated the most powerful products and services to create one comprehensive platform that enables our customers to detect and remediate defects across their entire SDLC. To find out more about Synopsys SIG, check out https://www.synopsys.com/software-integrity.html . What We’re Looking For The Static Analysis Vulnerability Specialist will join the Static Analysis Security Testing (SAST) team to review source code from hundreds of applications, in a variety of languages, and validate common web/mobile application vulnerabilities reported by the WhiteHat Static Code Analysis Engine. The Static Analysis Vulnerability Specialist will report directly to the Static Analysis Supervisor. Responsibilities Review source code of JavaScript, Java, .NET (C#), and PHP web/mobile applications for common security flaws Communicate the impact and likelihood of validated vulnerabilities and suggested remediation strategies Configure WhiteHat Static Code Analysis Engine to checkout and scan customer code thoroughly and efficiently Evaluate the accuracy of the WhiteHat Sentinel Static Analysis Scanner and provide feedback for possible improvements Required Qualifications Quickly learn new languages, frameworks, and security controls through self-study Effective communication with team members and customers Detail oriented problem solving Intermediate to skilled knowledge of one or more of the following languages: JavaScript, Java, .NET (C#), PHP. Knowledge in multiple languages is valued. Intermediate knowledge of HTML Understanding of SAST concepts Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related discipline, or equivalent experience Understanding of the basic concepts of programming (object-oriented, functional patterns, etc) Passion for the advancement of web security Familiarity with the OWASP Top 10 Synopsys has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law. Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

jobTitle: Strategic Marketing Manager - Data Center / Cloud - 38615BR
jobDescription: The IP Segment Marketing Manager will work closely with top people across Synopsys to drive our global market strategies, marketing campaigns, and business development activities for the Data Center segment including Servers, Storage, Networking, AI and Multi-die technologies for Synopsys’ DesignWare IP portfolio. Responsibilities Implement and evolve a Synopsys IP marketing strategy and business plan for the segment and application areas supported Overall Data Center segments mission, priorities and technology roadmap. Key target customers & partners across the entire cloud application segments Key customer needs Industry landscape and Synopsys differentiation Create & orchestrate outbound marketing campaign(s) Business growth targets Work closely with sales management and Synopsys Business Unit managers to drive, orchestrate and track/report key customer engagements Run an existing cross-functional Data Center segment team Be a key spokesperson for Synopsys on Data Center segments and applications, presenting to customers and at industry conferences Develop and nurture executive relationships with key customers & partners Develop and maintain metrics based on data for your segment and application areas Qualifications At least eight years segment marketing experience in a technical domain with established working relationships with semiconductor companies Experience in the semiconductor industry and EDA/IP Familiarity with make vs buy analysis and tradeoffs during IP selection Sufficient technical background to be able to understand communication, Server, Storage, Acceleration Cards and Security solutions customer needs At least five years of cross functional management experience Exceptional business acumen and sufficient understanding of the market segment, applications and technology to be able to drive strategies and develop key messaging Strategic thinker, and able to simultaneously contribute to strategy development, guide teams, and achieve excellent execution Possesses excellent command and communication skills, excellent presentations and content development skills Organizationally savvy and collaborative; comfortable in a matrixed, team orientated environment with multiple stakeholders Must be able to define and manage a successful marketing program ‘by influence’ to drive customer & product requirements collaboratively with the business units Bachelor’s degree in Engineering is required, a graduate degree in engineering or business is desired Must be able to use Microsoft Excel, Pivot tables and relational database knowledge a plus Fluency in other languages like Mandarin is a plus At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Amazing things are happening at Synopsys and we are energized for the Future! Sharing this passion with our current and future talent communities is a top priority. As the Talent Brand and Experience Manager you will be responsible for developing and executing programs and strategies that position Synopsys as an employer of choice. You will oversee delivering a personalized top-notch experience for our candidates to help them see that Synopsys is the place for them! You will manage a team that is focused on bringing the Synopsys talent brand to life, executing recruitment marketing campaigns and scaling our candidate experience to the next level. You will oversee the development and implementation of a recruitment support team, focused on delivering a signature recruitment experience and drive and scale talent brand engagement, awareness and recognition. Your Role And Responsibilities Combine inbound and outbound talent marketing strategies that are customized for local audiences and key talent communities around the globe. Collaborate with local teams to deliver strategies through both enterprise and local relationships with key branding and attraction partners. Create compelling content and story-telling that showcase Synopsys culture, opportunities and innovative technology Establish a data insights strategy by defining clear campaign metrics, track results and share ROI with key stakeholders Ensure brand consistency across channels and candidate touchpoints globally Work closely with the corporate enterprise team responsible for our overarching Employer Brand and Social Media strategy to ensure alignment and messaging Serve as the subject matter expert for our social channels and facilitate frequent benchmarking to stay apprised on the latest trends and advancements within talent marketing Develop and implement new programs and initiatives to support the attraction and engagement of both internal and external talent Partner with cross-functional teams like L&D and HRIS to implement solutions within our systems and processes to enhance the candidate experience – from top to bottom funnel Lead the global effort to manage and optimize talent attraction programs such as our global employee referral program and RIYA (Returnship) Help define and implement a shared services recruitment support team that will be focused on bottom funnel execution Skills and background you bring to the team: A successful leader on our team will be an outstanding manager, partner and collaborator Proven track record for developing creative talent marketing strategies A great vision for a compelling, consistent and memorable candidate and hiring manager experience Excellent program and project management capabilities, the ability to take an idea and bring it to realization A strong curiosity to create compelling content to help us attract and build a diverse talent pipeline A passion for analytics and an insight-driven mindset A global mindset and ability to operate across disciplines, cultures and scenarios, and to influence at multiple levels of an organization. Experience with social media platforms, solutions and functionality Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment Strong leadership skills: customer-driven, solution-oriented, drives through ambiguity, facilitates change management 8+ years working in a high-tech Talent Acquisition environment Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience Experience in recruitment marketing, employer brand or a related field Experience in project or program management; working cross-functionally across a globally distributed organization. Experience in brand marketing, with an understanding of insight development, evaluation and expertise in crafting strategy, narratives, storytelling frameworks, and internal user campaigns At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you. Responsibilities Include Translate customer requirements into marketing requirements documents (MRD) and Product Review Documents (PRD) Definition of new products that will result in sustainable growth within the product line Comparative study of product line with respect to competition and customer requirements FAE communication and training Communicating technical benefits of product line to customers and understanding customer needs Promotion of product lines through articles, white papers, application notes and seminars Qualifications Energetic, results-based individual Deep understanding of all phases of logic library product lifecycle - specification, development, validation, and use in SoC design flows Strong knowledge of the interplay between logic libraries and the Synopsys design flow as applicable to hardening CPUs, GPUs, DSPs, and SoCs FAE or SoC design experience Proven ability to develop and manage technical relationships with architects and design engineers at key customers and strategic partners Exceptional organizational and program management skills Demonstrated ability to work in a matrix environment Excellent oral and written communication skills in English Education and Experience: BS EE with 5+ years relevant experience, or MS EE (preferred) with 3+ years relevant experience At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. At Synopsys, we are enthusiastic learners and seasoned inventors. We are makers and visionaries who make technology safer. We are innovators who develop the software and hardware that drive the world’s high-performing chips for amazing things like autonomous vehicles, smart homes, and machines that learn. We embrace diversity as a company, so we can create solutions that serve not just technology but the humans behind it. The candidate will be a member of the Customer Success Group which offers the industry leading RTL verification platform consisting of multiple technologies. RTL Simulation provides advanced, built-in technologies, including full-featured testbench, complete assertion support, a library of assertion checkers. Also including a comprehensive coverage and analysis, to enable smart verification of complex system-on-chip designs. The Verification IP (VIP) portfolio has complete line of behavioral models, checkers and suite of compliance tests for advanced on-chip protocols. The Formal Verification platform offers static and formal methods that are the best in class. These combined with Hardware Assisted Verification and Emulation Systems create the Synopsys' Verification Platform. Application Engineer (AE) position gives you the opportunity to be part of a fantastic team working on Synopsys Verification Platform, primarily on the simulator, VCS. The responsibilities involve providing pre/post-sales technical support, including analysis of customers' current verification methodologies, presentations and deployment of the next gen ML techniques to accelerate chip development. Desired Skills And Experience BS in CS/EE with 7+ years of experience in functional verification. Knowledge of VLSI design flow and methodology, including HDL/HVL SystemVerilog, Verilog, VHDL, SystemC Experience in front-end verification including RTL/TB coding, simulation debug Working experience on UVM Methodologies Knowledge of Low Power Design/Verification, Debug using Verdi is a plus Proficient in UNIX usage, shell/Perl/YAML scripting Strong communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to lead and coordinate discussions in a small group as well as present to larger groups At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Desired Skills And Experience BS in CS/EE with 7+ years of experience in functional verification. The candidate will be a member of the Customer Success Group which offers the industry leading RTL verification platform consisting of multiple technologies. RTL Simulation provides advanced, built-in technologies, including full-featured testbench, complete assertion support, a library of assertion checkers. Also including a comprehensive coverage and analysis, to enable smart verification of complex system-on-chip designs. The Verification IP (VIP) portfolio has complete line of behavioral models, checkers and suite of compliance tests for advanced on-chip protocols. The Formal Verification platform offers static and formal methods that are the best in class. These combined with Hardware Assisted Verification and Emulation Systems create the Synopsys' Verification Platform.
